17.5 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18.5 cm; 26 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (5 quires).

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some corrections on the margins; the phrases of 'Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Saʻd ʻalá matn al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah' are preceded by the word 'Qawluhu' (His statement) in red; catchwords.
Text: Folios 1a-42a; folios 43-46 are blank.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Taqyīdāt ʻalá sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Saʻd ʻalá matn al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah jamaʻtuhā min taqrīr Shaykhinā al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī ḥāla al-dars. Tamm." "Jāmiʻuhā al-faqīr Muḥammad ʻArafah al-Dasūqī al-Mālikī al-Burhānī." "Yaqūlu kātibuhu: Hādhihi ṣūrat mā katabahu al-muʼallif wa-huwa al-ʻAllāmah al-Dasūqī ʻalá nuskhatihi allatī bi-khaṭṭihi wa-innamā athbattuhu ʻalá hādhihi al-nuskhah bi-hādhihi al-ʻibārah muḥāfaẓatan ʻalá ittibāʻ nuskhat al-muʼallif al-maktūb ʻalayhā dhālika, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi fī al-dārayn. Āmīn."

Colophon: Colophon missing; text ends abruptly with: "wa-mithl dhālika yuqālu fī al-mashmūm, fa-al-rāʼiḥah al-qāʼimah bi-al-misk laysat hiya al-mashmūmah bal al-mashmūm rāʼiḥah ukhrá khalaqahā Allāh taʻālá qāʼimah bi-al-hawá [bi-al-hawāʼ] bi-sabab mujāwarat al-hawá [al-hawāʼ] lil-jurm dhī al-rāʼiḥah. Qawluhu 'wa-huwa qūwah mūdaʻah fī al-ʻuṣbatayn' ..."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Aḥmad al-Shaʻrānī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Min mumidd al-kawn astamiddu al-ʻawn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-ashhadu an lā ilāh illā Allāh al-malik al-ḥaqq al-mubīn, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluhu sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākharīn. Allāhumma ṣalli wa-sallam ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá sāyir al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihim wa-ṣaḥbihim ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi qawāʻid ʻaẓīmah yaḥtāju ilayhā kull faqīh intakhabtuhā min kitāb al-Qawāʻid lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-Shaykh Badr al-Dīn al-Zarkashī raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, fa-man raʼá fī hādhihi al-qawāʻid khaṭaʼan aw taḥrīfan fa-li-yurājiʻ aṣlahu, fa-rubbamā yakūnu dhālika min sūʼ fahmī, wa-Allāh fī ʻawn al-ʻabd mā kāna al-ʻabd fī ʻawn akhīh, wa-rattabtuhā tibʻan li-aṣlihā ʻalá ḥurūf al-muʻjam tasʹhīlan lil-ṭālib ..."
Secundo folio: tanqīḥ al-adhhān al-rābiʻ al-mughālaṭāt.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 15.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some wormholes on the margins without loss of text; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Mukhtaṣar Kitāb Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī lil-Shaʻrāwī taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi. Āmīn." "Mukhtaṣar Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī."

On folio 1a ownership statements as follows: "Mālikuhu Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Anṣārī al-Ḥusaynī." "Fī silk mulk Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Anṣārī al-Ḥusaynī al-Qādirī al-Ḥawālikī ʻufiya ʻanh." "Mālikuhu kātibuhu Abū al-Isʻād ʻufiya ʻanh." "Thumma ṣāra fī nawbat al-faqīr Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Anṣārī al-Ḥusaynī al-Qādirī." "Ṣār fī mulk al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Jawwād ibn al-faqīr Shuʻayb al-Shāfiʻī al-Anṣārī fī awākhir Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-Ḥarām sanat 1019 [13 February, 1611]." "al-Faqīr Aḥmad Abū al-Mawāhib ibn al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Jawwād Shuʻayb al-Shāfiʻī al-Anṣārī [...?]." "Thumma min baʻdihi ṣār fī silk mulk Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Qādirī [... ...?]." "Faded seal".

On folio 1a: "Wa-fīhi 'Kitāb al-Ishārah ilá sīrat Rasūl Allāh' ... muʼallifuhu al-Shaykh ʻAlāy al-Dīn al-Maṣlaṭāy ..." (Probably: "al-Ishārah ilá sīrat al-Muṣṭafá wa-tārīkh man baʻdahu min al-khulafāʼ" / by ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn Mughalṭāy ibn Qalīj, 1290 or 1291-1360 or 1361).
On folio 37b eight verses of poetry praising al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-Shaʻrānī and giving the date of his death on Monday, 3 Jumād al-Awwal, 973 (6 December, 1665) by his son ʻAbd al-Raḥmān.

Colophon: "Wa-li-yakun dhālika ākhir al-qawāʻid al-muntakhabah min Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī, raḥimahu Allāh ... Wa-kāna farāghī min taʼlīfihi bi-tārīkh sābiʻ ʻashar Dhī al-Ḥijjah sanat 1011 [28 May, 1603] wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Yaqūlu kātibuhu al-faqīr Shuʻayb ibn Aḥmad: Katabtu hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah min nuskhah saqīmah jiddan, fa-taḥtāju hādhihi ilá al-muqābalah, wa-al-aṣl al-manqūl minhu yaḥtāj ilá dhālika min bāb awlá wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻalī al-ʻaẓī ..."

Translation of the colophon: "Let this be the end of the rules selected from Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī [The Rules of al-Zarkashī], may God have mercy upon him ... I finished writing it on 17 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1011 [28 May, 1603]. Praise be to God alone, and prayer be upon Him, who no prophet comes after Him. The copyist of the manuscript, the poor Shuʻayb ibn Aḥmad, says: I copied this blessed treatise from a very bad copy which needs to be collated, let alone the original source from which it was copied. There is no power nor might except in God the Sublime, the All Mighty ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Maqāmāt al-Ḥarīrīyah : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥarīrī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ajall al-awḥad Abū Muḥammad al-Qāsim ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān al-Ḥarīrī al-Baṣrī, barrada Allāh maḍjaʻahu: Allāhumma innā naḥmaduka ʻalá mā ʻallamta min al-bayān wa-alhamta min al-tibyān kamā naḥmaduka ʻalá mā asbaghta min al-ʻaṭāʼ wa-asbalta min al-ghiṭāʼ wa-naʻūdhu bi-ka min shirrat al-lasn wa-fuḍūl al-hadhī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-lā nurhaqa bi-tabaʻatin wa-lā maʻtabah.
21 x 32 cm; written surface: 16.5 x 26.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In red leather binding with flap; central and corner medallions on cover and flap (in 16 numbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; extensive commentaries and notes on the margins and interlinear; some wormholes; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Maqāmāt al-Ḥarīrīyah fī al-mawāʻiẓ wa-al-ādāb wa-al-aḍāḥīk wa-al-aḥājī. Ṣāḥibuhā wa-mālikuhā al-faqīr Baḥr Aḥmad, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. A.M.Y.N. [Āmīn])

On folio 1a: Two verses of poetry attributed to Jār Allāh al-Zamakhsharī (Zamakhsharī, Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar, 1075-1144) praising al-Ḥarīrī and his Maqāmāt: "Uqsimu billāh wa-āyātihi // wa-mashʻar al-ḥajji wa-mīqātihi. Anna al-Ḥarīrīya ḥarrīyun bi-an // taktuba bi-al-tibri Maqāmātihi."
Colophon: "Qad tammat Maqāmāt al-Ḥarīrī bi-ʻawn Allāh al-ghanī."
Translation of the colophon: "The Maqāmāt of al-Ḥarīrī are concluded by the help of the rich God."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Amīr al-Kabīr ʻalá Sharḥ al-Samarqandīyah lil-Mullawī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamd al-ḥaqīqī laka minka yā ḥamīd yā majīd, fa-innamā majāz ḥamdinā takhyīl istiʻārah fī iṭlāq al-tajrīd, wa-rashshiḥ Allāhumma asrāranā bi-an taḍmura fī nufūsinā shuhūd waḥdatik al-aṣlīyah maʻa istiʻmālinā fī mursal tabʻīyat mursalika fī bayān al-ʻalāqāt al-marḍīyah, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallama wa-sharrafa wa-majjada wa-karram. Āmīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Miṣrī al-Azʹharī: Hādhā mā narjū Allāh taʻālá fīhi ʻalá sharḥ Shaykhinā wa-shaykh mashāyikhinā wa-mashāyikhihim al-ʻAllāmah al-Mullawī ʻalá al-istiʻārāt ..."
Secundo folio: li-tashbīhihā bi-irtibāṭ al-ilṣāq.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 18.5 cm; 24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 quires).
In medium size Maghribi script, in black ink, on white paper; some markings in red; the statements of al-Mullawī are preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (his statement) in red; catchwords.

The manuscript is wrapped in an issue of "al-Ādāb" Egyptian weekly periodical (ʻadad 94, yawm al-Ithnayn, 26 Ṣafar, sanat 1307 - 21 Uktūbir, sanat 1889, al-sanah al-thālithah). On the last page of the issue (page 472) is written in pencil the name of "Muḥammad Ramaḍān al-Madanī al-Kutubī" who seems to be the manuscripts dealer.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-baḥr al-fahhāmah farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-waḥīd dahrihi Sayyidinā wa-shaykh mashāyikhinā Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Miṣrī ʻalá al-Mullawī al-Ṣaghīr fī al-istiʻārāt."
Text: Folios 1b-21b; folios 22-24 are blank.

Colophon: "Intahat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnihi wa-tawfīqihi ʻalá yad kātibihi bi-nafsihi ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭarābulusī [... ... ...] tāba Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn fī ṣabīḥat yawm al-Jumʻah sanat [ithnatayn] wa-khamsīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf. ʻĀm 1252."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy is ended by the praise of God and his abundant help and benevolence, by the handwriting of the copyist ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭarābulusī [... ... ...] for himself, may God forgive him and all Muslims. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. On Friday morning, the year 1252."

record.title: 880-03 al-Risālah al-Qushayrīyah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Hawāzin al-Qushayrī.
record.note: Title from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tafarrada bi-jalāl malakūtih wa-tawaḥḥada bi-jamāl jabarūtih wa-taʻazzaza bi-ʻulū aḥadīyatih wa-taqaddasa bi-sumū ṣamadīyatih wa-takabbara fī dhātih ʻan muḍāraʻat kull naẓīr wa-tanazzaha fī ṣifātih ʻan kull tanāhin wa-quṣūr ..."
Secundo folio: wa-aqnaʻu wa-arḍá bi-mā yuʻṭī.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 18 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some keywords in red; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
Pages of the manuscript are numbered in Indian numerals: 1-138.

The manuscript is wrapped in an issue of the Egyptian newspaper "al-Ahrām": "Yawm al-Sabt, 2 Ughusṭus, sanat 1616 [1919], 5 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1337, 26 Abīb, sanat 1635, al-sanah al-khāmisah wa-al-arbaʻūn, al-ʻadad 12883."
On folio 1a: "Risālat al-Qushayrī." "Hādhihi Risālat al-Qushayrī."

Colophon: "Wa-hunā tamma mā waffaqa al-Jalīl bi-mannihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak 29 [tisʻah] wa-ʻishrīn maḍat min shahr al-Ḥijjah, khitām sanat wāḥid wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, sanat 1271 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Here ends what the Glorified One facilitated by His generosity and abundant benevolence, on blessed Tuesday, 29 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1271 of the Hijrah of the Prophet. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions. Amen."

record.title: Sir Harry Trelawny diary : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Dated on front cover: Augst. 17, Septembr 3d 1785.
Bound in original marbled paper wrappers.

record.title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-mutaʻāl ʻalá al-qaṣīdah al-musammāh bi-Lāmīyat al-afʻāl : manuscript / Ḥamad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣaʻīdī al-Mālikī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī wa-tawakkulī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá afḍālih wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salā[m] ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Wa-baʻd fa-yaqūlu aḥwaj al-ʻibād wa-akhfaḍ al-ʻabīd Ḥamad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣaʻīd[ī] al-Mālikī ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-ikhwānihi al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Hādhā taʻlīq laṭīf ʻalá manẓūmat al-Imām Abī ʻAbd Allāh Jamāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mālik al-Andalusī al-Jayyānī al-Naḥwī al-Lughawī al-Ṣarf[ī] iqtaṣartu fīhi ʻalá ḥall alfāẓihā wa-bayān murādihā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ishtaqqahu min wasam
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper with some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a: "lil-Shaykh Yūnus Khalīlī yukmilu la-hu."
Colophon: Colophon missing; text ends abruptly with "... aḍḍahu rammahu ay aṣlaḥ al-ʻamal. Intahá. Wa-lammā ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Jawhar al-maknūn fī ṣadaf al-thalāthat al-funūn : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh wasallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi. Qāla al-Shaykh al-faqīh, al-ʻallāmah al-nabīh, al-walī al-zāhid, al-almaʻī al-nāqid Abū Zayd Sayyid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Shaykh Sayyid Ṣaghīr, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-badīʻ al-hādī // ilá bayāni mahyaʻ al-rashādi ..."
Secundo folio: multaqiṭan min durar al-Talkhīṣi.
16 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 18 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 1 quire).
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
Text folios 1b-8b; folios 9 and 10 are blank.
Author's colophon: "Tamma bi-shahri al-Ḥijjati al-maymūni // mutammimi niṣfa ʻāshir al-qurūni. Abyātuhā tisʻūna baʻda miʼatayn // wa-zidʹhā wāḥidatan bi-dūni mayn."
Translation of the author's colophon: "It ended in the blessed month of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, at the end of the middle of the tenth century of al-Hijrah, in exactly two hundred and ninety one verses."

Copyist's colophon: "Kamula bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih wa-tawfīqih fī 23 Rabīʻ Awwal sanat 1266. Allāhumma yā ʻaẓīm al-minnah habb li-kātibihi al-Jannah. Allāhumma ikhtim la-nā bi-ḥusn al-khātimah wa-ikfinā sharra al-dunyā wa-ʻadhāb al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God and His abundant help and benevolence on 23 Rabīʻ Awwal, 1266 [6 February, 1850]. O God of great benevolence grant Paradise to the copyist. O God grant us the good end and deliver us from the evil of this world and the torment of the Hereafter."

record.title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Ilāhīyah bi-sharḥ baʻḍ al-awrād al-Bakrīyah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd al-Barr al-Wanāʼī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻalī al-ʻaẓīm dhī al-kamāl alladhī lā tudriku al-ʻuqūl minhu shayʼan wa-lā talmaḥu minhu lamḥatan wa-lā taḥtamilu al-afkār al-salīmah ẓuhūr athar min āthārih illā bi-imdād minhu wa-manḥih ... Wa-baʻd fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá mawlāh ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd al-Barr al-Ḥasanī al-Wanāʼī al-Shāfiʻī ... Hādhā sharḥ laṭīf ʻalá Awrād al-ṣabāḥ wa-al-masāʼ wa-al-ṣalawāt al-khams lil-Imām al-humām Sayyidī Muṣṭafá al-Bakrī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu, fa-innahā zād al-musāfir wa-bi-hā yakūnu al-murīd bi-āmālihi ẓāfir ..."
Secundo folio: al-Bakrī qaddasa Allāh sirrah.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 17 cm; 12 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair, rather large and thick naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Awrād al-ṣabāḥ wa-al-masāʼ wa-al-ṣalawāt al-khams" in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Minaḥ al-Ilāhīyah bi-sharḥ baʻḍ al-awrād al-Bakrīyah lil-ʻAllāmah al-Sayyid ʻAlī al-Wanāʼī al-Shāfiʻī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn."

On folio 2b: "Wa-sammaytuhu al-Minaḥ al-Ilāhīyah bi-sharḥ baʻḍ al-awrād al-Bakrīyah. Wa-qad rawaytuhā ʻan qudwatī fī al-ṭarīq al-Imām ʻalá al-taḥqīq al-Shihāb Aḥmad al-Dardīr ʻalayhi raḥmat al-ʻazīz al-qadīr wa-ʻan al-ʻumdah al-nāṣiḥ al-ʻallāmah al-ṣāliḥ Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn al-ʻallāmah Aḥmad Jumʻah al-Bujayrimī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-ghyrihimā."

The manuscript is wrapped in an issue of al-Ahrām Egyptian daily newspaper: "Yawm al-Thulāthāʼ, 29 Yūliyū, sanat 1919, 1 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1337, 22 Abīb, sanat 1635, al-sanah al-khāmisah wa-al-arbaʻūn, al-ʻadad 12879."

Author's colophon: "Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr kifāyah li-man ḥuffa bi-al-ʻināyah wa-ʻalayka bi-kutub al-aʼimmah taʻlam mā tafaḍḍala bi-hi al-ʻAẓīm al-Aʻẓam. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This amount is sufficient for those who are covered by [God's] providence. Thereafter, you need to read the books of the scholars that you may learn what the Mighty Great One has graciously bestowed [upon us]. May God pray on our master Muhammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. It is completed".

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī sharḥ qawlihi taʻālá Innamā yaʻmuru masājida Allāh : manuscript / ʻUmar ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭaḥlāwī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālih. Ḥamdan li-man naḍḍara wujūh ahl al-Ḥadīth wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman ʻalá khayr rasūl nazala ʻalayhi aḥsan al-Ḥadīth wa-ʻalá ālihi al-aʻlām wa-ṣaḥābatihi wa-dhurrīyatihi al-kirām mā ʻummirat fī al-arḍ masājid wa-taqarraba ilá Allāh rākiʻ wa-sājid. Rabbi waffiqnī fa-lā aʻdilu ʻan sunan al-sāʻīn fī khayr sanan. Wa-baʻd fa-yaqūlu afqar al-ʻibād li-raḥmat rabbihi yawm al-tanād ʻUmar ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭaḥlāwī al-Mālikī al-Azʹharī: Lammā anʻama Allāh ʻalayya bi-al-tawajjuh ilá al-diyār al-Rūmīyah wa-al-aʻtāb al-sharīfah al-Khāqānīyah sāḥat malik salāṭīn al-Islām Mawlānā al-Sulṭān rafīʻ al-majd wa-al-shān al-mughāzī fī sabīl Allāh Maḥmūd Khān ..."
Secundo folio: al-fasīḥ fa-lammā shāhadtu.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 1 quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah fī sharḥ qawlihi taʻālá Innamā yaʻmuru masājida Allāh taʼlīf al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh ʻUmar al-Ṭaḥlāwī al-Mālikī ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-lil-Muslimīn ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-ṣādafa tamām taʼlīf hādhihi al-risālah yawm al-Khamīs, thānī ʻashar Shaʻbān sanat 1147, alf wa-miʼah sabʻah wa-arbaʻīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Shabrāwī fī al-yawm al-thānī min al-thulth al-thālith min al-shahr al-khāmis min al-ʻām al-thāmin min al-ʻushr al-khāmis min al-qarn al-thānī ʻashar min Hijrat al-nabī al-ʻāqib ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "This epistle was completed on Thursday, the twelfth of Shaʻbān, the year 1147, one thousand one hundred and forty seven. It was copied by the poor and despised ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Shabrāwī on the second day of the third part of the fifth month of the eighth year of the fifth tenth of the twelfth century of the last Prophet, may prayer and peace be upon Him."

record.title: 880-02 al-Maqālah al-sanīyah li-dalāʼil al-ashkāl al-ramlīyah : manuscript / Abū ʻAbd Allāh al-Zinātī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qul lā yaʻlamu man fī al-samāwāt wa-al-arḍ al-ghayb illā Allāh. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-al-tābiʻīn la-hu bi-iḥsān ilá yawm al-dīn. Qāla al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Abū ʻAbd Allāh al-Zinātī ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu bi-mannihi wa-karamih: Iʻlam ayyuhā al-ṭālib li-ʻilm al-athar wa-mūḍiḥ al-khabar sa-ūḍiḥu laka ʻan kull marmūz wa-mustatir thumma wa-iʻlam anna ʻilm al-raml al-maʻrūf bi-ʻilm al-athar mā huwa illā ʻilm maʼthūr wa-bi-al-adillah al-muʻtamadah mashhūr ḥaythu mā khaṭṭahu al-amīn Jubrāyīl ʻalayhi al-salām li-Nabī Allāh Idrīs ..."
Secundo folio: huwa ʻilm mawḍūʻ ʻalá al-raml.
10.5 x 17 cm; written surface: 9 x 13.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; astrological and divination diagrams in black and red; catchwords.
On folio 2b: "Wa-sammaytuhā al-Maqālah al-sanīyah li-dalāʼil al-ashkāl al-ramlīyah."

Colophon: "Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr kifāyah wa-Allāh walī al-hidāyah wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-mabdaʼ wa-al-khitām wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. [Intahá] wa-tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This amount is sufficient. God is the lord of guidance. Praise be to God at the beginning and at the end. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. [It is finished] and completed."

record.title: 880-02 al-Aḥkām al-muhimmah fī shurūṭ Ahl al-Dhimmah : manuscript / Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Abū al-Hudá ʻAlamī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh munshiʼ saḥāb al-maʻrifah fī samāʼ al-adhhān wa-muṭliʻ shams al-ʻināyah min mashriq al-fahm wa-maṭlaʻ al-bayān wa-munawwir al-jawāriḥ bi-ṣifāt al-ʻibādah wa-anwār al-īmān, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh shahādata man waḥḥadahu ʻalá al-mushāhadah wa-al-ʻayān wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluhu al-mabʻūth lil-kāffah min ḍiʼḍiʼ Maʻadd ibn ʻAdnān, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-makhṣūṣīn bi-al-riḍwān ... fa-qaṣada al-Amīr al-kabīr Sayf al-Dīn al-Mahrānī al-muʻadd la-hum wa-al-muḥakkam fīhim al-muʻayyan bayna al-aʻyān an adhkura la-hu mā warada fī dhālika min al-shurūṭ li-yakūna ḥujjah ʻinda al-imtiḥān fa-istakhartu Allāh wa-jamaʻtuhu bi-ḥaythu lā yaṭʻanu fīhi insān wa-sammaytuhu al-Aḥkām al-muhimmah fī shurūṭ Ahl al-Dhimmah ..."
Secundo folio: al-Iskandarīyah ḥamāhu Allāh
16 x 21 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 16 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 1 quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "al-Aḥkām al-muhimmah fī shurūṭ Ahl al-Dhimmah takhrīj al-faqīr ilá Allāh subḥānahu wa-taʻālá al-Mawlá Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Abī al-Hudá ʻAlamī ḥam [ḥāmī] al-Sunnah, raḥimahu Allāh."
Text: Folios 1a-5b; folio 6 is blank.

On folio 5b, an anecdote about the thirteen "mamsūkhūn" (those transformed into animals and inanimate objects and the reasons for their transformation), quoted from Ḥashiyat al-ʻAlqamī (Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, 1492-1556) ʻalá al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr (of al-Suyūṭi, 1445-1505): al-Fīl (elephant), al-dubb (bear), al-khinzīr (pig), al-qird (monkey), al-jirrīth (eel), al-ḍabb (lizard), al-waṭwāṭ (bat), al-ʻaqrab (scorpion), al-Zuhrah (Venus), al-duʻmūṣ (tadpole), al-ʻankabūt (spider), al-arnab (rabbit), Suhayl (Canopus).
Colophon: Colophon missing; the author ends his work with: "... Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

record.title: 880-01 Ashkāl al-taʼsīs min Kitāb Iqlīdis : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-ṭāhirīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna jamāʻah min al-fuḍalāʼ wa-ṭāʼifah min al-aṣdiqāʼ iltamasū minnī risālah takūnu muqaddimah wa-ālah fī iqtināʼ barāhīn al-ʻulūm al-ḥisābīyah ka-al-aʻmāl al-jabrīyah wa-al-misāḥīyah wa-dhālika muʼassas ʻalá ashkāl al-taʼsīs min Kitāb Iqlīdis wa-hiya ashkāl sharīfah yabtanī ʻlayhā barāhīn al-handasīyāt wa-yantahī ilayhā masāʼil al-riyāḍīyāt ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-zāwiyah al-qāʼimah hiya.
12 x 20 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 13.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard.
In nastaʻlīq script, in black ink on white paper; keywords in red; geometrical diagrams in gold; some notes on the margins; some wormholes without loss of text; catchwords.
Text folios 1a-13a; folio 14 is blank.
On folio 1a: "Ashkāl al-taʼsīs."

Colophon: "Tamma al-Taʼsīs wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb fī awāʼil shahr Jumādá al-Ākhir sanat iḥdá wa-sabʻīn wa-alf [min hijrat] man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf."

Translation of the colophon: "The 'Taʼsīs' (Basis, Foundation) is completed at the beginning of Jumādá al-Ākhir, of the year 1071 [of the Hijrah] of Him to whom belongs glory and honor. God is more knowledgeable of what is right. To Him is the reference and returning."

record.title: 880-02 Faṣl al-khiṭāb fī uṣūl lughat al-Aʻrāb : manuscript / Nāṣīf ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Yāzijī al-Lubnānī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Fattāḥ. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ʻilmuhu yastaghriqu al-asmāʼ wa-al-afʻāl wa-bi-yadihi al-taṣrīf wa-al-salāmah wa-al-ṣiḥḥah wa-al-iʻlāl ḥamdan yuzlifunā ilayh yawma tablá al-sarāʼir wa-taẓhar al-ḍamāʼir. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā mukhtaṣar jaʻaltuhu ka-al-bāb fī qawāʻid al-taṣrīf wa-al-iʻrāb tastaʻīnu bi-hi al-ṭalabah al-aṣāghir ʻalá al-dukhūl ilá majlis al-akābir wa-qad sammaytuhu Faṣl al-khiṭāb fī uṣūl lughat al-Aʻrāb ..."
Secundo folio: al-Bāb al-awwal fī taṣrīf al-afʻāl.
17.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings in red; catchwords.
Text folios 3a-30b; folios 1-2, 31-36 are blank.
Pages are numbered 1-72.

Colophon: "Qāla al-faqīr ilayhi taʻālá Nāṣīf ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Yāzijī al-Lubnānī: Hādhā mā aradtu taʻlīqahu fī hādhā al-kitāb min uṣūl hādhihi al-ṣināʻah muqtaṣiran ʻalá dāniyāt al-quṭūf min al-muhimmāt al-muṭaridah dūna al-daqāʼiq wa-al-shawārid taqrīban li-fahm mā yuqraʼu minhu wa-ḥifẓ mā yufhamu ʻalá annī muʻtarifun bi-al-quṣūr ʻan istīfāʼ mā ḥarrarahu al-qawm fa-innī qad taṭaffaltu ʻalá faḍalāt min kalāmihim wa-ayna al-Thurayyā min yad al-mutanāwil. Intahá wa-Allāh aʻlam. M."

Translation of the colophon: "The poor to the Almighty Nāṣīf ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Yāzijī al-Lubnānī says: This is what I wanted to introduce in this book, regarding the fundamentals of this art. I have limited myself to the easiest and the straightforward of the most important, excluding the minute and the irregular, so that what is being read is easier to understand and what is comprehendible can be memorized. I admit that I did not present in detail what the authorities on the subject have written. I am no more than a parasite on the leftovers of their words. How can one reach Pleiades! It is completed. God is more knowledgeable."

record.title: 880-02 Ikmāl al-dīn wa-itmām al-niʻmah : manuscript / Abū Jaʻfar Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Ḥusayn ibn Mūsá ibn Bābawayh al-Qummī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi aʻin wa-waffiq ʻalá itmāmih. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wāḥid al-aḥad, al-fard al-ṣamad, al-qādir al-ʻalīm al-ḥakīm, taqaddasa wa-taʻālá ʻan ṣifāt al-makhlūqīn, dhī al-jalāl wa-al-ikrām wa-[...] wa-al-inʻām alladhī la-hu al-asmāʼ al-ḥusná wa-al-amthāl al-ʻulyā wa-al-ḥikmah al-bālighah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-qāla innahumā lan yaftariqā.
17.2 x 28 cm; written surface: 9 x 18.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In modern brown leather binding.

In clear and somewhat small naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; sometimes the headings are in large black script; about 100 leaves have some repair with some loss of text; extensive marginal notes in different hands; catchwords.
Text folios 1b-271a.
On preliminary leaf: The stamp of "Maktabat al-Ṭayyār al-Khāṣṣah - Baghdād. Taʼassasat 1947 M - 1366 H. al-ʻAdad 011. Muʼassisuhā Hāshim ʻAbd al-Bāqī al-Ṭayyār."
Author's name from folio 2a.

On folio 271a an ownership statement dated 1199 Hijrī (1784 or 1785): "Mimmā manna bi-hi al-Malik al-Jalīl ʻalá ʻabdihi al-ḍaʻīf al-dhalīl Mūsá ibn Sayyid ʻAlī ibn Sayyid Yūsuf ibn Kāẓim al-Mūsawī nasaban wa-al-Hīn Abzalī [?] nisbatan. Raḥima Allāh wālidayhi man laqāhu wa-rajjaʻahu ilá ṣāḥibihi, wa-laʻan Allāh man laqāhu wa-saraqahu wa-lam yurajjiʻhu ilá ṣāḥibihi wa-ḥarāmun ʻalayhi an yanẓura fīhi. Sanat tisʻah wa-tisʻīn wa-alf wa-miʼah [1199 (1784 or 1785)]."

Colophon: "Tammat. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-itmām wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-anām wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-muntakhabīn ilá yawm al-qiyām. Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh fī yawm al-Sabt muʼarrakhan 20 shahr Jumādá al-Thānī sanat 1034 fī Qaryat Hāndūkafarḥay [?] min maḍāfāt baldah muʻaẓẓamah [...?] ṣānahā Allāh taʻālá ʻan āfāt al-du[hū]r. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm. [Illegible seal]."

Translation of the colophon: "It is concluded. Praise be to God that it [the manuscript] is completed. May prayer and peace be upon the Master of the Nations [Prophet Muḥammad] and upon his family and chosen companions till Judgment Day. It was completed on Saturday, dated 20 Jumādá al-Thānī, the year 1034 [30 March, 1625] at the village of Hāndūkafarḥay [?], a dependency of the exalted town of [...?], may the Almighty God protect it from the calamities of time. Completed. Completed. Completed. [Illegible seal]."

record.title: 880-02 Irshād al-sārī fī sharḥ al-Bukhārī. Volume 2 : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Qasṭallānī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Incipit: Starts with "Bāb al-fitan. Bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-qūwatih bi-al-tanwīn yadhkuru fīhi qawlahu ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: 'Man aḥabba liqāʼ Allāh aḥabba Allāh liqāʼah' ..."
Secundo folio: innahu lam yuqbaḍ nabī.
22 x 30.8 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 22 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding; both covers embossed with central and corner medallions, edges heavily rubbed; some scuffing; flap missing; cover slightly soiled.

In clear and somewhat small naskh script, in black ink on white paper; with original text, headings, keywords and markings in red; numerous marginal notes; about a dozen leaves with marginal repairs with no loss of text; minor wormholes; catchwords.
Text folios 2a-441b.
On folio 1a in pencil: "Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr ibn ʻAbd al-Malik al-Qasṭallānī. al-Juzʼ al-thānī min irshād al-sārī fī Sharḥ al-Bukhārī.
Author's colophon: "... wa-qad faraghtu min taʼlīfihi wa-kitābatihi fī yawm al-Sabt sābiʻ ʻishrīn Rabīʻ al-Thānī sant ʻashrah wa-tisʻmiʼah ḥāmidan muṣalliyan musalliman."

Translation of the author's colophon: "... I finished the composition and writing of [the book] on Saturday, 27 of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, the year 916 [13 August, 1510], with praise, prayer and request from God to grant peace [for the Prophet Muḥammad]."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak fī shahr Shawwāl sanat thintayn wa-arbaʻīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá Allāh taʻālá Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Anshāṣī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The blessed book is completed by the praise of God, His help and abundant benevolence. The copying was concluded on blessed Wednesday in the month of Shawwal, the year 1042 of the Hijrah [April/May, 1730] by the hand of the poorest of the poor and the most needy to God, may He be praised, Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Anshāṣī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him and his parents and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Marāqī al-falāḥ : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭahṭāwī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ayyada al-sharīʻat bi-wurrāthihā wa-rafaʻa bi-him manārahā wa-basaṭa athāthahā wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad afḍal makhlūq wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-ʻālimīn bi-al-ḥuqūq. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi taqyīdāt laṭīfah li-Sharḥ Nūr al-īḍāḥ al-musammá bi-Marāq [bi-Marāqī] al-falāḥ, asʼalu Allāh tamāmahā wa-ḥusn ikhtitāmihā, jamaʻtuhā li-man huwa qāṣir mithlī rājiyan qabūlahā min Allāh al-walī al-ʻalī maʼkhūdhah mimmā katabahu al-marḥūm ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Afandī Ḥalawāt wa-min Sharḥ al-muʼallif al-kabīr wa-sharḥ al-Sayyid Muḥammad Abī al-Suʻūd, raḥima Allāh taʻālá al-jamīʻ ..."
Secundo folio: wa-law kāna mutaghayyiran muntinan.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 17 cm; 21 lines per page.

Binding: In modern Islamic style black leather binding with flap. The manuscript should have contained 54 numbered quires of 10 leaves each, however, only the first leaf of quire 1 is present, quire 2 is missing and quire 54 contains 8 leaves with nothing missing; all the quires are loose within the binding.

In clear naskh script, in black ink on glossy white paper; with keywords and markings in red; text within double red frame; many wormholes, mainly on the margins; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-mudaqqiq al-fahhāmah al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Ṭaḥṭāwī ʻalá Sharḥ Nūr al-īḍāḥ wa-najāt al-arwāḥ al-musammá bi-Marāq [bi-Marāqī] al-falāḥ lil-ʻallāmah faqīh al-ṭabʻ Ḥasan al-Shurunbulālī al-Ḥanafī."

Author's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhā yawm al-Jumʻah tāsiʻ shahr Shaʻbān al-mukarram qubayl al-zawāl alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1210, wa-qad ibtadaʼtuhā fī al-ʻām al-sābiq qabla naẓīr hādhā al-shahr bi-qalīl wa-ikhtaṭaftu kitābatahā fī ayyām al-biṭālāt al-mutakhallilah athnāʼ al-durūs. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The writing of the manuscript was concluded on Friday, the ninth of the honored month of Shaʻbān before sunset in the year 1210 Hijrī [18 February, 1796]. I started writing it last year shortly before the present month [i.e. the month of Rajab], having snatched the time for writing it intermittently during recesses between the teaching days. God is more knowledgeable."
Copyist's colophon: "Tammat kitābatuhā ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad al-Ṭahwīhī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-lil-Muslimīn wa-li-man daʻá la-hu bi-khayr. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy was concluded by the hand of the poor to God the Almighty, Muḥammad al-Ṭahwīhī, may God forgive him and the Muslims and those who invoke God on his behalf to be good to him."

record.title: 880-02 Marāqī al-falāḥ bi-imdād al-Fattāḥ sharḥ Nūr al-īḍāḥ wa-najāt al-arwāḥ : manuscript / Ḥasan ibn ʻAmmār al-Shurunbulālī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī sharrafa khulāṣat ʻibādihi bi-wirāthat ṣafwatih khayra ʻibādih wa-amaddahum bi-al-ʻināyah fa-aḥsanū li-dhātihi al-ʻibādah wa-ḥafiẓū sharīʻatahu wa-ballaghūhā ʻibādah ... Wa-baʻd fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-dhalīl al-rājī ʻafwa rabbihi al-jalīl Ḥasan ibn ʻAmmār ibn ʻAlī al-Shurunbulānī al-Ḥanafī ... Inna hādhā kitāb ṣaghīr ḥajmuhu ghazīr ʻilmuhu ... wa-sammaytuhu Marāqī al-falāḥ bi-imdād al-Fattāḥ sharḥ Nūr al-īḍāḥ wa-najāt al-arwāḥ."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ṭahārah bi-fatḥ al-Ṭāʼ.
15.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 14.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In modern black leather binding with flap.
The manuscript contains 22 numbered quires each of which contains 10 leaves, except quires 1, 8, 9, 21 and 22 which contain 8 leaves each, but the text is complete with nothing missing.
In clear naskh script, in black ink on glossy white paper; with keywords and markings in red; many wormholes, mainly on the margins, with some loss of text; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Nūr al-īḍāḥ wa-najāt al-arwāḥ lil-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah wa-al-baḥr al-fahhāmah shaykh mashāyikh al-Islām Sayyidī Ḥasan al-Shurunbulānī al-Ḥanafī taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān. Āmīn."
On folio 1a, a note by one of the readers of the manuscript: "Ṭālaʻ ʻAbd al-Wahhāb Ṣūfī fī hādhā al-kitāb sanat 1263 [1846/1847], fataḥa Allāh ʻalayhi. Āmīn."
The last three leaves are blank.

Colophon: "Katabahu li-nafsihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr wa-al-mudhnib al-ḥaqīr al-muqirr bi-al-taqṣīr al-rājī ʻafwa rabbihi al-qadīr Ḥasan Ḥubayshī al-Ḥanafī ʻāmalahu Allāh taʻālá bi-luṭfihi al-khafī wa-ajrāhu Allāh ʻalá ʻawāyid birrihi al-khafī ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Hilālī al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Ḥijāzī bi-Dimyāṭ, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-wālid wālidayh wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhi wa-li-man samiʻahu wa-li-man ṣaḥḥaḥa fīhi laḥnahu wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-riḍwān. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kitāb fī yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-arbaʻat ʻashar. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-qad tamma bi-khayr."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the poor servant, for himself, he who admits his sin and deficiency and hopes for the forgiveness of his Almighty God, Ḥasan Ḥubayshī al-Ḥanafī the son of the departed al-Ḥājj Hilālī al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Ḥijāzī, in Dimyāṭ [Damietta, Egypt], may God treat him according to His hidden kindness and lead him unto the paths of His hidden righteousness. May God forgive him, his parents and the father of his parents and those who read this book, those who listen to it, those who correct its mistakes, and those who invoke God to grant him [the copyist] mercy and acceptance. The copying of this book was completed on blessed Sunday [name of the month not mentioned] of the year 1114 [1703 or 1704]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. It is finished with success."

record.title: Order authorizing payment to Jonathan Forward for transporting convicts to the American plantations : manuscript / R. Walpole ; Charels Turner ; Richard Edgecombe.
record.note: In brown ink on cream laid paper.

record.title: [Psalter].
record.note: Copying of this book was completed on the 30th of Ḫedar.
Accompanied by ceremonial horsehair whisk.
Between wooden boards with four chain stitches. One column (ff.1r-143r); two columns (ff.143r-154v), 23 lines per page. In black and red ink. Mahdar case.

record.title: An inventory of the household furniture &c belonging to Mr. Stamford at the Scots Arms Little Hermitage Street taken & sold by appraisement to Mr. Willm. Finlay ..., the 31st of Jany. 1799 : manuscript.
record.note: Title from first line of text.
In original marbled wrapper.

record.title: [Magic scroll of spiritual healing].
record.note: Scroll on parchment, two columns, black and red ink.
The scroll was made for ወለተ ሩፋኤል.

record.title: [Synaxarium].
record.note: Ordered by Abba Mikaʼel and Abba Yohannes.
Volumes in wooden boards, with four chain stitches, three columns, 34-38 lines per page, in red and black ink.

V.1: Synaxarium for the first part of the year: F. 1r mentions the ones who ordered the book: Abba Mika’el, whose country is አትሪብ (in Egypt?), Abba Yohannes, whose country is ቡርልስ. F. 163v contains further information about the book; the two volumes of the Synaxarium were purchased by ገብረ ማርያም, with his own money for two ወቂት; the record also mentions other books he bought; thereafter, the record (continuing on f. 165r) mentions a list of purchased books owned by the church, 20 books in all, as well other church utensils and priestly garments, crosses; another record lists books given by other people with a curse on anyone who steals or erases; a final record, written in a different hand, lists more books and materials given to the church; f. 164v contains the name plate of Yale University Library, the Edwin J. Beinecke Fund

V.2: Synaxarium for the second part of the year: 1868–1913 (f. 61v mentions Emperor Menilek,1868–1913, and Governor Ras Hailu,1868–1950); f. 1r mentions the ones who ordered the book: Abba Mika’el, whose country is አትሪብ (in Egypt?), Abba Yohannes, whose country is ቡርልስ. 1. f. i r: owner plate: Yale University Library; The Edwin J. Beinecke Fund; 2. f. i v: Pen trial, written in trained hand; 3. f. ii r: An incomplete record, mentioning the dates Genbot 5, and 19, written in an untrained hand; 4. f. ii r, bottom: another incomplete record mentioning Miyazia 25 and 26, Sane 17 and Arias, the heretic, written in an untrained hand; 5. ff. 2v and 194v are blank. F. 44r has the name ወልደ ሰንባት, written into the blank, written in a different hand; f. 61v has a note of ownership in a different hand: This book belongs to the church, ዋሻ ሚካኤል during the time of Emperor Menilek (1868–1913) and Governor (Ras) Hailu (1858–1950), and Qängazmač Alemu, and church manager ቄሰ ገበዝ ተገኝ, and Märigeta ዛይህመ, church scholar, in the year of Evangelist Saint John, it was purchased. ቄሰ ገበዝ ተገኝ, whose baptismal name is ወልደ ተንሣኤ, is the one bought it as the property of the church ዋሻ ሚካኤል; it appears that the hand changes half way through f. 86v.

record.title: [Missal].
record.note: 1721–1726 (f. 1r mentions the 7,221st year of creation [=1721], and “the month of February (Yakatit) ... in the time of our King, Bakafa [1721–1730]; f. 19v mentions Abba Petros = Peter VI, 1718–1726, and Abba Krestodolu III, 1720–1735; the overlap between the three dates—king, Coptic Patriarch, and Ethiopian Abuna—is 1721–1726); the colophon itself mentions the eighth year of Bakafa’s reign, i.e., 1729.

Introductory colophon to the manuscript: "In the name of the Father and Son and Holy Spirit, one God. How we remember the calculation of the year of our Lord Jesus Christ since we are in the year of Matthew the Evangelist, may He keep us until the year of Mark (the Evangelist), in the 7,221st year of creation [=1721], since there is no epact for [the ringing of] its bell, the month of February (Yakatit), the fourth day and seventh night, in the time of our King, Bakafa [1721-1730], in the eighth year after he became king, this book was written." [Text is damaged.]
F. 19v mentions Abba Petros = Peter VI, 1718–1726, and Abba Krestodolu III, 1720–1735. The overlap between the three dates (King and Coptic Patriarch and Ethiopian Abuna) is 1721–1726.

In wooden boards, with four chain stitches, leather bound, two columns, 22-23 lines per page, black and red ink. Fine fabric is visible between the pastedowns of the front and back covers. Double slip mahdar.

record.title: [Code of kings].
record.note: Leather bound, perhaps in the West.
19th century (the note in the front suggests early-19th century when Henry Salt was in Adwa).

Notes: 1. f. i r(ecto): “[..lnyed?] to Henry Salt. Sent to him from Adwa by Nathaniel Pierce;” Inside front cover has an ownership plate of Yale University Library, gift of Thomas Ewart Marston, Yale [1927 (out of focus)]; f. 297v: note of completion and gifting of the book.

record.title: [150 Psalms of David].
record.note: Note of content: "Psalms of David, translated into Tigrê by Debtera Matheos at Adoa. Unrevised," with comments nearby in a different hand: "Henry Salt's writing; Sent to him from Adwa by Nathaniel Pearce."
Leather bound, one column, 19 lines, running header.
Foliated in the upper right recto.

record.title: [Acts of the Apostles, Epistles, and Revelation].
record.note: Note of content: "Acts, Epistles & Revelation, translated by Debtera Matheos into Tigrê. Unrevised", with comments nearby in a different hand: "Henry Salt's writing; Sent to him from Adwa by Nathaniel Pearce".
Leather bound, one column, 19-20 lines, running header.
Foliated in the upper right recto.

record.title: [The story of Mary and Ephrem and the composition of the Praises of Mary, gate of light, book of Mohammad Grañ, and image of Saint George zaSalédā Mogas].
record.note: : Notes: 1. F. ii r(ecto): A list of names of a leading judge and priest of the region of ዐፎሊ ምድር; there follows at least three more names of people; the names appear to be of Oromo people; 2. ff. 6r, 12v and passim, mention an owner ቅብዓ ሥላሲ. 3. f. 58r mentions another owner(?), ወልደ ማርያም; 4. f. 19r mentions the scribe, ገብረ ኪዳን; 5. frame 109v mention later owners(?) or family members, written in a later hand: ገብረ ማርያም, ወልደ ማርያም, ወልዳ ኢየሱስ.
With leather case.
One of the scribes was Gabre Kidān.
Between wooden boards, with four chain stitches, one column, 13 lines per page, in black and red ink.

record.title: John Ray annotations in Ausonius Popma's De usu antiquae locutionis libri duo : manuscript.
record.note: Ownership inscription on title page: Joannes Ray.
Note in John Ray's hand at top of title page (partially cut away): At Banks's auction. 16[79?]
Volume also contains annotations in a different, early sixteenth-century hand.
Binding: contemporary limp manuscript waste wrapper.

record.title: 880-03 Tafsīr Abī al-Saʻūd : al-musammá Irshād al-ʻaql al-salīm ilá mazāyā al-Kitāb al-Karīm : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Saʻūd.
record.note: Title from printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. 'Yā ayyuhā alladhīn āmanū awfū bi-al-ʻuqūd'. al-Wafāʼ al-qiyām bi-mūjib al-ʻaqd wa-kadhā al-īfāʼ. Wa-al-ʻaqd huwa al-ʻahd al-muwaththaq al-mushabbah bi-ʻaqd al-ḥabl wa-naḥwih. Wa-al-murād bi-al-ʻuqūd mā yaʻumm jamīʻ mā alzamahu Allāh taʻālá ʻibādahu wa-ʻaqadahu ʻalayhim min al-takālīf wa-al-aḥkām al-dīnīyah wa-mā yaʻqudūnahu fīmā baynahum min ʻuqūd al-amānāt wa-al-muʻāmalāt wa-naḥwihā mimmā yajibu al-wafāʼ bi-hi aw yaḥsunu dīnan bi-an yuḥmala al-amr ʻalá maʻnan yaʻummu al-wujūb wa-al-nadb ..."
Secundo folio: al-iṣṭiyād fī al-barr
18 x 27.2 cm; written surface: 10 x 18.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding (in 45 quires; some numbered). Covers embossed with beautiful central medallions.

In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink on glossy white paper; with markings in red; at the head of the text on folio 3b a decoration in gold and blue; some corrections on the margins; text within black and gold frames; catchwords.
Text folios 3b-446a; folios 1-2 are blank.
On the upper left corner of folio 2a: "al-Rubʻ al-thānī".

Colophon: Colophon missing; ends with: "... idh mā min amr dīnī illā wa-huwa yastanidu ilá al-Qurʼān bi-al-dhāt aw bi-wasaṭ, 'wa-hudan' min al-ḍalālah 'wa-raḥmah' yasʼalu bi-hā khayr al-dārayn 'li-qawmin yuʼminūn' ay yuṣaddiqūnahu li-annahum al-muntafiʻūn bi-hi, wa-ammā mā ʻadāhum fa-lā yahtadūna bi-hudāhu wa-lā yantafiʻūn bi-jadwāh. ʻAn Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: ʻAllimū ariqqāʼakum Sūrat Yūsuf fa-innahu ayyumā Muslim talāhā wa-ʻallamahā ahlahu wa-mā malakat yamīnuhu hawwana Allāh ʻalayhi sakarāt al-mawt wa-aʻṭāhu al-qūwata allā yaḥsuda Musliman."

record.title: 880-02 Multaqá al-abḥur : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥalabī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Multaqá al-abḥur. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waffaqanā lil-tafaqquh fī al-dīn alladhī huwa ḥabluhu al-matīn wa-faḍluhu al-mubīn wa-mīrāth al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn wa-ḥujjatuhu al-dāmighah ʻalá al-khalq ajmaʻīn wa-maḥajjatuhu al-sālikah ilá aʻlá ʻillīyīn ..."
Secundo folio: sahlah ghayr mughlaqah.
13.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 6 x 13.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding; flap missing.
In good medium naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; extensive commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1b-2a: "... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-muftaqir ilá raḥmat rabbih al-ghanī Ibrāhīm ibn Ḥamad [Muḥammad] ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ ṭālibī al-istifādah an ajmaʻa la-hu kitāban yashtamilu ʻalá masāʼil al-Qudūrī wa-al-Mukhtār wa-al-Kanz wa-al-Wiqāyah bi-ʻibārah sahlah ghayr mughlaqah fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik wa-aḍaftu ilayhi baʻḍ mā yuḥtāju ilayhi min masāʼil al-Majmaʻ wa-nubdhah min al-Hidāyah wa-ṣarraḥtu bi-dhikr al-khilāf bayna aʼimmatinā al-ashrāf ... sammaytuhu Multaqá al-abḥur li-yuwāfiq al-ism al-musammá ..."

On folio 179a an endowment statement as follows: "Waqaftu waqfan ṣaḥīḥan sharʻīyan bi-marḍāt Allāh taʻālá bi-sharṭ an lā yubāʻa wa-lā yurhana wa-lā yubaddala, fa-man baddalahu baʻdmā samiʻahu fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá allahīna yubaddilūnahu. Inna Allāha samīʻ ʻalīm. Wa-anā al-faqīr Ḥāfiẓ Ibrāhīm, sākin ʻalá Aghā ʻAlī al-faqīr Mullā ʻAbd al-Majīd sākin Qājardhādah bi-madrasatihi. [Seal]. Ibrāhīm Shihāb al-Dīn."

Author's colophon: "Qāla al-faqīr: Hādhā ākhir Multaqá al-abḥur ... wa-Allāh ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-qad tamma tabyīḍuhu bayna al-ṣalātayn min yawm al-Thulāthāʼ thālith ʻashar min Rajab al-muʻaẓẓam, sanat thalāth wa-ʻishrīn wa-tisʻi miʼah ʻalá yad al-faqīr Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn wa-ʻalá al-tābiʻīn la-hum bi-iḥsān ilá yawm al-dīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The poor one said: This is the end of Multaqá al-abḥur ... God suffices me. He is the best advocate. It was completed between the two prayers, on Tuesday, the thirteenth of the sublime month of Rajab, the year nine hundred and twenty three by the hand of the poor Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥalabī. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions and those who follow them faithfully until Judgement Day."

Copyist's colophon: "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah li-Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf Bilāl ibn Muḥammad, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-ikhwatihi wa-li-akhawātihi wa-aḥsana ilayhā [ilayhim] wa-ilayhi. Tamm."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The honorable copy of Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī was completed by the hand of the feeble servant Bilāl ibn Muḥammad, may God forgive him, his parents, his brothers and his sisters, and treat them and him with kindness. It is completed."

record.title: John Hardman & Co. album of stained glass designs.
record.note: Bound in quarter green cloth, with brass and copper buckles and leather straps.

record.title: 880-03 al-Tabṣirah : manuscript / Abū al-Faraj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Jawzī.
record.note: Title from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. [al-Ḥamdu] lillāh fāliq al-ḥabb wa-al-nawá wa-sāmiʻ mā khafá wa-khāliq al-ʻabd wa-mā nawá wa-ʻālim mā khafiya, al-muṭṭalaiʻ ʻalá bāṭin al-ḍamīr wa-mā ḥawāhu min al-kadar wa-al-ṣafā, bi-mashīʼatihi rashada man rashad, wa-ghawá man ghawá bi-irādatih wa-jafā. Ikhtāra Muḥammadan, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻalá sāʼir al-khalāʼiq wa-jaʻalahu musharrafan wa-asrá bi-hi min al-Masjid al-Ḥarām ilá al-Masjid al-Aqṣá fa-kāna dhālika la-hu fakhran wa-sharafan, fa-urkiba al-Burāq wa-ʻurrija bi-hi ilá al-sabʻ al-ṭibāq ..."
Secundo folio: Qum yā ghafūlan ʻan wiṣāl ḥabībihi.
17.5 x 26.5 cm; written surface: 13.5 x 22.5 cm; 23-24 lines per page.
Binding: In loose marbled cardboard binding.

In fair naskh script, in black ink on white aging paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; on the margins of some leaves are inscribed the words "waqf" (endowment); catchwords.

The text is preceded by a partial table of contents. Starts with chapter 6 "Majlis fī dhikr ziyārt qabr al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻlayhi wa-sallam", and ends with chapter 42 "Majlis fī dhikr al-faraj baʻda al-shiddah."
Folios 177b-178b contain invocations and anicdotes.

Colophon: "... Wa-wāfaq al-farāgh min taʻlīq hādhihi al-waraqāt fī salkh Rabīʻ al-Ākhir al-mubārak [four illegible words]. ʻAllaqahā li-nafsihi wa-liman shāʼa Allāh taʻālá min baʻdihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá raḥmat rabbihi al-ghanī ʻAlī ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥaydar, ḥāmidan wa-muḥassiban wa-muḥawqilan wa-muṣalliyan wa-musalliman." Followed by seven lines of invocations.

Translation of the colophon: "... These leaves were completed at the end of the blessed Rabīʻ al-Ākhir [four illegible words]. Copied by the poor to the mercy of his rich Lord ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥaydar, uttering the invocations of 'Ḥamdalah, Ḥasbalah, Ḥawqalah and Prayer and Peace [upon the Prophet Muḥammad]". Followed by seven lines of invocations.

record.title: Selections from the Qurʼan : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Starts with: "Wa-mā ubarriʼu nafsī inna al-nafsa la-ammāratun bi-al-sūʼ ..."
Secundo folio: Rabbī ghafūrun raḥīm.
19 x 27.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 16 cm; 5 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; covers embossed with central medallions and borders are embossed in floral designs; a little worn; slight smudging.

In beautiful large Arabic script (Chinese style), in black ink on white paper; text vocalized throughout, with recitation marks in red; all headings of the chapters are written in red; the opening two chapters are illuminated in gold, blue; green, red and other colors; the last page is also illuminated in green, gold, brown and other colors; text within double red frames; some pages are repaired with glued pieces of paper from modern Chinese publications; catchwords.
On folio 63 an attempt to practice copying part of verse 5 of Sūrat al-Raʻd.
On folio 63b an inscription in classical Chinese.
Ends with: "Hādhā balāghun lil-nās wa-li-yundharū bi-hi wa-li-yaʻlamū annamā huwa ilāhun wāḥidun wa-li-yadhdhakkara ulū al-albāb." "Ṣadaqa Allāh al-ʻAẓīm."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kitābān al-rābiʻ wa-al-khāmis min al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb : manuscript / Ibn Sīnā.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Fī al-amrāḍ allatī lā takhtaṣṣu bi-ʻuḍw dūna ʻuḍw. al-Kitāb al-rābiʻ min al-Qānūn. Kalām kullī fī al-ḥummīyāt wa-huwa sabʻat funūn ..."
Secundo folio: al-ḥammāmāt fa-yuḥammī judrānah.
16.5 x 30.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 22.5 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: In modern dark brown leather binding with flap; spine and flap embossed with central medallions; covers embossed corner decorations.

In good medium naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings and keywords in red; text within frames in red, blue and gold; many wormholes, mostly on the margins; some corrections and notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Kitāb al-rābiʻ min al-Qānūn lil-Shaykh al-Raʼīs Abī ʻAlī ibn Sīnā, raḥimahu Allāh, wa-yalīhi al-kitāb al-khāmis minhu wa-huwa al-Aqrābādhīn."

On folio 156b: "Fa-hādhā ākhir kitāb [...?] wa-huwa ākhir al-kalām min kitāb [al-kitāb] al-rābiʻ wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh shukran kathīran. Wa-yatlūhu kitāb [al-kitāb] al-khāmis fī al-anqrābādīn. Tammat al-jild al-rābiʻ min al-Qānūn [... ... ... ...] Allāh sākin Kashmar, ghafara Allāh [la-hu] wa-li-wālidayh. 14."
On folio 157a: "al-Kitāb al-khāmis min al-Qānūn lil-Shaykh al-Raʼīs Abī ʻAlī ibn Sīnā, raḥimahu Allāh, wa-huwa akhir al-kutub minhu."

On folio 157b: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir wa-tammim bi-al-khayr. al-Kitāb al-khāmis min kutub al-Qānūn wa-huwa al-Aqrābādīn. Laqad faraghnā min al-kitāb al-arbaʻah ʻan dhikr al-ʻilam al-naẓarī wa-al-ʻamalī al-ḥāfiẓ lil-ṣiḥḥah wa-ḥāna la-nā an nakhtuma kitāb al-Qānūn, al-kitāb al-khāmis, al-muṣannaf fī al-adwiyah al-murakkabah, li-yakūna kamā al-qarābādīn lil-kitāb ..."

Colophon: "Tamma kitāb al-Aqrābādīn bi-tamāmih min kitāb al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb lil-Shaykh al-Raʼīs wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá dhālika ḥamdan lā ghāyah la-hā wa-ṣallá [Allāh ʻalá] al-Nabī al-Hāshimī Abṭaḥī [al-Abṭaḥī] wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ṣalātan lā mithla la-hā. Ḥarrarahu wa-fī sanat thamāniyat ʻashar."

Translation of the colophon: "The book of al-Aqrābādīn of al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb [Canon of medicine] of the Grand Master [Avicenna] is completed in its entirety. Praise be to God for this without end. May God pray on the Hashimite and Abṭaḥite Prophet [Muḥammad] and his family and companions, a prayer without equal. Copied in the year eighteen."

record.title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-ṭullāb bi-sharḥ Taḥrīr tanqīḥ al-Lubāb : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā qāḍī al-quḍāh, shaykh mashāyikh al-Islām, malik al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām, Sibawayh zamānih, farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-awānih, Zayn al-Dīn, lisān al-mutakallimīn, ḥujjat al-munāẓirīn, muḥyī sunnat Sayyid al-Mursalīn, Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-nafaʻanā wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakatih ... wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ ʻalá mukhtaṣarī al-musammá bi-Taḥrīr tanqīḥ al-Lubāb fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-mujtahid al-Shāfiʻī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, yaḥullu alfāẓahu wa-yubayyinu murādahu wa-yuḥaqqiqu masāʼilahu wa-yuḥarriru dalāyilahu, wa-sammaytuhu Tuḥfat al-ṭullāb bi-sharḥ taḥrīr tanqīḥ al-Lubāb. Wa-Allāh al-karīm asʼalu an yajʻalahu khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm ..."
Secundo folio: bi-jannāt al-naʻīm.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; covers and flap embossed with central medallions.
In clear naskh script, in black ink on white paper; with the phrases of Taḥrīr Tanqīḥ al-Lubāb in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Katabahu al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Ṭībī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban li-nafsihi wa-li-man shāʼa min baʻdihi, rājiyan min Allāh al-thawāb al-jazīl min al-Malik al-Jalīl, wa-dhālika yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, sādis ʻishrīn shahr Ṣafar al-Khayr, min shuhūr sanat 1152, alf wa-miʼah ithnayn wa-khamsīn baʻda al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the poor Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Ṭībī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban for himself and for whomever he wills after him, requesting from God, the Majestic King, to grant him abundant reward, on blessed Wednesday, the twenty sixth of Ṣafar, 1152 [4 June, 1739] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and the most perfect of peace be upon him."

record.title: Islamic prayers, invocations and decorations : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Incipit: The first leaf seems to be missing.
Secundo folio: al-rāfiʻ al-muʻizz al-mudhill.
12 x 19 cm; written surface: 6 x 10 cm; lines per page vary.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; covers richly gilt with central medallion on both sides and corners decorations; edges slightly rubbed.
In large and beautiful naskh or thulth scripts, in black ink on thin white paper; with headings in white ink on gold background; catchwords.
Colophon: Last page seems to be missing; ends with a magic square and the katchword "barkamsah".

record.title: 880-02 al-Durrah al-muḍīʼah fī qirāʼāt al-aʼimmah al-thalāthah al-marḍīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī.
record.note: Title from published version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Quli al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waḥdahu ʻalá // wa-majjidhu wa-isʼal ʻawnahu wa-tawassalā ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-in kilmatun aṭlaqtu.
12.5 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 12 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap; central medallion and floral design decorations and gold frames on both covers.
In clear naskh script, in black ink on white glossy paper; with keywords and markings in red; the opening page is nicely illuminated in gold and colors; text vocalized throughout; catchwords.
On the upper left corner of folio 1a in pencil: "Durrah fī al-ʻashrah."
Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Sanat 1209. Sanat 1209."
Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of the Benevolent King. The year 1209. The year 1209."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥawāshin ʻalá mawāḍiʻ min Sharḥ Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh, fa-hādhihi Ḥawāshin ʻalá mawāḍiʻ min Sharḥ Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī lil-ʻAllāmah al-Taftāzānī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahumā arjū an yaʻumma nafʻuhā wa-yaʻẓuma waqʻuhā, innahu huwa al-maʼmūl wa-muḥaqqiq kull masʼūl ..."
Secundo folio: al-kalām wa-aḥwāluhu al-muqtaḍabah.
18.5 x 25 cm; written surface: 8 x 13.5 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding; central design on both covers; edges rubbed, rebacked, some edges repaired; some staining (mainly marginal), some paper edges repair.

In clear ruqʻah script, in brown ink on white paper; with headings, keywords and markings in red, some of the headings are written in larger script in red or black ink on the margins; numerous notes on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.

On folio 2b: "Fa-hādhihi Ḥawāshin ʻalá mawāḍiʻ min Sharḥ taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī lil-ʻAllāmah al-Taftāzānī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahumā, arjū an yaʻumma nafʻuhā wa-yaʻẓuma wa-qʻuhā, innahu huwa al-maʼmūl wa-muḥaqqiq kull masʼūl ..."
At the head of the colophon: "Fī shahr Shawwāl."

On the margin of folio 150a: "Hādhā ākhir al-ḥawāshī allatī katabahā Aḥmad ibn Qāsim al-ʻAbbādī, aʻlá Allāh darajatahu wa-razaqanā Allāh taʻālá khayr al-dārayn bi-barakatihi ʻalá ḥāshiyat Shaykhihi al-ʻAllāmah al-Imām Nāṣir al-Dīn al-Laqānī al-Mālikī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻāmalahu muʻāmalat awliyāʼihi. Āmīn thumma āmīn, yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. M.M.M. Qad waqaʻa taswīd hādhihi al-ḥawāshī ʻalá yad al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr al-mutawaghghil bi-al-dhanb al-kathīr al-mutamassik bi-ʻafw Allāh al-malik al-qadīr, al-mutafāʼil wa-al-rājī min al-Mutaʻālī al-Kabīr fī al-dunyā al-ʻilm wa-al-ʻamal bi-hi wa-al-taysīr wa-fī al-ʻuqbá ʻadam al-muʼākhadhah bi-al-fiʻla al-qalīl wa-al-kathīr bi-jāh khātim al-rusl al-bashīr al-nadhīr Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh al-kabīr."

Colophon: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waffaqanī ʻalá al-tamām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi sayyid al-anām wa-ʻalá ālihi alladhīna kānū lil-dīn ka-al-aʻlām wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna qatalū al-kafarah wa-badaʼū al-Islām. Qad tammat al-ḥāshiyah al-musammāh bi-al-Miṣrī al-wāqiʻah ʻalá Saʻd al-Dīn lil-ʻAllāmah al-thānī al-muḥaqqiq al-Taftāzānī, quddisa sirruhu, ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād wa-aḍall sabīl al-rashād Muḥyī al-Dīn -- al-mansūb ilá Shīrawān nāḥiyatan wa-ilá Farsā qaryatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. Fī yawm al-Sabt waqta al-ʻaṣr. Ibtadaytuhu wa-fī yawm al-Aḥad qabla al-ʻaṣr atmamtuhu -- ibn al-Ḥājjī al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Khālidī al-Naqshabanidī al-Farsāfī, fī sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-tisʻīn wa-sanatayn min Hijrah [al-Hijrah] al-Nabawīyah al-Muṣṭafawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-akmal taḥīyah min jānib Rabb al-Barīyah fī [kull] waqt wa-sāʻah ilá abad al-abadīyah. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God who enabled me to complete [the copying of the manuscript], and prayer and peace be upon His Messenger, the master of the nations, and upon his family who were for the faith like banners, and upon his companions who killed the infidels and started Islam. The marginalia titled "al-Miṣrī" [i.e. by the "Egyptian" author Ibn Qāsim al-ʻAbbādī] on the work of Saʻd al-Dīn, the second scholar, the learned al-Taftāzānī, may his secret be sanctified, by the hand of the feeblest slave who has strayed from the guided path, Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-Ḥājjī al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Khālidī al-Naqshabanidī al-Farsāfī, who is from the region of Shīrawān [probably Shirvān (Irān)], from the village of Farsā. May God forgive him and his parents and be kind to them and to him. I started the copying on the afternoon of Saturday and finished it before the afternoon of Sunday, in the year one thousand two hundred ninety two of the Hijrah of the Prophet Muḥammad, may the best of prayer and most perfect of peace be upon him from the Lord of Creation at every time and every hour for ever and ever. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 al-Taʻrīfāt : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of al-Taʻrīfāt: "Rabbi yassir wa-lā tuʻassir. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥaqqa ḥamdih wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr khalqih Muḥammad wa-ālih. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi taʻrīfāt jamaʻtuhā wa-iṣṭilāḥāt akhadhtuhā min kutub al-qawm wa-rattabtuhā ʻalá ḥurūf al-hijāʼ min al-Alif wa-al-Bāʼ ilá al-Yāʼ tasʹhīlan tanāwuluhā lil-ṭālibīn wa-tasīyan [wa-taysīran] taʻāṭīhā lil-rāghibīn wa-Allāh al-hādī wa-ʻalayhi iʻtimādī fī mabdaʼī wa-maʻādī. Bāb al-Alif faṣl al-Bāʼ ..."
Secundo folio of al-Taʻrīfāt: al-Ibtilāʻ ʻibārah ʻan ʻamal.
Incipit of Abwāb al-taṣrīf: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Iʻlam anna abwāb al-taṣrīf khamsah wa-thalāthūn bāban, sittah minhā lil-thulāthī al-mujarrad ..."
Secundo folio of Abwāb al-taṣrīf: an yakūna ʻayn fiʻlihi.

Incipit of List of the irregular feminine words in Arabic: "Rabbi yassir. Wa-maʻrifat al-muʼannath al-samāʻīyah mutaʻassirah wa-ṭarīq maʻrifatihā tatbaʻ naql kalām al-ʻArab, wa-tatabbuʻ kull kalām al-ʻArab mutaʻassir ʻalá al-akthar, wa-naḥnu nadhkuru hāhunā al-muʼannath al-samāʻīyah bi-ḥaythu lā yabqá illā nadiran, wa-nurattibu awāʼilahā ʻalá tartīb ḥurūf al-hijāʼ ..."
Secundo folio of List of the irregular feminine words in Arabic: khayl, khamr wa-jamīʻ asmāʼ al-khamr.
12 x 21.2 cm; written surface: 6.7 x 13.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap; covers embossed with central medallion.
In fair, rather small naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink on thin white and yellow paper; headings and keywords in red; extensive commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a in pencil: "Taʻrīfāt-i Sayyid."
Text of al-Taʻrīfāt folios 3b-83.

Colophon of al-Taʻrīfāt: "Qad tamma al-kitāb. Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min taḥrīr al-kitāb sanat 1112. Wa-yawm al-Ithnayn tammat al-kitāb al-musammá bi-Taʻrīfāt al-Sayyid al-Sharīf bi-ʻawn Allāh al-malik al-wahhāb min yad al-ḍaʻīf al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Sayyid Ismāʻīl ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh. M.M.M."

Translation of the colophon of al-Taʻrīfāt: "The book is concluded. The copying of the book was completed in the year 1112. On Monday the copying of the book "Taʻrīfāt al-Sayyid al-Sharīf" was ended by the hand of the feeble al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Sayyid Ismāʻīl, may God forgive him and his parents."
Colophon of Abwāb al-taṣrīf: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-malik wahhāb [al-wahhāb] fī Arzanah-ʼi Rūm sanat 1109. M.M.M."
Translation of the colophon of Abwāb al-taṣrīf: "The book is completed by the help of God the King who gives abundantly, in Arzanah-ʼi Rūm, the year 1109."

List of the irregular feminine words in Arabic ends with: "... wa-al-ḥurūf al-maʻnawīyah naḥwa fī wa-ʻalá wa-ashbāhuhumā kulluhā muʼannath samāʻīyah. Nuqila min Maẓhar, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh. Tammat."

record.title: Songs, sonnets and short poems written for and dedicated to Allen Field / by Robert Edwd. Murray Coppinger.
record.note: Bound in full black morocco, with gilt lettering and decoration to covers and spine. With the initials E.A. on front cover, beneath "Souvenir" and above "October 25th, 1867." The binding was presumably executed by the firm of Ramage & Coppinger.
Title from title leaf.

record.title: Tour via Calais, Brussels & Berlin to St. Petersburg & Moscow : returning by way of Berlin, Herringsdorf, Dresden, Eisenach, Maintz, Cologne, Brussels & Calais, to London : June & July, 1899 : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page.
Bound in contemporary half leather and and dark green cloth.

record.title: 19 famous recipes.
record.note: Written in black ink, with headings in red.

record.title: Kort liden Udtog over Soldatens Forhold og Fremgang efter sin Indtrædelse i Soldaterstanden : Ledetraad for Infanteristen ... / Udsat af Underkorporal, Peder Larsen Tolstrup, ved 3die Forstærknings Bataillon, 2det compagni, den 20 Juli 1851.
record.note: Bound in contemporary light blue boards with red linen back and corners; with drawings on both covers.

Bound in half-calf, worn but intact, with gilt-lettered leather label to the upper cover.

record.title: 880-01 Ḥadīth Miʻrāj Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih. Hādhā kitāb adhkuru fīhi Ḥadīth Miʻrāj Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ḥadīth al-Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī [?] al-Baṣrī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh. Ruwiya ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, qāl: Qāla Rasūl Allāh, Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fa-baynamā anā nāʼim dhāt laylah bayna al-Ṣafā wa-al-Marwah, kānat laylah muẓlimah wa-hiya dhāt raʻd wa-barq wa-shitāʼ, habaṭa ʻalayya al-Amīr Jibrīl, ʻalayhi al-salām ..."
Secundo folio: law ajabtahā yā Muḥammad.
18 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 13.5 x 19 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In clear, small Maghribī script, in brown ink on white paper; catchwords.
On the upper left corner of folio 1a: "Allāhumma ṣallī ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālih."

Colophon: Colophon missing. Ends with an invocation "... Allāhumma ifʻal bī wa-bihim ʻājilan wa-ājilan fī al-dīn wa-al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah mā anta la-hu ahl, innaka ghafūr ḥalīm jawwād karīm raʼūf raḥīm, sabʻat marrāt. Intahá."

record.title: Islamic laws, doctrines, prayers and literature : manuscript.
record.note: Title of Kitāb al-dumūʻ from folio 55a.
Title of Kitāb Ādāb al-akl from folio 57b.
Title of Kitāb Ādāb al-nikāḥ from folio 68a.
Title of Tanwīr al-ghabash fī faḍl al-Sūdān wa-al-Ḥabash from folio 134b.
Title of Bāb al-ʻAql ḥujjat Allāh ʻalá khalqih from folio 135a.
Title of Excerpts from Tuḥfat al-albāb fī ʻajāʼib al-buldān from folio 141a.
Title of Excerpts from Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān al-kubrá from folio 142b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Poem on the seven voluntary fasts in Islam: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-sallama taslīman. Ayarghabu [Atarghabu] ajran li-qiyāmi [lil-qiyāmi] taṭawwuʻan // ʻalayka bi-ayyāmin rawtʹhu [rawatʹhā] al-awāʼilu. Wa-ʻiddatuhā sabʻu min al-ʻāmi kullihi // wa-fī ṣawmihā lil-ṣāʼimīna faḍāʼilu ..."

Incipit of Kitāb al-dumūʻ: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-sallama taslīman. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Faqīh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Abū ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ʻAlī al-Jawzī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḍiya ʻanh: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ikhtaraʻa al-ashyāʼ bi-laṭīf qudratih wa-badīʻ ṣanʻatih fa-aḥsana fīmā ikhtaraʻa, wa-abdaʻ al-mawjūdāt ʻalá ghayr mithāl, fa-lā sharīka la-hu fīmā abdaʻ. Allafa al-laṭīf wa-al-kathīf min aʻdād āḥād al-jawāhir wa-jamaʻa li-yufrida bi-al-waḥdānīyah kull maṣnūʻ ..."

Incipit of Kitāb Ādāb al-akl: "Kitāb Ādāb al-akl. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallama taslīman. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aḥsana tadbīr al-kāʼināt fa-khalaqa al-khalq wa-al-samāwāt wa-anzala al-māʼ al-furāt min al-muʻṣirāt fa-anshaʼa al-ḥayy wa-al-nabāt wa-qaddara al-arzāq wa-al-aqwāt wa-ḥafiẓ bi-al-maʼkūlāt qiwá al-ḥayawānāt wa-aʻāna ʻalá al-ṭāʻāt wa-al-aʻmāl al-ṣāliḥāt wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad dhī al-muʻjizāt al-bāhirāt ..."

Incipit of Kitāb Ādāb al-nikāḥ: "Kitāb Ādāb al-nikāḥ. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-karīm wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī lā tuṣādifu sihām al-awhām fī ʻajāʼib ṣanʻatih majrá wa-lā tarjiʻu al-ʻuqūl ʻan awāʼil badāʼiʻihi illā wālihatan ḥayrá wa-lā tazālu laṭāʼifu ʻamalihi niʻmatan ʻalá al-ʻālamīn tatrá, fa-hiya tatawālá ʻlayhim ikhtiyāran wa-qahran ..."

Incipit of Miscellaneous Ḥadīths and advices: "Wa-min baʻḍ taʼālif al-Aḥādīth: Man dakhala ʻalá marīḍ an yaḍaʻa yadahu ʻalá jabīnihi aw mawḍiʻ min jasadihi wa-an yadʻwa la-hu li-qawlihi, ʻalayhi al-salām: Mā min ʻabdin Muslimin yaʻūdu marīḍan lā yaḥḍuru ajaluhu fa-yaqūlu nasʼalu Allāh al-ʻaẓīm rabb al-ʻarsh al-ʻaẓīm an yashfiyaka wa-yuʻāfiyaka illā shafāhu Allāh ..."

Incipit of Tanwīr al-ghabash fī faḍl al-Sūdān wa-al-Ḥabash: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam taslīman. Kitāb Tanwīr al-ghabash taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Faqīh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Jamāl al-Dīn Abū al-Faraj al-Jawzī, raḥimahu Allāh. Qāla, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu fī wa-ṣīyatihi li-waladih Abū al-Qāsim: Innī kafaytuka istiʻārat al-kutub li-annī taraktu laka miʼat taʼlīf min taṣnīfī minhā fī al-tafsīr wa-al-Ḥadīth wa-ghayr dhālika ... Qāla al-Shaykh al-Faqīh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ḥāfiẓ Jamāl al-Dīn wa-qudwat al-aʼimmah wa-al-muḥaddithīn Abū al-Faraj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī al-Jawzī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakātihi. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ikhtāra min jamīʻ al-makhlūqāt al-insān thumma iṣṭafá minhu ahl al-taqwá wa-al-iḥsān thumma jaʻala ʻalá maḥall naẓarihi al-qulūb lā al-abdān ..."

Incipit of Bāb al-ʻAql ḥujjat Allāh ʻalá khalqih: "Bāb al-ʻAql ḥujjat Allāh ʻalá khalqih wa-huwa mālik al-qalb wa-amīr al-jasad wa-wazīr al-rūḥ wa-tarjumān al-ʻabd wa-bi-hi yaqaʻu al-tadbīr wa-tathbut al-ḥujjah. Wa-huwa ʻaqlān, ʻaql mawhūb wa-ʻaql maksūb. Fa-al-ʻaql al-mawhūb huwa alladhī wahaba Allāh ʻazza wa-jall lil-ʻulamāʼ yumayyizūn bi-hi al-ḥaqq wa-al-bāṭil, wa-al-ʻaql al-maksūb huwa alladhī ishtarakat [fīhi] jamīʻ al-khalāʼiq wa-uʻṭiya minhu lil-malāʼikah wa-banī Ādam wa-al-bahāʼim ..."

Incipit of Questions and answers on Islamic law: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Qāla al-Shaykh Sayyidī al-Ḥasan ibn Masʻūd al-Yūsī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-raḍiya ʻanh, fī baʻḍ ajwibatihi fī al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fī al-wird, hal huwa lāzimah am lā ..."

Incipit of An anecdote regarding the encounter of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻĀbid with al-Khaḍir and Ilyās: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Dhakara Abū Bakr al-Muṭawwiʻī ʻan Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻĀbid qāl: Kuntu jālisan fī Bayt al-Maqdis ʻinda Bāb Sulaymān, ʻlayhi al-salām, yawm al-Jumʻah baʻda al-ʻaṣr, idh jāʼa ilayya shakhṣān, aḥaduhumā yushbihu khilqtuhu khilqatanā wa-al-ākhar ʻaẓīm al-khalq, kānat jabhatuhu ʻarīḍatan wa-kāna fīhā athar ḍarbah wa-sallamā ʻalayya ..."

Incipit of Excerpts from Tuḥfat al-albāb fī ʻajāʼib al-buldān: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Dhukira fī Tuḥfat al-albāb fī ʻajāʼib al-buldān anna fī balad al-Sūdān ummah bilā ruʼūs wa-qad dhakarahum al-Shaʻbī fī kitāb Sīrat al-mulūk. Wa-qad dhakara anna fī bilād al-Maghrib ummah min walad Ādam kulluhum nisāʼ wa-lā yaʻīshu fī arḍihim dhakar ..."

Incipit of Excerpts from Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān al-kubrá: "Wa-min kitāb Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān. Ḥarf al-Yāʼ. Yājūj wa-Mājūj, summū bi-dhālika li-kathratihim. Wa-qīl huwa ism Aʻjamī ghayr mushtaq. Qāla Muqātil: Hum walad Yāfit ibn Nūḥ, ʻlayhi al-salām. Wa-ammā qawlu man qāl anna Ādam nāma wa-iḥtalam wa-iltaṣaqa manīyuhu bi-al-turāb fa-tawallada minhu hādhā al-ḥayawān fa-mardūd bi-ʻadam iḥtilām al-anbiyāʼ ʻalayhim al-salām ..."
Secundo folio of Kitāb al-dumūʻ: ilayhi wa-rajaʻ wa-ashhadu.
Secundo folio of Kitāb Ādāb al-akl: taslīman. al-Ḥamdu lillāh.
Secundo folio of Kitāb Ādāb al-nikāḥ: wa-qālū inna ʻĪsá.
Secundo folio of Miscellaneous Ḥadīths and advices: fī jawāzihi bi-asmāʼ Allāh.
Secundo folio of Tanwīr al-ghabash fī faḍl al-Sūdān wa-al-Ḥabash: ʻalá mā hiya ʻalayh.
Secundo folio of Bāb al-ʻAql ḥujjat Allāh ʻalá khalqih: wa-qalb madhbūḥ wa-qalb maṭrūḥ.
Secundo folio of Questions and answers on Islamic law: wa-kataba Sayyidī Muḥammad.
Secundo folio of An anecdote regarding the encounter of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻĀbid with al-Khaḍir and Ilyās: wa-ʻalá ṭarīqat rajul.
Secundo folio of Excerpts from Tuḥfat al-albāb fī ʻajāʼib al-buldān: mattá buniyat hādhihi al-madīnah.
Secundo folio of Excerpts from Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān al-kubrá: aḥaduhumā lil-ākhar ṣār.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18 cm; 20-24 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding, flap missing; central medallion on both covers; leaves are loose within the binding as usual with some Islamic bindings.
In fair, small Maghribī script, in black ink on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover a leaf is glued which contains some folkloric medicinal recipes.
On folio 1a a poem in eight verses about the seven voluntary fasts in Islam.
