Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Ḥamdan li-man abdaʻa al-uṣūl wa-al-muwalladāt wa-ikhtāra minhā dhawī al-rawīyah wa-al-ʻuqūl al-bāhirāt, wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman ʻalá aṣl al-nashʼatayn wa-khulāṣat man ātāhu Allāh al-ḥikmatayn, Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad al-mabʻūth raḥmatan lil-ʻālamīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-mutamassikīn bi-millatihi wa-al-ʻāmilīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu aḥqar al-anām Aḥmad al-Damanhūrī, ṭahharahu Allāh min waṣmat al-anām: Hādhihi masāʼil muzdariyah jalīlah tataʻallaqu bi-ʻilāj al-maqʻadah al-ʻalīlah bi-adwiyah shahīrah kathīrat al-wujūd, qarībat al-taḥṣīl li-kull faqīr wa-ghanī kanūd, sammaytuhā bi-al-Kalām al-yasīr fī ʻilāj al-maqʻadah wa-al-bawāsīr, wa-rattabtuhā ʻalá muqaddimah wa-maqṣūd wa-khātimah, rājiyan minhu subḥānah an yamunna ʻalaynā bi-ḥusn al-khātimah ..."
Secundo folio: al-ʻaḍalatayn mublighān ilá aṣl.
17 x 24.7 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah fī ʻilāj al-maqʻdah wa-al-bawāsīr lil-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Damanhūrī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."
On folio 13a, in a different hand: "Fāʼidah lil-bawāsīr" (a medical recipe for the treatment of hemorrhoids).
Folio 14 is blank.

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu: Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʼlīfihi fī al-ʻāshir min al-sābiʻ min al-tāsiʻ min al-sābiʻ min al-thānī ʻashar min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taswīdihi yawm al-Jumʻah rābiʻ ʻashar Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min shuhur sanat alf wa-miʼah arbaʻah wa-tisʻīn min al-Hijrah. Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih yawm al-Aḥad, ghurrat shahr Ṣafar al-khayr, sanat 1298. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The author said: It was completed on the tenth of the seventh of the ninth of the seventh of the twelfth of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and peace be upon him [10 Rajab, 1169 Hijrī = 10 April, 1756]. Its drafting "taswīd" was completed on Friday [sic], 14 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1194 of the Hijrah [Monday, 20 March, 1780]. The copy was completed, by the praise of God, His help and abundant benevolence, on Sunday, the beginning of Ṣafar, 1298 [3 January, 1881]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-murīd li-Khulāṣat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Faraqī al-Zakī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Naḥmaduka Allāhumma ʻalá mā ʻallamtanā min farāʼid ʻaqāʼid al-īmān wa-nashkuruka ʻalá mā alhamtanā min sāṭiʻ al-ḥujaj wa-qawāṭiʻ al-burhān, wa-nuṣallī wa-nusallim ʻalá man ʻaṣamtahu min al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-hādīn ṭarīq al-ḥaqq wa-al-ḥāmīn sharāʼiʻ al-Islām. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūl afqar al-ʻibād ilá raḥmat al-karīm al-jawwād Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Faraqī al-Zakī, ʻāmalahu Allāh wa-al-Muslimīn bi-luṭfihi al-khafī: Lammā kāna ʻilm al-tawḥīd awwal wājib ʻalá al-mukallaf fahman lā yaṣiḥḥu wājib wa-lā mandūb bi-dūnih jazman, wa-kānat manẓūmat Shaykhinā al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Najjārī min ajall mā ṣunnifa fīhi nafʻan li-mā annahā qad ishtamalat maʻa wajāzat lafẓihā wa-suhūlat tanāwulihā ʻalá al-ʻaqāʼid murdafah bi-adillatihā jamʻan, fa-insharaḥ ṣadrī la-hā ghāyat al-inshirāḥ, fa-sharaʻtu fī taʼlīf sharḥ mukhtaṣar ʻalayhā, mustaʻīnan bi-al-ʻAlīm al-Fattāḥ, wa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl, wa-sammaytuhu "Fatʹḥ al-murīd li-Khulāṣat al-tawḥīd ..."
Secundo folio: kathīr al-dumūʻ al-gharaḍ.
16.5 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 19 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.

In fair ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "Khulāṣat al-tawḥīd" of ʻAlī al-Najjārī in red; numerous notes, commentaries and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Four verses of poetry by Muḥammad al-Ṭanṭāwī (could not be identified) in praise of "Khulāṣat al-tawḥīd" of ʻAlī ibn ʻĪsá al-Najjārī and the commentary on it by Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Faraqī al-Zakī.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʼlīf hādhā al-sharḥ al-nafīs sanat alf wa-miʼatayn sabʻah wa-thalāthīn min Hijratihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Tamm. ʻAlá yad kātibihi wa-muʼallifihi al-faqīr Aḥmad Qashsh al-Faraqī al-Zakī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This precious commentary was completed in the year 1237 [1821 or 1822] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may God pray on him and grant him peace. Written and authored by the poor Aḥmad Qashsh al-Faraqī al-Zakī, may God have mercy upon him. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Muḥāḍarat al-abrār wa-musāmarat al-akhyār : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aṭlaʻa shams al-fawāʼid fī muḥāḍarat al-abrār wa-jaʻala niẓām al-qalāʼid fī musāmarat al-akhyār wa-awdaʻa li-laʼāliʼ [laʼāliʼ] al-fawāʼid fī muḥāwarat al-aḥrār, wa-awḍaḥa al-ḥikam fī mujārāt al-ḥukamāʼ, wa-abāna jawāmiʻ al-kalim fī mubārāt al-ʻulamāʼ, wa-ḍammana al-asrār fī muṭāraḥat al-aḥibāʼ, wa-arsala al-arwāḥ fī munāwaḥat al-awiddāʼ, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. Ammā baʻd, fa-innī awdaʻtu fī hādhā al-kitāb alladhī sammaytuhu "Muḥāḍarat al-abrār wa-musāmarat al-akhyār" ḍurūban min al-akhbār wa-funūnan min al-mawāʻiẓ wa-al-amthāl dhawī al-albāb ..."
Secundo folio: dhālika ḥattá tatawaffara ḥurmatuh.
13.5 x 21.8 cm; written surface: 7 x 16.5 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good small naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā dīwān li-Ibn al-ʻArab [al-ʻArabī], wa-huwa jāmiʻ min kull fann, shiʻr wa-ḥikāyāt muḍḥikah musallīyah, wa-aḥādīth wa-nukat wa-musāmarāt wa-tawārīkh al-khulafāʼ wa-ʻajāʼib al-ṣunʻ wa-badāʼiʻ al-ḥikmah wa-ghayr [wa-ghayruhu] kathīr. Wa-naḥnu iqtaṣarnā. Wa-fīhi ghayr dhālika min al-ʻajāʼib. Sanat 1110."
Text folios 1b-82b; folios 83-84 are blank.

Colophon: "Intahá wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, lā sharīka lah, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammadan [Muḥammad] wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-dhurrīyātihi wa-azwājihi wa-ahl baytihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. M."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed. Praise be to God alone. He has no companion. Prayer and peace be on our Master Muḥammad, his family, his companions, his descendants, his wives, and those of his household, the good and the pure ones. Praise be to God alone. M."

record.title: 880-03 al-Taysīr li-ḥifẓ madhāhib al-qurrāʼ al-sabʻah : manuscript / Abū ʻAmr ʻUthmān ibn Saʻīd al-Dānī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 2b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām Abū ʻAmr al-ḥāfiẓ ʻUthmān ibn Saʻīd ibn ʻUthmān al-Muqriʼ ibn ʻUmar al-Ṣayriafī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-munfarid bi-al-dawām, al-mutaṭawwil bi-al-inʻām, khāliq al-khalq bi-qudratih, wa-mudabbir al-amr bi-ḥikmatih, lā rādda li-amrih, wa-lā muʻaqqiba li-ḥukmih, wa-huwa sarīʻ al-ḥisāb ... Ammā baʻd, fa-innakum saʼaltumūnī, aḥsana Allāh irshādakum, an uṣannif lakum kitāban mukhtaṣaran fī madhāhib al-qurrāʼ al-sabʻah bi-al-amṣār ... fa-ajabtukum ilá mā saʼaltumūhu wa-aʻmaltu nafsī fī taṣnīf mā raghibtumūhu ʻalá al-naḥw alladhī aradtumūh ..."
Secundo folio: fī qurb wa-dhakartu.
15 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In black buckram binding with flap and red leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; many notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: A note, in a different hand about, "al-Ḥurūf al-muqaṭṭaʻah" (Separate letters at the beginning of some sūrahs of the Qurʼān) and about "madd" ("elongation": drawing out of the voice over long vowels in the recitation of the Qurʼān).

On folio 2a: "Kitāb al-Taysīr li-ḥfẓ madhāhib al-qurrāʼ al-sabʻah, raḥimahum Allāh, wa-taqrīb wa-tabyīn dhālika ʻalá al-mashhūr ʻanhum min al-ṭuruq wa-al-riwāyāt, maʻa ḥadhf al-taṭwīl wa-al-takrār, wa-al-iʻtimād ʻalá al-ījāz wa-al-ikhtiṣār, taṣnīf Abī ʻAmr ʻUthmān ibn Saʻīd ibn ʻUthmān ibn Saʻīd ibn ʻUmar al-Muqrī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, riwāyat Abī Dāwūd Sulaymān ibn Abī al-Qāsim Najāḥ, mawlá Amīr al-Muʼminīn, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih."
On folios 95b-96a, a commentary, in a different hand, on "Āyat al-Riddah" (the apostasy verse. Qurʼān: Sūrat al-Baqarah: 217)
Folios 97-98 are blank.

Colophon (folio 95b): "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi [kitābat] hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak al-musammá bi-Taysīr [al-Taysīr], yassara Allāh ʻalaynā amranā fī al-dunyā wa-Yawm al-Dīn, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá al-ghanī ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn ʻAbd Allāh fī Ḥalab al-Shahbāʼ, fī Madrasat al-Aḥmadīyah, wa-dhālika fī yawm al-Khamīs min shuhūr sanat 1189 min Hijrat man ʻalayhi alf salām wa-alf taḥīyah. Wa-arjū min al-khillān an yuṣliḥū mā fīhā min al-ʻayb wa-al-nuqṣān."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of this blessed book, titled "al-Taysīr", may God facilitate our condition in this world and on Judgement Day, was completed by the poor to God, the Rich and Most High, ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn ʻAbd Allāh, on blessed Thursday, 1189 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [1175 or 1176; date of the day and name of the month not mentioned] at al-Madrasah al-Aḥmadīyah, in Aleppo, Syria. I request my colleagues to correct whatever defects or shortcomings they may find in it."

record.title: 880-03 Kitāb al-Ḥikam : manuscript / Ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh al-Iskandarī.
record.note: Title of al-Ḥikam al-ʻAṭāʼiyah from folio 1a.
Title of Mawlid al-Nabī supplied by cataloger.
Title of al-Dimyāṭīyah from caption (folio 40b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of al-Ḥikam al-ʻAṭāʼīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻārif billāh, mūḍiḥ al-ṭarīqah wa-mumidd masālik al-ḥaqīqah Tāj al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh al-Iskandarī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh wa-jaʻala al-Jannah munqalabahu wa-mathwāh: Min ʻalāmāt al-iʻtimād ʻalá al-ʻamal nuqṣān al-rajāʼ ʻinda wujūd al-zalal. Irādatuka al-tajrīd maʻa iqāmat Allāh iyyāka fī al-asbāb min al-shahwah al-khafīyah, wa-irādatuka al-asbāb maʻa iqāmat Allāh iyyāka fī al-tajrīd inḥiṭāṭ al-himmah al-ʻalīyah ..."
Secundo folio of al-Ḥikam al-ʻAṭāʼīyah: lā yakun taʼakhkhur.

Incipit of Mawlid al-Nabī (folio 27b): "Hādhā al-Mawlid li-baʻḍ al-muḥaqqiqīn, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī sharrafa al-anām bi-ṣāḥib al-maqām al-aʻlá, wa-kammal al-wujūd bi-akmal mawlūd ḥawá sharafan wa-faḍlan, sharrafa bi-hi al-ābāʼ wa-al-judūd, wa-malaʼ al-wujūd bi-hi ʻadlan. Ḥamilat bi-hi ummuhu Āminah, fa-lam tajid li-ḥamlihi thiqalan, wa-waḍaʻathu, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, makhtūnan madhūnan fī khilaʻ al-ḥusn yuḥlá, wa-wulida, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-wajh lā yurá aḥsana minhu wa-lā aḥlá ..."
Secundo folio of Mawlid al-Nabī: wa-nārat bi-hi al-akwān.
Incipit of al-Dimyāṭīyah: "Hādhihi al-Dimyāṭīyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Badaʼtu bi-Bismillāhi wa-al-ḥamdi awwalan // ʻalá niʻamin lam tuḥṣa fīmā tanazzala ..."
Secundo folio of al-Dimyāṭīyah: Wa-yā qābiḍu iqbiḍ.
13.5 x 19.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 13.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Ḥikam lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá Tāj al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh al-Iskandarī al-Shādhilī, qaddasa Allāh taʻālá rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu wa-nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi wa-al-Muslimīn fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn."
On the right margin of folio 42b, someone wrote three verses of poetry as a supplement to the verses of al-Dimyāṭīyah.

Colophon of al-Ḥikam al-ʻAṭāʼīyah: "Tammat al-Ḥikam bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam wa-ʻaẓẓam, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn Muḥammad al-Shahīr bi-al-Habrāwī, sanat 1112."

Translation of the colophon of al-Ḥikam al-ʻAṭāʼīyah: "The copy of al-Ḥikam was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant favor. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace and glory. Copied by the poor faqī ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn Muḥammad al-Shahīr bi-al-Habrāwī, in the year 1112 Hijrī [1700 or 1701]."
Colophon of Mawlid al-Nabī: "ʻAlá yad kātibihā al-marqūm, sanat 1112."
Translation of the colophon of Mawlid al-Nabī: "The copy was completed by the hand of the aforementioned copyist, in the year 1112 Hijrī [1700 or 1701]."

Colophon of al-Dimyāṭīyah: "Biʻawn Allāh taʻālá tammat wa-bi-al-khayr ʻammat. Katabahā li-nafsihi, wa-liman shāʼa Allāh min baʻdih, ʻUbayd al-Ghanī ibn Muḥammad al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Habrah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-liman daʻā lahum bi-al-maghfirah wa-dhālika ẓuhrīyat nahār al-Arbiʻāʼ li-sittata ʻashar yawman maḍat min shahr Ṣafar al-khayr min shuhūr sanat 1112."

Translation of the colophon of al-Dimyāṭīyah: "It [the copy] was completed by the help of God, may He be praised. May it be wide-spread. Copied by ʻUbayd al-Ghanī ibn Muḥammad al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Habrah, may God forgive him and his parents and whosoever beseech God to forgive them, on Wednesday noon, 16 Ṣafar, 1112 Hijrī [2 August, 1700]."

record.title: 880-02 Tadhkirat ulī al-albāb bi-maʻrifat al-ādāb : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Raʼūf ibn Tāj al-ʻĀrifīn al-Munāwī al-Ḥaddādī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī arshada hādhihi al-ummah ilá ādāb lā tuḥṣá, wa-khaṣṣahā bi-faḍāʼil wa-mazāyā lā tustaqṣá, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh shahādata ʻabd muḥtāj ilá fayḍ ʻAllām al-Ghuyūb, wa-anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, ajall ṭālib wa-maṭlūb, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn, mā ṭalaʻa najm wa-afila gharūb. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf, al-multajī ilá karam al-Raʼūf al-Laṭīf, Muḥammad al-madʻū ʻAbd al-Raʼūf ibn al-Munāwī al-Ḥaddādī, kafāhu Allāh sharra al-munāwī wa-al-muʻādī: Hādhā mā ishtaddat ilayhi ḥājat al-khāṣṣ wa-al-ʻāmm ilá maʻrifat ādāb al-akl wa-al-shurb wa-al-jimāʻ ..."
Secundo folio: al-awwal fī ādābihi al-sharʻīyah.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In beautiful thick naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Folio 81 is blank.
Text folios 1b-80a.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "Wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq wa-al-hādī ilá al-ṣawāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, sayyid al-aḥbāb, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-al-atbāʻ wa-tābiʻīhim bi-iḥsān. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

record.title: 880-02 Kashf al-qināʻ ʻan Matn wa-Sharḥ Abī Shujāʻ : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī al-Azʹharī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan li-man ikhtaṣṣanā bi-risālat Abī al-Qāsim, wa-ikhtaṣṣahu bi-al-shafāʻah al-ʻuẓmá yawm al-hawl, al-ʻāṣim mā ashfaqat al-umm ʻalá waladihā al-bārr al-rāḥim ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-muftaqir ilá al-ghfrān ... ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Maḥallī al-Azʹharī al-Shāfiʻī ... Lammā an manna Allāh ʻalayya bi-al-ijtimāʻ ʻalá ... Abī al-Ḍiyāʼ Nūr al-Dīn ʻAlī al-Shabramallisī ... kāna min jumlat mā qaraʼtuhu ʻalayhi Sharḥ Abī Shujāʻ lil-Shams Ibn Qāsim al-Ghazzī, wa-ḥaṣala min dhālika fawāʼid, nashaʼa baʻḍuhā min asʼilat al-ḥāḍirīn, baʻda al-murājaʻah bi-ḥasab al-ṭāqah, wa-aktharuhā min fawāʼid Ustādhinā al-madhkūr, ghayra jawābin li-suʼāl, fa-aḥbabtu an ajmaʻahā fī hādhihi al-awrāq, khishyata ḍayāʻihā, baʻda an istajaztuhu, fa-ajāz. Wa-wasamtu mā jamaʻt bi-"Kashf al-qināʻ ʻan Matn wa-Sharḥ Abī Shujāʻ" ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalá wifq murādihi al-muwaffiq.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound; wrapped in a sheet of paper.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some of the phrases of the original "Matn" and "Sharḥ" are written in red preceded by the phrase "qawluhu" (his statement); catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, farīd ʻaṣrih wa-waḥīd dahrih, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, Sayyidī ʻAlī al-Shabrāmallisī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātih wa-bi-ʻulūmih, ʻAlī ibn Qāsim al-Ghazzī, ʻalá Abī Shujāʻ. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
On folio 1a: Three verses of poetry on seeking Paradise, start with: Yā man yuʻāniqu dunyā lā baqāʼa la-hā // yumsī wa-yuṣbiḥu fī dunyāhu saffārā ..."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Min niʻam Allāh taʻālá ʻalá al-ʻabd al-faqīr Sulaymān al-Minūfī al-Shāfiʻī al-Aḥmadī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn. M."
On the front of the wrapping sheet: "Ḥāshiyat al-Shabramsallī [sic] ʻalá Ibn Qāsim."

On the back of the wrapping sheet a quotation from "Ṭirāz al-majālis" of al-Shihāb al-Khafājī (Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Khafājī, 1571 or 1572-1659) praising the Prophet Muḥammad and his parents.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ fī salkh al-Ḥijjah, sanat alf wa-miʼah tisʻah wa-arbaʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilá Allāh Sulaymān al-Minūfī al-Shāfiʻī al-Aḥmadī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu wa-ghafara la-hu. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on Wednesday, at the end of Dḥu al-Ḥijjah, 1149 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and peace be upon him, by the poorest of the poor to God, Sulaymān al-Minūfī al-Shāfiʻī al-Aḥmadī, may God forgive him and pardon him. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-ṭullāb bi-Sharḥ Taḥrīr Tanqīḥ al-Lubāb : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā Qāḍī al-Quḍāh, shaykh mashāyikh al-Islām, malik al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām, Sībawayh zamānih, farīd ʻaṣrih wa-awānih, zayn al-dīn, lisān al-mutakallimīn, ḥujjat al-munāẓirīn, muḥyī sunnat Sayyidī [Sayyid] al-Mursalīn, Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-fasaḥa fī qabrih wa-nafaʻanā wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakatih: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī faqqaha fī dīnihi man iṣṭafāh min al-anām, wa-hadá man irtaḍāh li-fahm mā sharraʻahu min al-aḥkām ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ ʻalá mukhtaṣarī al-musammá bi-Taḥrīr tanqīḥ al-lubāb fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-mujtahid al-Shāfiʻī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, yaḥullu alfāẓahu wa-yubayyinu murādahu wa-yuḥaqqiqu masāʼilahu wa-yuḥarriru dalāʼilahu, wa-sammaytuhu "Tuḥfat al-ṭullāb bi-sharḥ taḥrīr tanqīḥ al-lubāb". Wa-Allāh al-karīm asʼal an yajʻalahu khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm wa-sababan lil-fawz bi-jannāt al-naʻīm."
Secundo folio: thumma bi-al-ḥamd la-hu jamʻan.
23 x 16.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather binding with flap, central medallion on cover and flap; in 20 numbered quires.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper with the phrases of Taḥrīr Tanqīḥ al-Lubāb in red; some commentaries on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
Text folios 1a-202b; folios 203-204 are blank.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Taḥrīr, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, shaykh mashāyikh al-Islām, malik al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām, Sībawayh zamānih, wa-waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-awānih, zayn al-dīn, lisān al-mutakallimīn, maḥajjat al-munāẓirīn, Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad Ibrāhīm ʻArab al-Shāfiʻī." "Qad intaqalat al-milkīyah min al-madhkūr yamīnahu ilá al-fāḍil al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm Rābiḥ al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban. Wa-bi-dhā lazim al-taʼshīr li-yuʻlam."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, thalāthata ʻashar khalat min shahr Rabīʻ Ākhir alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-thalāthah wa-sabʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-dhālika ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-qadīr Muḥammad Ibrāhīm ʻArab al-Zankalūnī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Bakrī ṭarīqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-wālid wālidayhi wa-li-khwānihi fī Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on blessed Thursday, 13 Rabīʻ Ākhir, 1273 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [11 December, 1856], may the best of prayer and peace be upon Him, by ... Muḥammad Ibrāhīm ʻArab al-Zankalūnī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Bakrī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him, his parents and the parents of his parents, and his brethren in God, Most High. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Jamʻ al-jawāmiʻ : manuscript / al-Jalāl al-Maḥallī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá afḍālih wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālih. Hādhā mā ishtaddat ilayhi ḥājat al-mutafahhimīn li-Jamʻ al-jawāmiʻ min sharḥ yaḥullu alfāẓah wa-yubayyinu murādah wa-yuḥaqqiqu masāʼilah wa-yuḥarriru dalāʼilah ʻalá wajh sahl lil-mubtadiʼīn, ḥasan lil-nāẓirīn, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Qāla al-muṣannif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ..."
Secundo folio: wa-qāla mā taqaddam.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 14.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap, central medallion on cover and flap.

In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper with the phrases of Jamʻ al-jawām and markings in red; numerous notes and commentaries on the margins and interlinear; text of folios 1b and 2a within gold frame, the rest of the folios lined in double red frames; catchwords.
Brockelmann (S II, page 105) gives the title of the book as "Badr aṭ-ṭāliʻ fī ḥall Ǧamʻ al-ǧawāmiʻ."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ Jamʻ al-jawāmiʻ lil-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh al-Jalāl al-Maḥallī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
On folio 382a: Two verses of poetry, in a different hand, attributed to al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī praising "al-qanāʻah" (contentment).

On folio 382a an anonymous endowment statement: "Waqaftu jamīʻ al-kutub alladhī [allatī] katabtuhā bi-yadī wa-alladhī [wa-allatī] ishtaraytuhā ʻalá kull ṭālib ʻilm yataʻāṭá al-intifāʻ bi-hā fī maḥallihā. Fa-in fuqida wa-intaqala [intaqala] ilá Ruwāq al-Shuwām, waqfan sharʻīyan lā yubāʻ wa-lā yūhab. Fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻahu, al-Āyah [Qurʼān, Sūrat al-Baqarah: 181]."
On folio 382a: Six illegible seals.

Colophon: "Wa-qad wāfaqa farāgh naskhihi yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak rābiʻ yawm fī Jumād Awwal min shuhūr sanat 1169 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on blessed Thursday, the fourth day of Jumād Awwal, 1169 [5 February, 1756] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and peace be upon Him. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Shirʻat al-Islām ilá dār al-salām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr Imāmʹzādah.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī dallanā ʻalá maʻrifatihi bi-al-shawāhid wa-al-aʻlām wa-taʻabbudinā li-karāmatinā bi-aqsām al-ʻubūdīyah wa-al-aḥkām, wa-sharraʻ la-nā fīmā yuṣliḥunā fī al-dārayn sunan al-Islām, wa-hadānā ilá mā irtaḍāhu min amr al-dīn bi-Nabīyihi Muḥammad, ʻalayhi al-sallām, wa-jaʻalahu qāʼidanā bi-laṭīf khulqihi ilá dār al-salām, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi mā lamaʻa fī al-samāʼ barq wa-tahallala ghamām. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi ʻuqūd manẓūmah min sunan sayyid al-ʻālamīn wa-imām al-muttaqīn muntaqdah [muntaqāh] min kutub al-aʼimmah al-mahdīn min ʻulamāʼ al-dīn mufaṣṣalah shudhūruhā wa-ʻaqāʼiluhā lil-mashghūf bi-ijtināʼihā, mashrūḥah fuṣūluhā wa-makshūfah abwābuhā lil-mustaḍīʼ bi-maṣābīḥ akhawātihā ... wa-tarjamtuhu bi-Kitāb Shirʻat al-Islām ilá dār al-salām wa-jaʻaltuhu thamāniyah wa-arbaʻīn faṣlan ..."
Secundo folio: yataḥaffaẓuhu ahl al-īqān.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 12.5 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap, covers tooled with geometric designs.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; many notes and commentaries on the margins and interlinear by Sayyid ʻAlī Dhādah (could not be identified); catchwords.
Folios 1b-2a contain an index of contents: "Fihrist Shirʻat al-Islām."

On folios 2b-3a: A short epistle, in a different hand, on the lucky and blessed days of the month of Muḥarram, in Ottoman Turkish, titled: "Risālah fī ayyām saʻd wa-mubārak fī awwal shahr al-Muḥarram."

On folio 4a: Information about a commentator on "Shirʻat al-Islām": "Ṣāḥib Sharḥ al-Shirʻah, al-Mawlá Yaʻqūb ibn Sayyid ʻAlī (Burūsawī, Yaʻqūb ibn ʻAlī, died 1524 or 1525), māta, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, fī sanat thalāthīn aw iḥdá wa-thalāthīn wa-tisʻimiʼah rājiʻan min safar al-ḥajj. Ṣannafa, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, sharḥan laṭīfan jāmiʻan lil-fawāʼid al-sharʻīyah li-kitāb al-Shirʻah [Shirʻat] al-Islām. Wa-kāna al-Sulṭān Bāyazīd Khān (Bayezid II, Sultan of the Turks, 1447 or 1448-1512) laqqabahu bi-Shāriḥ al-Shirʻah li-maylihi ilá al-sharḥ al-madhkūr. Wa-kataba ḥawāshī ʻalá Sharḥ dībājat al-Miṣbāḥ, wa-hiya mutadāwalah bayna al-ṭalabah. Wa-la-hu ayḍan Sharḥ li-Kitāb Kulistān lil-Shaykh Saʻdī al-Shīrāzī, wa-al-kitāb al-mazkūr [al-madhkūr] bi-al-Fārisīyah, wa-qad katab al-sharḥ al-madhkūr bi-al-ʻArabīyah li-yasʹhula maʻrifat al-lisān al-Fārisī ʻalá al-ṭalabah, rawwaḥa [Allāh] rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥah."

On folio 4a: Two ownership statements: "Tamallakahu al-faqīr ilayhi subḥānah taʻālá ʻAlī al-Wahbī Barqūqjahwī 20[?]." The second ownership statement is partially legiblle: "Mimmā anʻama Allāh ʻazza wa-jall ʻalá al-ʻabd ..."
On folio 4a: Seven faded seals.
On folio 4b: "Hādhā Kitāb Shirʻat al-Islām."
Text folios 4b-160b.

Colophon: "Tamma taḥrīr al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb ʻalá yad bandah faqīr al-ḥaqīr Sayyid ʻAlī sākin Barqūqjah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn. Tammat al-kitāb, Rajab al-fard, fī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, fī waqt al-ʻaṣr, min sanat alf miʼatān wa-arbaʻūn. Wa-al-ḥamd lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, [wa-ʻalá] Rasūlihi afḍal al-salām. M."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed by the help of God, the Generous King, by the poor and despised servant, Sayyid ʻAlī, who lives in Barqūqjah [could not be identified], may God forgive him and all believers, on Wednesday afternoon, [4] Rajab, 1240 [22 February, 1825]. Praise be to God and the best of peace be upon His Messenger."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Fiqh al-akbar : manuscript / Abū al-Muntahá Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Maghnīsāwī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā ilá ṭarīq al-Sunnah wa-al-Jamāʻah bi-faḍlihi al-ʻaẓīm, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi wa-ḥabībihi Muḥammad alladhī kāna ʻalá khuluq ʻaẓīm, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-dāʻīn ilá ṣirāṭin mustaqīm. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-mudhnib Abū al-Muntahá, ʻaṣamahu Allāh taʻālá al-kabīr al-karīm ʻan al-khāṭāyā [al-khaṭāyā] wa-al-maʻāṣī wa-min al-iʻtiqād al-fāsid al-ʻaqīm: 'Inna Kitāb al-Fiqh al-akbar alladhī ṣannafahu al-Imām al-aʻẓam kitāb ṣaḥīḥ maqbūl. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām fakhr al-Islām ʻAlī al-Yazdawī: Fī uṣūl al-fiqh nawʻān, ʻilm al-tawḥīd wa-al-ṣifāt, wa-ʻilm al-sharāʼiʻ wa-al-aḥkām, wa-al-aṣl fī al-nawʻ al-awwal huwa al-tamassuk bi-al-Kitāb wa-al-Sunnah wa-mujānabat al-hawá wa-al-bidʻah wa-luzūm ṭarīq al-Sunnah wa-al-Jamāʻah ..."
Secundo folio: li-yadulla ʻalá anna al-iqrār.
14 x 19.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 11.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled buckram with leather spine.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; some notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
Text folios 1a-32b; preceded by 1 blank leaf and followed by two blank ones.
At head of folio 1a: "al-Fiqh al-akbar." "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Fiqh al-akbar ilá Abī al-Muntahá." "Hādhā Kitāb Abū al-Muntahá."

Colophon: "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min katb hādhā al-kitāb al-sharīf bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-wahhāb al-laṭīf fī waqt al-maghrib fī [... ... ...] shahr Jumād al-Ākhir, sanat thamān wa-thamānī [wa] alf."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed by the help of God, the kind and abundant-giving King, in the evening of [... ... ...] the month of Jumād al-Ākhir, the year one-thousand [and] eighty-eight [August, 1677]."

record.title: 880-03 Fatḥ al-qarīb al-mujīb fī sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb : manuscript / Shams al-Dīn Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Qāsim al-Shāfiʻī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Shams al-Dīn Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Qāsim al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-ruḍwānih. Āmīn: al-Ḥamdu lillāh tabarrukan bi-Fātiḥat al-Kitāb li-annahā ibtidāʼ kull amr dhī bāl wa-khātimat kull duʻāʼ mujāb wa-ākhir duʻāʼ al-muʼminīn fī al-Jannah dār al-thawāb, aḥmaduhu an [ay] wifqa murādih, wa-uṣallī wa-usallimu ʻalá afḍal khalqihi Muḥammad Sayyidī [Sayyid] al-Mursalīn, al-qāʼil 'Man yurid Allāh bi-hi khayran yufaqqihhu fī al-dīn' wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi muddata dhikr al-dhākirīn wa-sahw al-ghāfilīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb fī ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār wa-al-tahdhīb wa-ḍaʻtuhu ʻalá al-kitāb al-musammá bi-al-Taqrīb li-yantfiʻa bi-hi al-muḥtāj min al-mubtadiʼīn li-furūʻ al-sharīʻah wa-al-dīn ..."
Secundo folio: bi-hi al-muḥtāj min al-mubtadiʼīn.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "al-Taqrīb" in red; catchwords.
On folio 2a: "... fa-li-dhālika sammaytuhu bi-ismayn: Fatḥ al-qarīb al-mujīb fī sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb, wa-al-thānī: al-Qawl al-mukhtār fī sharḥ Ghāyat al-khtiṣār ..."

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... wa-izālat al-najāsah in kānat ʻalá badanihi, ay al-mughtasil, wa-hādhā mā rajjaḥahu al-Rāfiʻī, wa-ʻalayhi, fa-lā yakfī ghaslah wāḥidah ʻan al-ḥadath. H. Wa-al-najāsah, wa-rajjaḥa al-Nawawī al-iktifāʼ bi-ghaslah wāḥidah ʻanhumā wa-maḥalluhu fīmā idhā kānat ḥikmīyah, ammā idhā kānat ʻaynīyah wajaba ghaslatān ʻanhumā. Wa-īṣāl al-māʼ ilá jamīʻ al-shaʻr wa-al-basharah, wa-fī baʻḍ al-nusakh badal jamīʻ uṣūl al-māʼ, wa-lā farq bayna shaʻr al-raʼs wa-ghayrihi wa-lā bayna al-khafīf minhu wa-al-kathīf wa-al-shaʻr al-maẓfūr in lam yaṣil al-māʼ ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Mafākhir al-ʻalīyah fī al-maʼāthir al-Shādhilīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻIyād al-Shāfiʻī al-Shādhilī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī man iʻtaṣama bi-hi najjāh, wa-man aṭāʻahu bi-faḍlihi kāfāh, wa-man saʼalahu min birrihi aʻṭāh, wa-man daʻāhu samiʻa nidāhu wa-labbāh, wa-man ʻalat himmatuhu ilayhi jaʻalahu ʻalī al-qadr bayna awliyāʼihi wa-ijtabāh, wa-man shadda ilayhi bi-al-ʻibādah wa-al-maḥabbah qarrabahu ilayhi wa-adnāh wa-afradahu wa-tawallāh ..."
Secundo folio: al-Shāfiʻī mathalan wa-lā yuʻrafu.
16.3 x 23 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In red leather binding with flap; medallions embossed on covers and flap; in 20 numbered quires.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Mafākhir al-ʻalīyah fī al-maʼāthir al-Shādhilīyah taʼlīf al-Walī al-kabīr wa-al-ʻalam al-shahīr al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-walī al-zāhid Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻIyād al-Shāfiʻī al-Shādhilī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

On folio 2a: "... fa-raʼaytu Kitāb Durrat al-asrār [lil-Ustādh Ibn al-Ṣabbāgh] jamaʻa ghālib al-maqṣūd wa-minhu akhadhtu akthar mā fī hādhā al-kitāb, illā annī zidtu fī hādhā al-kitāb min ghayr Durrat al-asrār mā yūfī bi-mā saʼalanī al-sāʼil fīhi mimmā laysa mawjūdan fī Durrat al-asrār, fa-akhadhtu dhālika min al-kutub al-muʻtamadah ..."
On folio 2b: "... wa-sammaytuhu al-Mafākhir al-ʻalīyah fī al-maʼāthir al-Shādhilīyah."
On folios 199b, 200a and 200b: Sketches of Sūfī incantations and talismans.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi laylat al-Khamīs al-mubārak al-muwāfiq li-sabʻah wa-ʻishrīn yawman khalawn min shahr Ṣafar al-khayr alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1285, alf wa-miʼatayn wa-khamsah wa-thamānīn maḍat min Hijrat Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-sharrafa wa-karrama wa-ʻaẓẓam, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-Karīm al-ʻAlī ʻabduhu Ibrāhīm ʻAlī al-Shībāwī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Shādhilī ṭarīqatan, ghafar Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-ikhwānihi fī Allāh taʻālá, aḥyāʼan wa-amwātan. Allāhumma ighfir li-man iṭṭalaʻa ʻalayhi wa-daʻā li-kātibihi bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-infaʻ bi-hi ahlahu Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nabī al-ummī wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá yawm al-dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied on the night of blessed Thursday, 27 Ṣafar, 1285 of the Hijrah of our Master Muḥammad [19 June, 1868], may God pray on Him, grant Him Peace, honor and exalt Him, by the poor slave of the Generous and the Exalted God, Ibrāhīm ʻAlī al-Shībāwī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Shādhilī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him, his parents, his teachers and his brethren in God, may He be praised, the living and the dead. May God pardon the reader of this book who invokes Him to pardon the copyist. Amen. Amen. Amen. May the Lord of the Universe benefit with this book he who is worthy of reading it. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen. I beseech You O Lord of the Universe! May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, His family and companions and grant them abundant peace, until Judgement Day. Praise be to God alone. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ket. y. tḥineh Goyṭin : manuscript.
record.note: Title from spine.
"Izṭ tsu geherig la-isheh ḥshuveh ṿeha-tsnueh ṿeha-ḥsideh ṿe-eyshes̀ ḥayel Mores̀ Yaṭel eyshes̀ ha-aluf k.h. Lipman Goyṭeyn nikhtav bi-shenat 579 li-f. ḳ."--Unnumbered page 1.
"Izṭ tsu geherig la-ishah ḥashuvah ha-tsenuʻah ṿeha-ḥasidah ṿe eshet ḥayil Marat Yaṭil eshet ha-aluf k.h. Lipman Goyṭin nikhtav bi-shenat 579 li-f. ḳ."--Unnumbered page 1.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

record.title: Collegium practicum privatum ad Johan. Fernelij pathologiam : manuscript.
record.note: Bookplate of John Hamilton, Baron Belhaven on front pastedown.
Title from first page.
Binding: late 17th-century? sprinkled calf; edges speckled in red.

record.title: Literary titan : the emergence of Frank Waters : critical essays : printout / edited by Alexander Blackburn and John Nizalowski.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: Of God : manuscript.
record.note: The first leaves of the volume contain a page of quotations from Hill's published work in a second unidentified hand, followed by three pages of geometrical definitions in Latin in the same hand. These are followed by two pages of notes in English in a third unidentified hand, apparently notes on sermon texts.
Additional description and transcript in bibliographical file. For more information, consult the appropriate curator.
Title from spine.
Spine title lettered on spine: "38. Of God. /ms."
Bookplate of James Stevens-Cox on front pastedown. Unidentified auction catalogue description, annotated, on front pastedown.
Signature of Joannes Junius (Joannes Casimir Junius, 1582-1624) on torn first page.
Manuscript foliated in a later hand, in pencil, 1-51.
Binding: contemporary limp parchment.

record.title: Annales du Skat : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page.
Statement on spine : "Tenues par Marguerite De Mot-Giron, secrétaire ; Laure Lorthioir-De Mot, secrétaire adjointe".
In two notebooks bound together in cloth by a former owner, with a presentation inscription to Nicole Graux-De Mot.

record.title: Philip Papillon themes and poems : manuscript.
record.note: Bookplate. late 19th-century bookplate of Thomas Papillon, Esq.
Possibly contemporary pagination in ink.
Binding: modern half sheep over marbled boards.

record.title: Queries concerning a treaty : manuscript.
record.note: Title from caption.
Tipped in before front flyleaf: typed letter, signed, from R. W. Hunt to "Dear Sir," Oxford, 1958 October 30. Discusses the possibility that the unknown author of the manuscript was Presbyterian.
Bookplate of J. G. Hodgson on front pastedown.
Binding: late 19th-century maroon morocco.

record.title: William Hodgett account book : manuscript.
record.note: Annotation on front pastedown: "Master Will.m Hodgetts Booke of accompts."
Annotation on back cover, in a later hand: "no use but curious. Master Will.m Hodgetts book of accompts."
Binding: contemporary parchment wallet binding, with brass clasp and turn clip.

record.title: Les trois imposteurs : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page.
Binding: 18th-century full calf, treated: six-compartment spine, gilt. Red leather spine tag: Les trois impost.

record.title: Samuel Beale collection of precedents : manuscript.
record.note: Ownership inscription on front pastedown: Sam. Beale. March 1788.
Binding: contemporary? reverse quarter calf over parchment boards. Red spine tag reads: Precedent.

record.title: 880-03 Fatḥ al-qarīb al-mujīb fī sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb : manuscript / Ibn Qāsim al-Ghazzī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh tabarrukan bi-Fātiḥat al-Kitāb li-annahā ibtidāʼ kull amr dhī bāl wa-khātimat kull duʻāʼ mujāb wa-ākhir daʻwá al-muʼminīn fī al-Jannah dār al-thawāb, aḥmaduhu an waffaqa man arāda min ʻibādih lil-tafaqquh fī al-dīn ʻalá wifq murādih, wa-uṣallī wa-usallimu ʻalá afḍal khalqihi Muḥammad Sayyid al-Mursalīn, al-qāʼil 'Man yurid Allāh bi-hi khayran yufaqqihhu fī al-dīn' wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi muddata dhikr al-dhākirīn wa-sahw al-ghāfilīn. Wa-baʻd, hādhā kitāb fī ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār wa-al-tahdhīb wa-ḍaʻtuhu ʻalá al-kitāb al-musammá bi-al-Taqrīb li-yantfiʻa bi-hi al-muḥtāj min al-mubtadiʼīn li-furūʻ al-sharīʻah wa-al-dīn ... wa-iʻlam annahu yūjadu fī baʻḍ nusakh hādhā al-kitāb fī ghayr khuṭbatih: Laqad sammaytuhu tāratan bi-al-Taqrīb wa-tāratan bi-Ghāyat al-akhtiṣār, wa-li-dhālika sammaytuhu bi-ismayn, aḥaduhumā Fatḥ al-qarīb al-mujīb fī sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb, wa-al-thānī al-Qawl al-mukhtār fī sharḥ Ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār ..."
Secundo folio: wa-askanahu aʻlá farādīs.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 17.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "al-Taqrīb" in red; numerous notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Fatḥ al-qarīb al-mujīb fī sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb lil-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah Ibn Qāsim nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātih wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min ṣāliḥ daʻawātih. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak fī 11 shahr Rajab al-mubārak, sanat 1263, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muṣṭafá ibn Aḥmad al-Jaʻfarī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban. Allāhumma ighfir la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of this book was completed on blessed Thursday, the 11th of the blessed month of Rajab, the year 1263 [25 June, 1847], by Aḥmad al-Jaʻfarī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban. May God forgive him, his parents and Muslim men and women. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Qurrat al-ʻayn li-sharḥ Waraqāt Imām al-Ḥaramayn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥaṭṭāb.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-fahhāmah, muftī al-Muslimīn bi-balad Allāh al-amīn, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah Muḥammad al-Ḥaṭṭāb al-Mālikī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna Kitāb al-Waraqāt fī ʻilm uṣūl al-fiqh lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah, ṣāḥib al-taṣānīf al-mufīdah, Abī al-Maʻālī ʻAbd al-Malik Imām al-Ḥaramayn, kitāb ṣaghura ḥajmuh, wa-kathura ʻilmuh, wa-ʻaẓuma nafʻuh, wa-ẓaharat barakatuh, wa-qad sharaḥahu jamāʻah min al-ʻulamāʼ ... wa-min aḥsan shurūḥihi sharḥ Shaykhinā al-ʻAllāmah al-mufīd Jalāl al-Dīn Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, fa-innahu kathīr al-fawāʼid wa-al-nukat, wa-qad ishtaghala bi-hi al-ṭalabah wa-intafaʻū bi-hi, illā annahu li-farṭ al-ījāz qāraba an yakūna min jumlat al-alghāz ... fa-istakhartu Allāh taʻālá fī sharḥ al-Waraqāt bi-ʻibārah wāḍiḥah munabbihah ʻalá al-sharḥ al-madhkūr wa-fawāʼidih bi-ḥaythu yakūnu hādhā al-sharḥ sharḥan lil-Waraqāt wa-lil-sharḥ al-madhkūr ... wa-sammaytuhu Qurrat al-ʻayn li-sharḥ Waraqāt Imām al-Ḥaramayn ..."
Secundo folio: bi-ḥaythu yakūnu hādhā al-sharḥ.
16.5 x 25 cm; written surface: 8 x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "Waraqāt Imām al-Ḥaramayn" in purple; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi laylat al-Sabt, 8 Muḥarram, sanat 1298."
Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on Saturday night, 8 Muḥarram, 1298 [11 December, 1880]"

record.title: 880-02 Ḍawʼ al-maʻālī li-Badʼ al-amālī : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān Muḥammad al-Qārī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī wajaba wujūd dhātih, wa-thabuta karam wujūdih wa-shuhūd ṣifātih, wa-ẓahara afʻāluhu al-ḥamīdah fī ṣaḥāʼif maṣnūʻātih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá zubdat makhlūqātih wa-ʻumdat mawjūdātih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-atbāʻih, fī ḥarakātihi wa-sakanātih. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-multajī ilá ḥaram Rabbihi al-Bārī ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān ibn Muḥammad al-Qārī: Lammā sharaʻtu fī sharḥ al-Fiqh al-akbar lil-Imām al-aʻẓam wa-al-humām al-aqdam, kāna fī nīyatī wa-ṭawīyatī an yakūna mukhtaṣaran ... fa-sanaḥa bi-bālī wa-ḥālī an aṣnaʻa sharḥan mūjazan ʻalá Qaṣīdat Badʼ al-amālī ... wa-sammaytuhu Ḍawʼ al-maʻālī li-Badʼ al-amālī ..."
Secundo folio: li-taraqqī ḥālī wa-sababan.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound, in six quires.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "Badʼ al-amālī" and markigs in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Ḍawʼ al-maʻālī li-Badʼ al-amālī li-Mullā ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān Muḥammad al-Qārī fī ʻilm al-tawḥīd, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
At the upper margins of folios 1b-2a, an ownership statement in the name of Jarkas Shaykh Ḥasan Efendinin.

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with the commentary on verse: "Wa-lil-daʻawāti taʼthīrun balīghun // wa-qad yanfīhi aṣḥābu al-ḍalāli. al-Daʻawāt bi-fatʹḥatayn, jamʻ al-daʻwah, bi-maʻná al-duʻāʼ, wa-al-maʻná anna li-daʻawāt al-muṭīʻīn lillāh tathīran balīghan fī ṣarf al-qaḍāʼ al-muʻallaq dūna al-mubram, li-qawlihi taʻālá: 'Udʻūnī astajib lakum', wa-li-qawlihi ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ..."

record.title: 880-02 Alfīyat al-taṣawwuf : manuscript / Muṣṭafá ibn Kamāl al-Dīn al-Bakrī al-Khalwatī al-Ṣiddīqī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 2b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-faqīru lil-Ghanī Muṣṭafá // najlu Abī Bakrin wa-sibṭu al-Muṣṭafá. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi al-ʻalī al-shāni // mā shana ahla al-ḥubbi yawman shānī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ushhidu Allāha bi-annī ashhadu.
15.5 x 21.7 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 9 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with headings and markigs in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements as follows: "Tamallakahu muḥarriruhu al-ḥaqīr Khalīl ibn Muḥammad Makkī bi-ṭarīq al-shirāʼ fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat 1165 [February/March, 1752]". "Thumma dakhala fī nawbat al-faqīr ʻAlī Bashīr tābiʻ ustādhihi al-Quṭb al-Ḥifnī."
On folios 1b-2a: An index of contents (28 chapters): "Fihristu mā fīhā min al-fuṣūli // lā bariḥat tudnī ḥimá al-wuṣūli."
On the margin of folio 2b: "Qūbilat ʻalá muʼallifihā."
At head of folio 2b: "Hādhihi Alfīyat al-taṣawwuf, raḥima Allāh munshiʼuhā wa-ghafara la-hu Āmīn. M."
On the margin of folio 72a: "Balaghat muqābalatan bi-ḥasab al-ṭāqah [...] wa-mannih. Min Allāh narjū al-[iʻānah].

On the margin of folio 72a: A supplimentary verse which states that the treatise was composed in Cairo (Egypt): Tamma bayāḍuhā bi-Miṣr al-Qāhirah // lā baraḥat li-man yashīnu qāhirah. Ṣaḥḥ."

Colophon: "Tamma bayāḍuhā bi-Bayt al-Maqdisi // alladhī ʻalá al-taqwá muʼassasi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih ʻalá yad afqar al-wará Yaḥyá ibn Ṣalāḥ al-Dīn ibn Haybat Allāh ibn Aḥmad ibn Ṣalāḥ al-Dīn al-Fityānī al-Maqdisī, al-Imām bi-al-Ṣakhrah al-Musharrafah."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied at Bayt al-Maqdis [Jerusalem] // which is founded on piety. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. It is completed by the praise of God and his abundant favor by the poorest of the people, Yaḥyá ibn Ṣalāḥ al-Dīn ibn Haybat Allāh ibn Aḥmad ibn Ṣalāḥ al-Dīn al-Fityānī al-Maqdisī, al-Imām bi-al-Ṣakhrah al-Musharrafah."

record.title: 880-02 Bushrá al-kaʼīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Hādhā juzʼun laṭīf wa-sammaytuhu Bushrá al-kaʼīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb, lakhkhaṣtuhu min kitābī al-kabīr alladhī allaftuhu fī aḥwāl al-Barzakh, qaṣartuhu ʻalá al-bushrá bi-mā yalqāhu al-muʼmin ʻinda mawtihi wa-fī qabrihi min al-takrīm wa-al-tarḥīb, wa-billāh al-tawfīq ..."
Secundo folio: Allāh ʻlayhi wa-sallam.
14.5 x 20.2 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with central medallion; front cover and flap torn off.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; with headings and markings in red; catchwords.
On the front of the preliminary leaf an erased ownership statement.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Bushrá al-kaʼīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb, taʼlīf Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-kāmil, al-rāsikh al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, al-ṣādiq al-khālid, al-Shaykh Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī, aʻāda Allāh taʻālá ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakātih. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
At the head of title on folio 1a, an endowment statement: "Hādhā al-kitāb waqf lillāh taʻālá."

On folio 1b: Three ownership statements: "Mulk al-Sayyid Yūsuf al-Ḥasanī al-Mālikī;" an erased ownership statement dated 5 Muḥarram, 1183 Hijrī (Thursday, 11 May, 1769); another erased ownership statement.

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb wa-al-ḥamdu li-Rabbinā al-Wahhāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad. Wa-kāna al-farāgh ʻan kitābat hādhā al-juzʼ al-mubārak yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, fī 22 shahr Jumādá al-Awwal, wa-dhālika fī sanat 1095, ʻalá yad kātibihi, afqar al-ʻibād ilá al-Mawlá al-Ḥaqq, ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed. Praise be to our Abundant Giving Lord. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad. The copy of this blessed volume was completed on blessed Thursday, 22 Jumādá al-Awwal, 1095 [27 April, 1684] by ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq, the poorest of the worshipers of our True Lord, may God forgive him and his parents."

record.title: 880-02 al-Shifā bi-taʻrīf ḥuqūq al-Muṣṭafá : manuscript / ʻIyāḍ ibn Mūsá ibn ʻIyāḍ al-Yaḥṣubī.
record.note: Title from folio 5a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-awḥad, al-ʻallāmah al-muḥaqqiq al-mutqin, Abū al-Faḍl ʻIyāḍ ibn Mūsá ibn ʻIyāḍ al-Yaḥṣubī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-munfarid bi-ismihi al-asmā [al-asmá], al-mukhtaṣṣ bi-al-mulk al-aʻazz al-aḥmá, alladhī laysa dūnahu muntahá wa-lā warāʼahu marmá, al-ẓāhir lā takhayyulan wa-wahman, wa-al-bāṭin taqddusan lā ʻadman ..."
Secundo folio: fī kitābihi al-maʻrūf bi-Qalāʼid al-ʻiqyān.
17.5 x 25.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 17 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with central medallion on both covers.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with headings in red; the first seventy leaves have numerous notes and commentaries in different hands; some leaves are affected by mold; some wormholes on the margins without loss of text; no catchwords.
On the leaf glued to the front cover, a borrowing statement, as follows: "ʻĀriyah ʻinda al-faqīr al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Bāqī ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Mughayzil."
On folio 1a: An erased ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ..."
On folios 1a-2a: A biography of the author: "Tarjamat al-Qāḍī ʻIyāḍ, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih."

On folio 3a: "Kitāb al-Shifā bi-taʻrīf ḥuqūq al-Muṣṭafā, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām [... ... ...] ʻIyāḍ ibn Mūsá ibn ʻIyāḍ al-Yaḥṣubī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh."

On the upper left corner of folio 3a, an ownership statement: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Mannān. Malakahu min faḍl Allāh taʻālá wa-luṭfih, ʻabduhu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Ramaḍān ibn Mūsá al-ʻUṭayfī al-Ḥanafī, ghafar Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn." Probably: ʻUṭayfī, Ramaḍān ibn Mūsá ibn Maḥmūd (1610-1684). A Ḥanafī scholar from Damascus, Syria (See: Ziriklī, al-Aʻlām 3:33).
On folio 3a: Several erased ownership statements and two illegible seals.
On folio 5a: "... tarjamtuhu bi-al-Shifā bi-taʻrīf ḥuqūq al-Muṣṭafá."

On folio 216b: An ownership statement: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāll. Bi-tārīkh thāmin Shawwāl sanat [illegible words] intaqala ilá mulk kātibihi ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad Imām al-Sirājīyah [could not be identified]."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-maʻūnatihi wa-luṭfih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the praise of God, His help and His benevolence. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family. God suffices us, He is the best advocate."

record.title: 880-03 Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ghānim al-Maqdisī.
record.note: Title of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār from folio 3a.
Title of Naẓm Muthallath Quṭrub supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah lisān al-fuṣaḥāʼ wa-al-mutakallimīn ʻIzz al-Dīn Ghānim ibn ʻAbd al-Salām al-Maqdisī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh wa-jaʻala al-Jannah mathwāh: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-baʻīd fī qurbih al-qarīb fī buʻdih, al-mutaʻālī fī rafīʻ majdih ʻan al-shayʼ wa-ḍiddih, alladhī awjada bi-qudratihi al-wujūd baʻda an kāna ʻadaman, wa-awjada kull mawjūd ḥukman, wa-jaʻala al-ʻaql baynahumā ḥakaman ..."
Secundo folio of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār: wa-mā yukābiduhu min wijdān.

Incipit of Naẓm Muthallath Quṭrub: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā Rabbī yassir yā karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi alladhī hadānā // li-millati al-Islām wa-ijtabānā ... Wa-baʻda taslīmī ʻalá khayri nabī // naẓamtu min Muthallathāt Quṭrubi. Urjūzatan ladhīdhatan fī al-mashrabi // wa-zidtuhā min kutubin ṭiwāli ..."
Secundo folio of Naẓm Muthallath Quṭrub: "Taḥīyat al-nāsi hiya al-salāmu.
15 x 20 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In reddish blue cardboard binding.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with headings and markings in red and green; catchwords.

On front cover a statement in Arabic and English by Duncan Black Macdonald, 1863-1943, professor of Semitic languages at Hartford Theological Seminary, as follows: "Kashf al-asrār fī ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār li-ʻIzz al-Dīn al-Maqdisī. Bought at Damascus, Aug. 1908. D.B. Macdonald. Hartford."

On folio 1a: "Ḥasbiya Allāh. Kitāb al-Mukhtār li-kashf al-asrār fī munāqashat al-ṭuyūr wa-al-azʹhār lil-shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah ʻIzz al-Dīn Ghānim ibn ʻAbd al-Salām, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, wa-ʻafá ʻanhumā."
On folio 3a: "... wa-sammaytuhu: Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār ..."
Colophon of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār: "Tammat nuskhat hādhā al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb fī awāsiṭ shahr Jumādá al-Ākhir, sanat sabʻ wa-sittīn wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār: "The copy of this book was completed by the help of the Benevolent King, in the middle of the month of Jumādá al-Ākhir, 1067 [31 March, 1657]."

Colophon of Naẓm Muthallath Quṭrub: " Tammat wa-bi-al-khayr ʻammat ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr Ḥusayn ibn Munlā Yūsuf al-Naqshabandī [?], ʻufiya ʻanhumā. Balagha al-muqābalah ḥasba al-ṭāqah wa-al-imkān. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of Naẓm Muthallath Quṭrub: "It is completed. May it be wide-spread with goodness, by the hand of the poor and despised, who confesses his inability and shortcoming, Ḥusayn ibn Munlā Yūsuf al-Naqshabandī [?], may they both be pardoned. It was collated to the best of [my] ability, as far as possible. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Bahjat al-ḥusn al-waḥīd ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / Aḥmad al-Mīhī al-Shabīnī al-Shāfiʻī al-Nuʻmānī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ḥallá ʻarāʼis al-tawḥīd fī ḥaḍrat al-wujūd, wa-ḥallá nafāʼis al-taghrīd fī rawḍat al-shuhūd, al-wāḥid al-maʻbūd alladhī naṭaqat bi-waḥdānīyatih ʻajāʼib maṣnūʻātih, al-fard al-ṣamad alladhī aṭbaqat ʻalá ṣamadānīyatihi gharāʼib mubdaʻātih ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-mudhnib al-awwāh ... Aḥmad al-Mīhī al-Shabīnī al-Shāfiʻī al-Nuʻmānī ... Inna naẓm al-ʻAllāmah al-quṭb al-rabbānī al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá Sayyidī Ibrāhīm al-Laqqānī, nisbah ilá Laqānah, baldah shahīrah bi-Iqlīm al-Buḥayrah alladhī anshaʼahu bi-ishārat shaykh al-tarbiyah fī al-taṣawwuf, Sayyidī Aḥmad ʻArab al-Sharnūbī ... al-musammī dhālika al-naẓm bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd ... wa-qad kuntu waḍaʻtu ʻalayhā ḥāshiyah badīʻat al-mabānī, laṭīfat al-maʻānī, thumma fī sanat thamān wa-khamsīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf ... ṣaraftu al-himmah ilá tabyīḍihā ... wa-sammaytuhā Bahjat al-ḥusn al-waḥīd ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd ..."
Secundo folio: al-Nuʻmānī anālahu Allāh.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound; wrapped in a sheet of paper; in twenty numbered quires.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with headings, keywords and markings in red; catchwords.

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhā: Tammat yawm al-Jumʻah fī thānī shahr Ramaḍān min sanat 1258, thamāniyah wa-khamsīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, wa-dhālika min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The author of the treatise said: It was completed on Friday, 2 Ramaḍān, 1258 [7 October, 1842] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and peace be upon him."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma raqmuhu ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad walad Sulaymān al-Warraqī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-aḥbābihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Yawm al-Jumʻah Ṣ [?], Sanat sittah wa-sabʻīn wa-m[iʼatayn wa-alf]."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The treatise was copied by the poorest of the poor and the most needy to God, may He be praised, Muḥammad walad Sulaymān al-Warraqī, may God pardon him, his parents, his loved ones and the Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Universe, on Friday Ṣ [?], [12]76, [1859 or 1860]."

record.title: 880-01 Ḥawāshin ʻalá Sharḥ al-Ujhūrī li-naẓmihi Faḍāʼil Ramaḍān : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan al-tābiʻīn wa-man tabiʻahum bi-iḥsān ilá yawm al-dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi ḥawāshī ʻalá sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Ujhūrī al-Mālikī li-naẓmihi li-Faḍāʼil Ramaḍān, jamaʻtuhā min hawāmish katabahā bi-yadihi Shaykhunā al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Madābighī, ʻalayhi saḥāyib al-raḥmah wa-al-riḍwān, ʻalá hāmish nuskhatihi, wa-min taqrīr Shaykhinā al-Shaykh ʻAṭīyah al-Ujhūrī, ḥafiẓahu Allāh, wa-min kutub al-Tafsīr, wa-al-Ḥadīth, wa-al-Fiqh. Wa-Allāh al-masʼūl an yanfaʻa bi-hā, ka-mā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihā ..."
Secundo folio: nidāʼ madḥ ka-yā ayyuhā al-Nabī.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 17.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; in five numbered quires.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
Text folios 1b-44b; folios 45-48 are blank.
On folio 1a: 9 verses from three poems (2, 2, 5 verses) praising "fiqh" (Islamic law) and advising on studying it.

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with "... wa-idhā naẓara Allāh ilá ʻabdihi, fa-inna al-murād jamīʻ al-khalq, kamā fahimahu al-muṣannif, wa-iḥtāja ilá al-suʼāl wa-al-jawāb, fa-inna ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Qudūrī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Qudūrī.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb al-Ṭahārah. Qāla Allāh taʻālá: Yā ayyuhā alladhīn āmanū idhā qumtu ilá al-ṣalāh fa-ighsilū wujūhakum wa-aydiyakum ilá al-marāfiq wa-imsaḥū bi-ruʼūsikum wa-arjulikum ilá al-kaʻbayn. Fa-faraḍa al-ṭahārah ..."
Secundo folio: min nawmihi wa-tasmiyat.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather binding.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; text fully vocalized; catchwords.
On folios 1b-2b: An index of contents.
On folios 197b-198a: Quotations from Abū Ḥanīfah (died 767 or 768) and the Ḥadīth about the leader in prayer (when to pray, or not to pray, behind him), and about he who neglects prayer.
Text folios 3b-197a.

Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh, al-Malik al-Wahhāb, wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Ghafara Allāh kātib [li-kātib] hādhā al-kitāb wa-li-man naẓara [ilayhi] bi-al-khayr wa-al-ṣawāb, wa-wassaʻa ʻalayhi al-niʻmah wa-al-arzāq, wa-adkhala [wa-adkhalahu] al-Jannah, fa-innahu mushtāq, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-mudhnib al-muḥtāj, qalīl al-ʻamal kathīr al-amal, qalīl al-iḥsān kathīr al-ʻiṣyān, wa-al-rāj raḥmat Rabbihi al-ʻazīz al-laṭīf, Qanbar ibn Khalīl, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. Wa-qad fāragha hādhā al-kitāb al-musammá "al-Qudūrī" fī yawm al-Jumʻah, waqta al-ḍuḥá, fī maḥrūsat Ḥalab, fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, min shuhūr sanat tisʻ wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King, but God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. May God forgive the author of this book, and him who looks at it favorably and positively. May God bestow His grace upon him, enrich his livelihood and admit him into Paradise which he ardently disires. Copied by the poor and despised slave, the sinner and the needy, who does little and hopes for much, of little charity and abundant rebellion, he who longs for the mercy of his mighty and gentle Lord, Qanbar ibn Khalīl, may God forgive him and his parents and treat him and them favorably. The copy of this book titled "al-Qudūrī" was completed on Friday forenoon, at protected Aleppo, in the month of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 1009 [October, 1600]."

record.title: 880-02 Nūr al-hidāyah wa-al-ʻirfān fī sirr al-rābiṭah wa-al-tawajjuh wa-Khatm al-Khawājakān : manuscript / Muḥammad Asʻad ibn Maḥmūd al-Khālidī al-ʻUthmānī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ayyada al-Sharīʻah al-Aḥmadīyah bi-ẓuhūr al-zumrah al-taqīyah al-naqīyah, ahl al-akhlāq al-Muḥammadīyah, fa-aḥyá bi-him al-arwāḥ al-ṭāhirah al-zakīyah ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu asīr al-dhunūb ... Muḥammad Asʻad ibn al-Ustādh al-Shaykh Maḥmūd al-Khālidī al-ʻUthmānī, al-mulaqqab bi-al-Ṣāḥib ... inna al-wird al-maʻrūf ʻinda sādātinā al-aslāf al-Naqshabandīyah wa-qādatinā al-aṣḥāb al-Khālidīyah ... al-musammá bi-al-Khatm al-Khawājakānī al-muḥtawī ʻalá baʻḍ ayāt min al-Qurʼān al-Karīm wa-al-Sabʻ al-Mathānī, huwa laysa fī al-ḥaqīqah min sharāʼiṭ hādhihi al-ṭarīqah al-anīqah, bal huwa min awrād akābir mashāyikhihā al-kirām ... al-Khawājah ʻAbd al-Khāliq al-Ghajdawānī ..."
Secundo folio: Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 11.2 x 17.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In makeshift cardboard binding; folio 1 is glued to the back of the front cover.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some corrections and comments on the margins; text within double red frames; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihā ʻan nuskhah bi-khaṭṭ muʼallifihā al-fāḍil al-amjad wa-al-fard al-awḥad, al-Ṣāḥibī al-Naqshabandī, al-Shaykh Muḥammad Asʻad, lā zāla baḥran lil-mustafīd, wa-rābiṭah fī īṣāl al-ṭālib wa-al-murīd, bi-qalam aḥqar al-anām, kathīr al-dhunūb wa-al-āthām, al-Sayyid Muḥammad ʻAlī al-Kīlānī, al-shahīr bi-al-Ẓibyānī, khādim al-fuqarāʼ al-kirām, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu wa-ʻan wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn, wa-dhālika fī al-yawm al-sādis ʻashar min shahr Allāh al-Muḥarram, sanat khams wa-thalāthimiʼah wa-alf min Hijrat man khaṣṣahu Allāh bi-akmal waṣf."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was reproduced from the autograph of its distinguished, prominent and illustrious author, al-Ṣāḥibī al-Naqshabandī, al-Shaykh Muḥammad Asʻad, who continues to be a sea of knowledge for the seekers and a means for connecting the student and the devotee, by the most despised of creatures, he who is full of sins and vices, al-Sayyid Muḥammad ʻAlī al-Kīlānī, al-shahīr bi-al-Ẓibyānī, servant of the noble poor [the sufis], may God forgive him, his parents and Muslims, on 16 Muḥarram, 1305 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [4 October, 1887], on whom God has bestowed the most perfect distinction."

record.title: 880-02 al-Anwār al-Azʹharīyah al-muḥīṭah bi-al-khuṭab al-minbarīyah : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Badawī al-Naḥḥās al-Shāfiʻī al-Azʹharī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī sharrafa aʻwād al-mābir wa-maḥārīb al-masājid bi-dhikrihi, wa-atḥafa khuṭabāʼ al-anām bi-tuḥaf imtinānih wa-mazīd birrih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, khayr man khaṭaba wa-amma, wa-anāra al-qulub bi-waʻẓihi wa-zajrih. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu muḥtāj Rabbihi al-qawī, Ibrāhīm ibn Badawī al-Naḥḥās al-Shāfiʻī al-Azʹharī: Hādhā mā ishtaddat ilayhi ḥājat al-khuṭabāʼ wa-al-qāṣirīn min amthālī, jamaʻtuhu ayyāma niyābatī li-khiṭābat al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar, manbaʻ al-ʻulūm wa-martaʻ arbāb al-manṭūq wa-al-mafhūm, al-ḥaram al-Miṣrī, al-aqmar al-anwar ..."
Secundo folio: innahā la-martabah ṣaʻbat al-irtiqāʼ.
17.5 x 25 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 15-22 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound; in two quires.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; catchwords.

On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Anwār al-Azʹharīyah al-muḥīṭah bi-al-khuṭab al-minbarīyah, wa-zidtuhu baʻda al-tamām khuṭaban sanīyah muḥtāj ilayhā al-ṭālib ʻinda ʻurūḍ al-ḥawādith al-zamānīyah, wa-khatamtu kull khuṭbah minhā bi-āyah min Kitāb Allāh taʻālá, li-takūna la-hā misk al-khitām wa-ishārah ilá mā yutlá baʻda al-Fātiḥah fī al-ṣalāh ..."

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with part of the fifth sermon for the month of Muḥarram: "... wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluhu wa-ṣafīyuhu wa-khalīluhu, al-makhṣūṣ bi-jawāmiʻ al-kalim. Allāhumma, fa-ṣalli wa-sallim wa-bārik ʻalá hādhā al-Nabī al-karīm, wa-al-Rasūl al-sayyid al-sanad al-ʻaẓīm, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, wa-man salaka ṭarīqatahu wa-lazam ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Kastalī ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah lil-Taftāzānī : manuscript / Muṣliḥ al-Dīn Muṣṭafá ibn Maḥmūd al-Qasṭallānī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu li-man wajaba la-hu al-wujūd kamā wajaba la-hu al-sujūd, wa-fāḍa bi-hi al-jūd fa-fāḍa ʻanhu kull mawjūd, ʻalá mā sharaḥa ṣadrī li-ʻaqāʼid al-Islām wa-ḥaqāʼiq al-sharāʼiʻ wa-al-aḥkām, wa-al-ṣalāh adhká mā kān ʻalá ashraf man wujida fī buqʻat al-imkān, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-bararah al-kirām ... Wa-baʻd, fahādhā ʻiqd min al-farāʼid ʻallaqtuhu ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid lil-ʻAllāmah Masʻūd al-Taftāzānī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-mā yanbanī ʻalá al-qūwah al-ʻamalīyah.
12.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 13.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding.

In small ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; the phrases of "Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid" preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying), in red; many notes and comments on the first twenty-three leaves; catchwords.
On folio 1a: Several erased ownerships; one dated 1251 Hijrī (1835/1836).
At the head of folio 1a: "Kastal li-Ḥāshiyat Khayālī."
Colophon: "Ittafaqa al-farāgh min taḥrīrihi. Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá."
Translation of the colophon: "The copy is completed. The book ended by the help of God, may He be praised."

record.title: 880-02 Risālat fī al-Basmalah : manuscript / Ismāʻīl ibn Ghunaym al-Jawharī.
record.note: Title from label on front cover.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah ʻalá al-qawm al-kāfirīn. Ḥamdan li-māniḥ al-bayān wa-fātiḥ abwāb al-tibyān, wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman ʻalá man amara bi-tajwīd al-Basmalah, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-ḥāʼizīn fī kull faḍl li-ḥamdih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá al-Mawlá al-kabīr Ismāʻīl ibn al-Shaykh Ghunaym al-Jawharī, futiḥa [ʻalayhi] al-tawfīq al-bāṭinī wa-al-ẓāhirī: qad waḍaʻtu fīmā maḍá risālah tataḍammanu mā ishtamalat ʻlayhi al-Basmalh min al-mabāḥith al-sharīfah wa-taḥtawī ʻalá mā fīhā min al-fawāʼid al-ghazīrah wa-al-maqāṣid al-munīfah, wa-qad raʼaytu an akhtaṣirahā min ahamm al-muhimmāt li-yasʹhula taʻāṭiyahā ʻalá amthālī min ulī al-raghabāt, ṭāliban min Allāh al-thawāb wa-al-fawz yawm al-maʼāb ..."
Secundo folio: al-nahī ʻan ittibāʻih.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17.5 cm; 23-26 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding with flap.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the label at the front cover: "Risālah fī al-Basmalah lil-Shaykh Ismāʻīl al-Ghunaymī al-Jawharī."
Folio 1 is blank; text folios 2a-8b.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārakah, sanat 1277, fī shahr al-Qaʻdah, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr Sulaymān ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad Lāmūnah, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Shabāsī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Friday, [date of the day not mentioned], the year 1277, of the month of al-Qaʻdah [May/June, 1861], by the poor copyist Sulaymān ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad Lāmūnah, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Shabāsī, may God pardon him, his parents and Muslims. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Jazāʼirīyah fī ʻilm al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAbd al-Salām al-Ṣaffūrī al-Shāfiʻī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī laysa fī al-wujūd illā dhātuh, wa-mā yurá min al-siwá fa-huwa afʻāluhu wa-ṣifātuh, wa-kāna wa-lā shayʼ maʻah, wa-huwa al-ān ʻalá mā ʻlayhi kān, fa-awjada kull shayʼ min lā shayʼ, bul qāla la-hu kun fa-kān ... Wa-baʻd, fa-inna ashraf al-ʻulūm ʻilm al-tawḥīd, li-annahu yubḥathu fīhi ʻan dhāt al-maʻbūd wa-ṣifātih ... wa-qad ṣunnifa fīhi kutub kathīrah, muṭawwalāt wa-mukhtaṣarāt, wa-aḥsan mā ṣunnifa min al-mukhtaṣarāt manẓūm al-Shaykh al-faqīh ʻalam al-aʻlām al-Sayyid Abī al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Jazāʼirī ... wa-qad sharaḥahu ... Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī al-Ḥasanī ... sharḥan aṭnaba fīhi wa-bālagha fī al-iṭnāb ... ghayra annahu min ziyādat al-iṭnāb yamallu minhu baʻḍ al-ṭullāb, fa-aḥbabtu an akhtaṣirah wa-aqtaṣir ʻalá al-maqṣūd alladhī lā budda minh ..."
Secundo folio: al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-huwa al-wāḥidu.
14.5 x 19 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound; in six unnumbered quires.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper, with the verses of "al-Manẓūmah al-Jazāʼirīyah" and markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Jazāʼirīyah fī ʻilm al-tawḥīd lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Zayn al-Dīn muftī al-Muslimīn, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, Abī Hurayrah ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Shaykh al-ʻallāmah Zayn al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Salām ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻUthmān ibn Nabhān al-Ṣūrī [al-Ṣaffūrī] al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

al-Manẓūmah al-Jazāʼirīyah starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-huwa al-wāḥidu al-azalī // subḥānahu jalla ʻan shabhin wa-ʻan mathalī ..." and ends with: "Wa-al-āli wa-al-ṣuḥbi thumma al-tābiʻīn lahum // mimman ʻani al-ḥaqqi wa-al-iḥsāni lam yaḥuli."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah min nuskhah saqīmah, yawm al-Thalāth, tāsiʻ Muḥarram al-ḥarām, sanat 1132, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Masīrī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was reproduced from a very bad copy, on Tuesday, 9 Muḥarram, 1132 [22 November, 1719], by the poor Aḥmad al-Masīrī, may God pardon him, his parents and Muslims."

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī al-tawḥīd : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn ʻalá al-qawm al-kāfirīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf al-mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá raḥmat rabbihi al-khabīr al-baṣīr Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī dhawī [dhū] al-taqṣīr: Ṭalaba minnī baʻḍ al-ikhwān, aṣlaḥa Allāh lī wa-lahum al-ḥāl wa-al-shān an aktuba risālah laṭīfah tashtamilu ʻalá ṣifāt al-Mawlá wa-aḍdādihā, wa-mā yajūzu fī ḥaqqihi taʻālá, wa-ʻalá mā yajūzu fī ḥaqq al-rusul, wa-mā yastaḥīlu fī ḥaqqihim wa-mā yajūz, fa-ajabtu li-dhālika, fa-qultu, wa-billāh al-tawfīq ..."
Secundo folio: wa-yajibu fī ḥaqqihi taʻālá.
12.3 x 18.7 cm; written surface: 7 x 12.2 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound; in one quire.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah fī al-tawḥīd li-Shaykhinā al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
On folios 6-8 are blank.
Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassara Allāh taʻālá min faḍlihi wa-karamih. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-thawāb [bi-al-ṣawāb] wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb."
Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what God, may He be praised, granted of his favor and generosity. God knows the truth better. To Him is the reference and returning."

record.title: 880-03 al-Mukhtār ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Aʻẓam : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Maḥmūd al-Mawṣilī.
record.note: Title from folio 3a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá jazīl naʻmāʼihi, aḥmaduhu ʻalá jalīl ālāʼih, wa-ashkuruhu ʻalá jamīl balāʼih, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh shahādatan uʻidduhā li-yawm liqāʼih, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabdahu wa-rasūlah, sayyidu rusulihi wa-khātim anbiyāʼih, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-aṣfiyāʼih, wa-aḥmaduhu ʻalá an jaʻalanī mimman salaka sunan sunnatihi wa-iqtafāhu, wa-warada sharīʻat sharʻihi fa-rawāh, ḥamda man ghamarathu niʻamuhu wa-ʻammathu ʻaṭāyāh ..."
Secundo folio: fa-ajabtuhu ilá ṭalabih.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 9 x 19 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; many notes and comments on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An index of contents.
At the head of folio 1a: "Kitāb Mukhtār."
On folios 1b-3a: Quotations from different sources and invocations, in different hands.

On folio 2a an ownership statement: "Malaka hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-rājī ʻafwa rabbihi al-qadīr, Yaḥyá ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Ḥamdān al-Tātilī al-Ḥasanī, fī Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 1132 [January/February, 1720]."
On folio 3a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Mukhtār ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Aʻẓam, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh."

At the head of folio 3b two verses of poetry attributed to al-Shaykh Fatʹḥ Allāh al-Baylūnī (probably Fatʹḥ Allāh ibn Maḥmūd al-Baylūnī, 1570-1632, an author and poet from Aleppo, Syria), praising the present book: "Lillāhi matnun fī al-matānati mufradu // talwī ilayhi ʻinānahā al-akhyāru. Yā man yarūmu tafaqquhan fī dīnihi // ʻawwil ʻalayhi fa-innahu al-Mukhtāru."
