Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Kharshī al-Mālikī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-muḥīṭ bi-khafīyāt al-ghuyūb, al-muṭṭaliʻ ʻalá sarāyir al-qulūb, al-mukhtaṣṣ bi-irādatihi kull maḥbūb wa-mawhūb ... Ammā baʻd, fa-inna al-ishtighāl bi-al-ʻilm min afḍal al-ṭāʻāt ... wa-qad kāna madhhab al-Imām Mālik ahlan wa-ḥaqīqan bi-dhālik. Wa-kāna aʻẓam mā ṣunnifa fīhi min al-mukhtaṣarāt, wa-aghná ʻan kathīr min al-muṭawwalāt "Mukhtaṣar" Mawlānā Abī al-Ḍiyāʼ Khalīl ibn Isʹḥāq ... wa-qad waḍaʻtu ʻalayhi sharḥan yaḥullu alfāẓah wa-yaḥtawī ʻalá taqyīdātih ..."
Secundo folio: Mawlānā Abī al-Ḍiyāʼ Khalīl.
16.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 11 x 16.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather binding with flap and central medallions.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "al-Mukhtaṣar" preceded by the letter "Ṣ" and the commentary by the letter "Sh" in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min Sharḥ Mawlānā wa-Ustādhinā al-ʻAllāmah al-baḥr al-fahhāmah al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Kharshī, nafaʻanā Allāh wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakātihi. Āmīn."

On folio 1b: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Malakahu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥājj ʻĀmir al-Salamūnī, yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, rābiʻ Rabīʻ Ākhir, sanat 1237 [29 December, 1821]". "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn Ḥasan ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥasan Abū Yūnus al-ʻAzzāwī."
On folio 499b: An ownership statement: "Nuqila ilá mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥasan Yūnus."

Colophon: "Tamma al-juzʼ al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-in shāʼa Allāh yalīhi mā baʻduhu, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá ʻafw rabbihi al-qadīr, al-faqīr Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Sulaymān al-Shalshalmūnī al-Azʹharī, ghafara Allāh la-hu ... Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-juzʼ al-mubārak yawm al-Ithnayn, thāmin ʻashar Muḥarram al-ḥarām, min shuhūr sanat 1130 [22 December, 1717]. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed part is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. It will be, God willing, followed by the remaining parts, by the poorest of the servants and the most needy to the forgiveness of his Almighty Lord, the poor Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Sulaymān al-Shalshalmūnī al-Azʹharī, may God pardon him ... This blessed part was copied on Monday, 18 Muḥarram, 1130 [22 December, 1717]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Nawādir al-Qalyūbī : manuscript / Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Qalyūbī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 11b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Kitāb Nawādir al-Qalyūbī. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala li-man waffaqa min ʻibādihi wāʻiẓan min nafsihi, wa-adhāqahu min kuʼūs sharābihi ḥalāwat unsihi, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá quṭb dāʼirat al-asmāʼ wa-al-ṣifāt Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad al-manʻūt bi-anwāʻ al-kamālāt wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-ashyāʻihi wa-aṣhārihi wa-anṣārihi wa-atbāʻihi alladhīna abrazū bi-ittibāʻihi mukhaddarāt al-maʻārif wa-al-farāʼid wa-aḥrazū nawādir al-laṭāʼif wa-al-fawāʼid, wa-ʻalá al-tābiʻīn la-hum bi-iḥsān fī kull waqt wa-awān. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā kitābun ṣaghura ḥajmuhu wa-ghazura nafʻuhu wa-sahula fahmuhu ... lil-Ustādh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah ... al-Shaykh Aḥmad Shihāb al-Dīn al-Ḥūfī thumma al-Qalyūbī ..."
Secundo folio: laṭīfah fāʼiqah wa-ʻibārāt bāriʻah.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 19 quires).
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in purple, green and yellow; catchwords.

On folios 1b-11a: A table of contents listing the titles of two-hundred and seventeen anecdotes: "Fihrist Nawādir al-Ustādh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Qalyūbī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."

On folio 11a: "Tarjamat muʼallif hādhā al-kitāb. Huwa Mawlānā al-Ustādh al-Qalyūbī, raḥimahu Allāh. Hādhihi Nawādir Mawlānā al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-qudwah al-fahhāmah, al-Ustādh al-Shaykh Aḥmad Shihāb al-Dīn al-Qalyūbī, raḥimahu Allāh raḥmatan wāsiʻah, wa-amaddanā min imdādātihi al-nāfiʻah wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. M."
On some leaves: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá."
Colophon: No colophon; text ends with: "... wa-ammā al-mamsūkhūn min banī Ādam fa-hum tisʻah wa-ʻishrūn ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Taʻrīfāt : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi tammim bi-al-khayr. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥaqqa ḥamdih wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr khalqih Muḥammad wa-ālih ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi taʻrīfāt jamaʻtuhā wa-iṣṭilāḥāt akhadhtuhā wa-rattabtuhā min kutub al-qawm ʻalá ḥurūf al-hijāʼ, min al-Alif wa-al-Bāʼ ilá al-Yāʼ, tasʹhīlan tanāwuluhā lil-ṭālibīn wa-taysīran taʻāṭīhā lil-rāghibīn. Wa-Allāh al-hādī wa-ʻalayhi iʻtimādī fī mabdaʼī wa-maʻādī. Bāb al-Alif wa-al-Bāʼ ..."
Secundo folio: T. al-Ittiḥād, taʻbīr [taṣyīr] al-dhātayn wāḥidah.
14 x 20.6 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding.
In good naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; many notes and comments on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb Ibrāhīm Afandī al-Mudarris ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm wa-yuraddu ilá makānihi bi-al-khzānah."
On the upper margin of some leaves: Endowment statements: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá".
Between folios 9b and 10a: A folded slip of proverbs and wisdom literature in Arabic poetry and prose.
On folios 66a-66b: Statements and calculations, in Ottoman Turkish, about the division of inheritance.
On folio 67b: Fatwas (legal opinions), in Ottoman Turkish, in the form of question and answer, about miscellaneous issues.

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh ʻan taswīd hādhihi al-nuskhah fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, fī yawm Shanbah, fī waqt al-ẓuhr, ʻalá yad ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the help of the Generous King. This copy was written in the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, on Saturday noon [date of the day and year not mentioned], by the feeble servant Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf, may God forgive him, his parents and all believers."

record.title: 880-02 al-Ifṣāḥ fī ʻaqd al-nikāḥ : manuscript / Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 8a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad Sayyid al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, alladhī uhdīnā bi-hi wa-bi-aṣḥābihi lil-farq bayna al-ḥalāl wa-al-ḥarām, wa-jaʻala al-nikāḥ min sunanihi li-yubāhiya bi-kathrat atbāʻih yawm al-zuḥām, wa-ḥarrama zawāj al-Jāhilīyah ʻalá al-dawām ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr Mawlānā al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī ... hādhā taʻlīq laṭīf fī al-nikāḥ ʻalá al-madhāhib al-arbaʻ, li-yakūna mutaʻāṭīhi ʻalá baṣīrah ... wa-sammaytuhu al-Ifṣāḥ fī ʻaqd al-nikāḥ ..."
Secundo folio: wa-shurūṭihi wa-al-bāb al-thānī.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: varies; 18-32 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folios 1b-6b are miscellaneous fatwas from different sources.
Text folios 7b-30a.

Colophon: "Tammat al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Ithnayn, arbaʻata ʻashar khalat min shahr Allāh al-Muḥarram, min shuhūr sanat 1278, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr Ismāʻīl al-shahīr bi-Banī al-Ṣaghīr, kāna Allāh fī ʻawnihi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed copy was completed on Monday, 14 Muḥarram, 1278 [22 July, 1861] by the poor who confesses his sin and inequity, Ismāʻīl al-shahīr bi-Banī al-Ṣaghīr, may God help him. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Bahjah al-Wardīyah : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Bāb al-Farāʼiḍ. Jamʻ farīḍah [... ...] ay muqaddarah, li-mā fīhā min al-sihām al-muqaddarah. Wa-al-farḍ lughatan al-taqdīr wa-sharʻan hunā naṣīb muqaddar lil-wārith ..."
Secundo folio: illā an yakūna ʻitqan.
18.5 x 26.5 cm; written surface: 13 x 20.5 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: In red leather binding with flap; central medallions within geometrical design on both covers.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; with the verses of "al-Bahjah al-Wardīyah" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a an endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad al-Bukhārī."
On folio 1a in pencil: "Sharḥ al-Bahjah al-Wardīyah."
Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu, raḥimahu Allāh: Wa-kāna tamāmuhu yawm al-Sabt, khāmis ʻashar Shawwāl, sanat sabʻ wa-sittīn wa-thamānimiʼah."
Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, may God have mercy upon him, said: It was completed on Saturday, 15 Shawwāl, 867 [12 July, 1463]."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi fī al-yawm al-mubārak al-thālith min Jumādá al-Awwal, sanat khams wa-arbaʻīn [wa-alf]. Wa-tamma ʻalá yad kātibih ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Bardalī [?], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-mashāyikhihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy was written on the blessed third day of Jumādá al-Awwal, the year 45 [1045 of the Hijrah] [15 October, 1635], by ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Bardalī [?], may God pardon him, his parents, his masters and the Muslims. Amen. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sullam : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khaṣṣ al-insān bi-al-manṭiq al-mufṣiḥ ʻammā fī al-ḍamīr min al-maknūnāt wa-afāḍ ʻalá riyāḍ ʻaqlihi ghayth saḥāb al-taṣawwurāt wa-al-taṣdīqāt ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī al-ʻafwa min al-Khabīr al-Laṭīf Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī al-dhalīl al-ḍaʻīf ibn Muḥammad al-Jīzāwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu jamīʻ al-masāwī: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān, aṣlaḥ Allāh lī wa-la-hu al-ḥāl wa-al-shān kitābatan badīʻah al-niẓām takshufu ʻan al-muqddimah al-shahīrah bi-al-Sullam al-lithām ..."
Secundo folio: al-ummah innamā huwa al-lafẓ.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 quires).
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Sullam" of al-Akhḍarī are preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh al-Bājūrī ʻalá matn al-Sullam."
Text folios 1a-26b; folios 27-30 are blank.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... inna al-mūṣil ilá al-taṣdīq yusammá ḥujjah, maʻa annahum ʻuqalāʼ, wa-kadhā yustafādu min kalām al-Shaykh al-Malawī, illā annahu qāla baʻda an fassara al-ʻuqalāʼ bi-arbāb hādhā ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala qulūb al-ʻulamāʼ samāwāt tatajallá fīhā shumūs al-maʻārif, wa-wassaʻa dawāyir afhāmihim fa-awlajahum qibāb al-mukhaddarāt min ʻarāyis al-maʻānī wa-al-laṭāyif, wa-ḥabāhum bi-ḥadāyiq al-ʻuqūl fa-tanāwalū thamarātihā, fa-aṣbaḥt āfāq ʻuqūlihim mushriqah bi-aqmār al-ʻulūm ... Ammā baʻd, fa-lammā waḍaʻtu al-urjūzah al-musammāh bi-al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq, wa-jāʼat bi-ḥamd Allāh jumaluhu kāfiyah wa-li-maqāṣid min fannihā ḥāwiyah, rāwadanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān min al-ṭalabah, akramahum Allāh, al-marrah baʻda al-marrah, ʻalá an aḍaʻa ʻalyahā sharḥan mufīdan ... fa-ajabtuhu li-dhālika ..."
Secundo folio: wa-jāʼat bi-ḥamd Allāh jumaluhu.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 numbered quires)
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of "al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq" in red ; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Akhḍarī ʻalá al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq nufiʻnā bi-hi. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows. 1. "Mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad Ruzayq (Zurayq) ... al-Mālikī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn." 2. "Nuqila bi-al-shirāʼ ilá mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Shabrāwī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn." 3. "Nuqila bi-al-shirāʼ ilá mulk al-faqīr Sālim Ḥasan al-Jurjāwī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayn [wa-li-wālidayhi] wa-li-kāffat al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... wa-lafẓ al-abrāj jamʻ qillah, wa-al-murād al-kathrah, li-annahā ithnay [ithnā] ʻashara burjan, taqṭaʻu al-Shams kull yawm darajah, wa-taqṭaʻu al-falak fī sanah wa-yakūnu ṭūl al-maylayn wa-qiṣaruhumā bi-ḥasab al-mayl al-Shimālī wa-al-Janūbī li-ittisāʻ al-qaws wa-ḍīqihi fī al-āfāq al-māʼilah allatī la-hā ʻirḍ, wa-ammā al-Qamar fa-yuqīmu fī kull burj laylatayn wa-thulthan wa-yaqṭaʻu al-falak fī ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Mārdīnī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aḥṣá kull al-ashyāʼ ʻadadan, wa-jaʻala al-mawāl li-man aʻṭá wa-ittaqá wa-ṣaddaqa bi-al-ḥusná saʻādatan sarmadā, wa-ʻalá man bakhula wa-istaghná wa-kadhdhaba bi-al-ḥusná kuʻūb shuʼm tūqiʻu fī al-radā ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu faqīr raḥmat rabbihi Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Mārdīnī: Hādhā taʻlīq ʻalá al-urjūzah al-Yāsamīnīyah fī ʻilm al-jabr mukhtaṣar jiddan, lam yasʼalnī fīhi aḥad, wa-innamā walaghtu fīhi min al-baṭālah wa-al-kasal hurūban min al-ishtighāl wa-al-malal ... wa-naʻattuhu bi-al-Lumaʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah ..."
Secundo folio: Sh. Masāʼil ʻilm al-jabr.
11.5 x 16.5 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 12 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire). The manuscript is wrapped in a folded sheet of paper which serves as a cover.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; the verses of "al-Yāsamīnīyah" are preceded with the letter "Ṣ" and the commentary with the letter "Sh" in red; some markings in red; some water damage without loss of text; the last leaf of the manuscript (12a-12b) was written by a different hand; catchwords.
The manuscript is wrapped in a folded sheet of paper taken probably from a ledger for recording agricultural data, and serves as a cover.
On folio 2a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah lil-Shaykh al-Imām Sibṭ al-Māridīnī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."

On folio 2a: Two verses of poetry which gives in "ḥisāb al-jummal" (alphabetical reckoning) the date of birth, death and age of the four Sunnī Islamic law scholars: Abū Ḥanīfah, Anas ibn Mālik, Ibn Ḥanbal and al-Shāfiʻī), and four verses attributed to al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī about giving his knowledge to those who deserve it.
Text folios 2b-12b.
Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā qaṣadnāh min hādhā al-taʻlīq. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Tamma naqluhā."
Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we aimed at from this commentary. Praise be to God alone. The copy is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Īsāghūjī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Dalajī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan li-man naṭaqat mawjūdātuhu bi-rubūbīyatih, wa-afāḍa ʻalá anwāʻ maṣnūʻātih ajnās al-niʻam biḥikmatih wa-raḥmatih, wa-ṣalá wa-sallama ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad ashraf al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-azkiyāʼ wa-al-tābiʻīn la-hum bi-iḥsān ilá yawm al-dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Dalajī: Hādhā taʻlīqun laṭīf ʻalá sharḥ Shaykh al-Islām li-matn Īsāghūjī, nāfiʻ in shāʼa Allāh li-man aḥsana nītatah wa-ṭahhara ṭawīyatah ..."
Secundo folio: bi-man aḥabbahu Allāh.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 10 x 17.5 cm; 23 lines per page.

Binding: Bound in yellow cardboard that used to be a printed cover for "Nahj al-balāghah" (edited by Muḥyī al-Dīn Khayyāṭ and printed by Muḥammad Kamāl Bakdāsh, date and place of publication missing; probably from the edition published in Beirut?, between 1900 and 1914); in 9 numbered quires (quires 5 and 6 are missing); at the head of each quire is written the word "Waqf" (endowment).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; the phrases of Shaykh al-Islām are preceded by the word "qawluhi" (his saying) in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Dalajī ʻalá Shaykh al-Islām fī al-manṭiq."

Colophon: "Wakāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā nahār al-Arbiʻāʼ li-sitt baqayn min shahr Ṣafar al-Khayr, sanat sabʻ wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Ibrāhīm al-Ṭūkhī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was written on Wednesday, six days remaining from the month of Ṣafar, 1207 [11 October, 1792], by Aḥmad al-Ṣabbāgh ibn Ibrāhīm ibn al-Ṭūkhī, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Akhbār Ibrāhīm ibn al-Mahdī wa-ukhtihi ʻUlayyah bint al-Mahdī wa-ashʻāruhumā : manuscript / jamʻ Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá al-Ṣūlī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá al-Ṣūlī: Hādhihi awrāq jamaʻtu fīhā akhbār Ibrāhīm ibn al-Mahdī wa-ukhtihi ʻUlayyah bint al-Mahdī wa-ashʻārahumā, fa-aqūlu: Ḥadathanī Yaḥyá ibn ʻAlī ʻan Aḥmad ibn Yaḥyá ibn Jābir, qāl ḥaddathanī Hibat Allāh ibn Ibrāhīm ibn al-Mahdī anna Muḥayyāh al-Ṭāʼifīyah umm walad al-Manṣūr kānat baʻathat bi-Shaklah umm Ibrāhīm ilá al-Ṭāʼif fa-nashaʼat hunāk, fa-faṣuḥat wa-qālat al-shiʻr, wa-anshadanī la-hā shiʻran fī akhin la-hā yuqālu la-hu Aḥmad ..."
Secundo folio: fa-ʻafā ʻanhu fa-ʻamila fīhi.
12.5 x 19.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 17 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Cardboard binding.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; text within double red frames; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover: "D. B. Macdonald, 143 Sigourney Street, Hartford, Conn., u.s.a." (probably Professor Duncan Black Macdonald, 1863-1943, of Hartford Theological Seminary)
On folio 1a: "Akhbār Ibrāhīm ibn al-Mahdī wa-ukhtihi ʻUlayyah bint al-Mahdī wa-ashʻāruhumā, jamʻ Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá al-Ṣūlī, ʻufiya ʻanh."

On folio 25b, in a different hand, are written two verses of poetry attributed to Ḥātim al-Ṭāʼī (lived in the last half of the 6th century), and two verses attributed to al-Ṣalāḥ al-Ṣafadī (Khalīl ibn Aybak, approximately 1297-1363), in which he quotes the first hemistich of Ḥātim al-Ṭāʼī's verse, and a list of books housed at an unnamed location.
Colophon: "Hādhā ākhir shiʻr Abī al-Qāsim Isḥāq ibn al-Mahdī. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the poetry of Abū al-Qāsim Isḥāq ibn al-Mahdī. God is more knowledgeable. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ : manuscript / edited by ʻAlī Sibṭ al-Shaykh Sharaf al-Dīn ʻUmar ibn al-Fāriḍ.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alldhī khaṣṣa ḥabībah al-athná [al-asná] bi-maqām qāb qawsayn aw adná, wa-qarana ismahu al-sharīf bi-aʻẓam asmāʼihi al-ḥusná ... qāla al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-dhanbihi al-mughtarif min nahr ʻaṭā rabbihi ʻAlī Sibṭ al-Shaykh Sharaf al-Dīn ʻUmar ibn al-Fāriḍ, al-rājī karama rabbihi al-fāyiḍ ... naẓartu fī nusakh min dīwān Shaykhinā, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu wa-sharaḥ ṣadrahu bi-al-naẓar ilayhi wa-barrahu, fa-raʼaytu al-nussākh jahilū baʻḍ kalāmihi wa-mā ʻarafūhu, wa-ishtabaha ʻalayhim shayʼ min jināsihi fa-ṣaḥḥafūhu wa-akhrajūhu bi-dhālika ʻan aṣlih ..."
Secundo folio: masālikahu muʻtamidan fī dhālik.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 12 x 19 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding with flap.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses are fully vocalized; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Dīwān al-Ustādh al-ʻārif bi-rabbihi al-walī al-zāhid, Mawlānā wa-ʻazīzinā Sayyid ʻUmar ibn al-Fāriḍ, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
On folio 77b: Eight verses of poetry (could not be identified) with the date 995 (1586/1587).
Colophon: "Tamma al-Dīwān bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi 13 Shawwāl, sanat 1270."
Translation of the colophon: "The Dīwān [Collected poems] was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Copied on 13 Shawwāl, 1270 [9 July, 1854]."

record.title: 880-02 Kanz al-dhakhāʼir wa-hadīyat al-musāfir ilá al-nūr al-sāfir : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Maḥallī al-Samannūdī al-Shāfiʻī al-Rifāʻī.
record.note: Title from printed version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh dhī al-birr al-ghāmir wa-al-faḍl al-wāfir, al-awwal wa-al-ākhir. Aḥmaduhu ʻalá iḥsānihi al-mutawātir ḥamdan yakūnu ʻiṣmatan lil-ḥāḍir wa-zādan lil-musāfir, wa-astaghfiruhu min jamīʻ al-kabāʼir wa-al-ṣaghāʼir ... Ammā baʻd, fa-qad saʼalanī jamāʻah min al-ikhwān wa-min akābir al-fuḍalāʼ al-aʻyān fī sharḥ al-qaṣīdah al-Tāʼīyah al-mashūrah bi-al-Subkīyah ... fa-ajabtuhum li-masʼalatihim wa-fāʼan li-ṣāliḥ adʻiyatihim ..."
Secundo folio: min al-thiqāt wa-ʻulamāʼ al-Islām.
16.5 x 23.3 cm; written surface: 10.3 x 16.3 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding (in 18 quires, mostly numbered)
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of Tāʼīyat al-Subkī in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Tāʼīyah lil-Subkī, tusammá al-Dhakhāʼir wa-hadīyat al-musāfir ilá al-nūr al-sāfir. Taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah muftī al-Muslimīn, baqīyat al-salaf al-ṣāliḥ Abī ʻAbd Allāh Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Maḥallī al-Samannūdī al-Shāfiʻī al-Rifāʻī. Āmīn."

The "Tāʼīyah" of al-Subkī starts with: Tayaqqaẓ li-nafsin ʻan hudāhā tawallati // wa-bādir fa-fī al-taʼkhīr aʻẓamu khaybatī. And ends with: Ka-dhāka ḍajīʻāka alladhāni takaffalā // bi-dafʻi dhawī zayghin wa-ḥifẓ al-Sharīʻati.

Colophon: "Tammat al-qaṣīdah wa-sharḥuhā bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-ṣadīqihi [?], ʻalá yad kātibihā, afqar al-ʻibād li-ʻafw rabbihi al-karīm al-jawwād, al-faqīr Mḥfūẓ ibn Ḥijāzī al-Khaṭīb al-Qimnī al-Shāfiʻī al-Shādhilī, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Tārīkh, fī 22 Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 1173. [6 July, 1760]."

Translation of the colophon: "The poem and its commentary are completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His family, his companions and his friend [?]. Copied by the poorest of the servants to the forgiveness of his generous and benevolent Lord, the poor Mḥfūẓ ibn Ḥijāzī al-Khaṭīb al-Qimnī al-Shāfiʻī al-Shādhilī, may God pardon him. Dated, 22 Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 1173 [6 July, 1760]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: Title from folio 4a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alldhī ikhtaṣṣa Nabīyanā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam bi-kitāb akhrasa al-fuṣaḥāʼ wa-aʻjaza al-bulaghāʼ ʻan al-tafawwuh bi-mithl aqṣar sūrah min suwarihi, bal āyah min āyātih, wa-bi-jawāmiʻ al-kalim wa-badāyiʻ al-ḥikam wa-ʻaẓīm al-khuluq fī sāyir aqwālihi wa-afʻālihi wa-ḥālātih, wa-kharaq la-hu khawāriq al-wujūd bi-muʻjizāt abharat al-ʻuqūl, wa-qaṣura ʻan iḥṣāʼihā istiqṣāʼ al-mādiḥīn ..."
Secundo folio: wa-taḥrīfātihi wa-hudāt al-khalq.
15.2 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 14 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In blue marbled cardboard binding.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; with the verses of al-Hamzīyah of al-Būṣīrī in red; many notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Shaykh al-Islām al-Shaykh Ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn."

On folio 1a, two ownership statements, as follows: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Min niʻam Allāh subḥānahu wa-taʻālá ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr ilayhi subḥānuhu ʻazza shānuhu, ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Qādirī al-Biqāʻī mawlidan [seal]." "Fī nawbat afqar al-wará ilá ʻafw rabbihi Sulaymān ibn Aḥmad al-shahīr bi-Ibn Jaʻfar Āghā, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu wa-khatama la-hu bi-al-ḥusná, fī 20 JĀ [Jumād Awwal], sanat 1287 [18 August, 1870], bi-thaman qadruhu 65."
The "Burdah" of al-Būṣīrī starts with: Kayfa tarqá ruqīyaka al-anbiyāʼu // yā samāʼan mā ṭāwalathā samāʼu.

On folio 4a: "Wa-sammaytuhu al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah. Thumma balaghanī anna al-nāẓim sammāhā "Umm al-Qurá" tashbīhan la-hā bi-Makkah, bi-jāmiʻ annahā ḥawat bi-ṭarīq al-taṣrīḥ wa-al-īmāʼ ʻalá mā fī akthar al-madāʼiḥ al-Nabawīyah, wa-ḥīnaʼithin sammaytuhā 'Afḍal al-qirá li-qurrá [qurrā] Umm al-Qurá'."

On the margin of folio 303b, an ownership statement, as follows: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu. Min niʻam Allāh subḥānahu wa-taʻālá ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr ilayhi subḥānahu wa-taʻālá Muḥammad al-Ḥanafī [... ...], ʻufiya ʻanh. [seal]."
On the margin of folio 303b, a note states that the poem of al-Būṣīri is in 455 verses: "ʻAdad abyāt al-Hamzīyah 455. Raḥima Allāh muʼallifahā."

On the margin of folio 303b, the date of death of the commentator, Ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī, is given as Monday morning, 23 Rajab, 974 (13 February, 1567), and the date of composition of the commentary on the midnight of Friday, 2 Jumādá al-Ūlá, 966 (20 February, 1559): "Tārīkh wafāt al-shāriḥ ḍaḥwat al-Ithnayn, thālith ʻishrīn Rajab, sanat arbaʻ wa-sabʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, ṣulliya ʻalayhi al-ʻaṣr ʻinda al-Multazam al-Sharīf wa-dufina bi-al-Muʻallā, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-raḥimahu. Āmīn. Qāla raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Waqaʻa al-farāgh min taṣnīfihi niṣfa laylat al-Jumʻah, thānī Jumādá al-Ūlá, sanat sitt wa-sittīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihā tāsiʻ Dhī al-Qaʻdah li-sanat sabʻ wa-thalāthīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā al-ṣalāh, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-rājī ʻafawa rabbihi wa-maghfiratah Taqī al-Dīn ibn al-Nūrī Maḥmūd al-shahīr bi-al-Ṣāliḥī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhumā, wa-ʻan man naẓara fīhi wa-daʻā la-humā bi-al-ghufrān wa-lil-muʼminīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on 9 Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 1037 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may prayer be upon Him, by the poor servant who hopes for the pardoning and forgiveness of his Lord, Taqī al-Dīn ibn al-Nūrī Maḥmūd al-shahīr bi-al-Ṣāliḥī, may both [he and his father] be forgiven, and he who reads the copy and requests God to forgive both of them and to forgive all believers. Praise be to God."

record.title: Diary : manuscript.
record.note: Annotations on blank leaves in the printed almanac section of the volume concern weather; social appointments; and ship arrivals and departures.
Bound with and inscribed in Perch's pocket almanac, calculated by Mr. Thomas Donohue....Barbados: Printed by Tho. Wtt. Perch, MDCCXC [1790].

record.title: Francis M. Emerson letter, Canon Creek, California, to Susan Hunt Emerson, 1854 November 20 : manuscript.
record.note: Letter is accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: J. J. Zimmerman letter, La Grange, California, to Franklin A. Hinds, Portland, Oregon, 1865 September 8 : manuscript.
record.note: Letter is accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: Note : to Richard Bull, ca. 1789 September.
record.note: Dated approximately by the reference to the second edition of Pinkerton's An essay on medals, 1789. See: Yale edition of Horace Walpole's correspondence.

Mounted on page 110 of Richard Bull's copiously extra-illustrated copy of: Walpole, H. A description of the villa of Mr. Horace Walpole. Strawberry Hill : Printed by Thomas Kirgate, 1784. See Hazen, A.T. Bibliography of the Strawberry Hill Press (1973 ed.), no. 30, copy 13.
Mounted beside the top half of the plate mentioned in the note, probably the impression sent by Walpole to Bull.

record.title: Translation of a report by Álvaro de Bazan, marquês de Santa Cruz, on the defense of Spain and the West Indies from Sir Francis Drake : manuscript.
record.note: Provenance: Henry Stevens; Sir Thomas Phillipps; Paul Mellon.

record.title: Select meditations and reflections on death : with other select pieces.
record.note: Title from title leaf.

record.title: Album of embroidered fabric samples.
record.note: Bound in green cloth and black boards (rebacked).

record.title: 880-02 al-Ṣalawāt al-birrīyah fī al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr al-barīyah : manuscript / Muṣṭafá ibn Kamāl al-Dīn al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bihi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ikhtaṣṣanā bi-Sayyid al-Anām nabīyan wa-rasūlan, wa-khaṣṣanā bi-sanad lā yuḍām malīyan maʼmūlan, wa-khallaṣanā bi-madad lā yusām marḍīyan maqbūlan ..."
Secundo folio: ḥāmilan li-aʻbāʼ al-risālah.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding with flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi al-Ṣalawāt al-birrīyah fī al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr al-barīyah lil-Sayyid al-ḥaqīqī Muṣṭafá al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī sibṭ al-Ḥasanīyah ʻalá al-kamāl wa-al-ḥamd lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."
On folio 3a: "Wa-qad warda al-idhn bi-tasmiyat hādhihi al-ṣalawāt al-Nabawīyah 'al-Ṣalāh al-birrīyah fī al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr al-barīyah'."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Thulāth, ʻashrun khalat min shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn thamāniyah wa-sittīn, sanat 1268. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabbī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble copy was completed on Tuesday, 10 Muḥarram, 1268 [5 November, 1851]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad the Illiterate Prophet, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻālim bi-al-kullīyāt wa-al-juzʼīyāt, al-hādī lil-ʻuqūl ilá ḥall ṣiʻāb al-maʻqūl bi-ṭuruq iktisāb al-taṣawwurāt wa-al-taṣdīqāt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-jāmiʻ li-ajnās al-kamālāt wa-al-faḍāyil, al-mukhtār min afḍal al-anwāʻ wa-ashraf aṣnāf al-urūmāt wa-al-qabāʼil ..."
Secundo folio: al-asrār. Ammā baʻd.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap.

In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; with the verses of al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; text within double red frames; catchwords.

On folio 95a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Hādhā mulk al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Dimashqī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidihi wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn, bi-jāh al-Amīn. Āmīn." "Thumma intaqala bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī ilá mulk ʻAbd Allāh al-Ṭarābulusī al-ʻUmarī."

Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God, the Lord of the Universe. May peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. God is the granter of truth, to Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on the Seal of the Prophets. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 al-Maṭlaʻ : Sharḥ Īsāghūjī fī al-manṭiq : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Shaykhunā al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, shaykh al-ṭarīqah wa-maʻdin al-ḥaqīqah, waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrih ... Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ laṭīf li-kitāb al-ʻAllāmah Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī, raḥimahu Allāh, al-musammá bi-Īsāghūjī fī ʻilm al-manṭiq, yaḥullu alfāẓah wa-yubayyinu murādah, wa-yaftaḥu mughlaqah, wa-yuqayyidu muṭlaqah, ʻalá wajh laṭīf wa-manhaj munīf. Wa-sammaytuhu "al-Maṭlaʻ". Wa-Allāh asʼal an yanfaʻa bi-hi, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
Secundo folio: manaḥa aḥibbatahu bi-al-luṭf.
15.5 x 21.7 cm; written surface: 7 x 13.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "Īsāghūji" of al-Abharī in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Maṭlaʻ, Sharḥ Īsāghūjī fī al-manṭiq, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā min barakātihi. Āmīn."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... li-anna al-kullīyatayn qad yakdhibān, ka-qawlinā: Kull insān kātib, wa-lā shayʼ min al-insān bi-kātib. Wa-al-juzʼīyatayn qad yaṣduqān, kaqawlinā: Baʻḍ al-insān laysa bi-kātib. Wa-al-naqīḍān lā yajtamiʻān wa-lā yartafiʻān. Wa-hādhān al-mithālān lil-jumlatayn. Wa-mithāl ..."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Sakhāwī.
record.note: Title from Incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā Fattāḥ. Yā ʻAlīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu [al-faqīr] ilá raḥmat Rabbih, ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Sakhāwī al-Shāfiʻī, ʻāmalahumā Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah: Hādhā Mukhtaṣar fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb, sahl lil-mubtadī, nāfiʻ, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, rattabtuhu ʻalá muqaddimah wa-aḥada ʻashara bāban wa-khātimah, fī ṣifat al-aḥruf al-Hindīyah, wa-hiya tisʻat ashkāl, hākadhā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-arbaʻah wa-khamsīn fa-anzil hākadhā.
16.5 x 22.7 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding with flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
On front cover: "Matn al-Sakhāwīyah fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb."

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Matn al-Sakhāwīyah lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Sakhāwī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-humā wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

On folio 10b: An anonymous treatise on arithmetic and calculation, in fifteen verses, by the same copyist, starts with: Lil-ḥalli bābun ḥifẓuhu muhimmu // wa-nafʻuhu yā dhā al-ḥijā yaʻimmu. And ends with: Thumma ikhtabir bi-ḍarbika al-aḍlāʻā // fī baʻḍihā fa-innahu qad shāʻā.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā qayyadnāh wa-aradnāh. Tamma kitābatan ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajuhum ilayh ghafran wa-sitran, Ismāʻīl ibn al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-ʻAzīzī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Sanat 1168."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we wrote and what we wanted. Copied by the poorest of the poor and the neediest to the forgiveness and protection of God, Ismāʻīl son of the learned Shaykh ʻAlī al-ʻAzīzī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. In the year 1168 [1754 or 1755]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Aḍwāʼ al-bahijah fī ibrāz daqāʼiq al-Munfarijah : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-muḥaqqiq al-ruḥalah mufīd al-ṭālibīn ḥujjat al-munāẓirīn wa-lisān al-mutakallimīn muḥyī al-Sunnah fī al-ʻālamīn, Abū Yaḥyá Zayn al-Dīn Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mufrij lil-karab ʻuqayb al-shiddah, al-munjī li-khalāṣ ʻibādih min ghayāhib al-ẓulam al-muʻaddah ... wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā mā ishtaddat ilayhi ḥājat al-mutafahhimīn lil-Munfarijah, qaṣīdat al-Imām ... al-Rabbānī Abī al-Faḍl Yūsuf ibn Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf, al-Tawzarī al-aṣl, al-maʻrūf bi-Ibn al-Naḥwī ... min sharḥ yaḥullu alfāẓahā wa-yubayyinu murādahā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-summiya bi-al-khabab li-qiṣar.
15.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 11 x 16 cm; 24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "al-Munfarijah" in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Aḍwāʼ al-bahijah fī ibrāz daqāʼiq al-Munfarijah, jamʻ Mawlānā, Shaykh mashāyikh al-Islām, qāḍī quḍāt al-Muslimīn, Abī Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: "Fāʼidah fī iʻrāb 'Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm'" (in ten lines); four verses of poetry attributed to al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī (about travel and its benefits); "Fāʼidah: Maktūb ʻalá sayf Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam ..."

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu ... Tamma al-sharḥ al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi fī ḥādī ʻashar Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, sanat iḥdá wa-thamānīn wa-thamānimiʼah, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih, kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʻlīqihā fī yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, thālith yawm min shahr Rajab al-fard al-ḥarām, sanat 1074, arbaʻah wa-sabʻīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá musharrifihā, afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author said ... The blessed commentary was completed by the praise of God and His help, on 11 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 881 [5 April, 1477]. May prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, his family and His companions, whenever He is mentioned by those who remember and whenever He is not mentioned by those who do not remember. Copied on blessed Thursday, 3 Rajab, 1074 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [31 January, 1664], may the best of prayer and peace be upon Him. Praise be to God alone. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God, the Almighty, the All-powerful."

record.title: 880-03 Mawrid al-ẓamʼān fī marsūm khaṭṭ al-Qurʼān : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Kharrāz.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn al-Umawī al-shahīr bi-al-Kharrāz, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-raḍiya ʻanh: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻaẓīmi al-minani // wa-mursili al-rusli bi-ahdá al-sunani. Li-yublighū al-daʻwata lil-ʻibādi // wa-yūḍiḥū mahāyiʻa al-irshādi ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-jāʼa atharun fī al-iqtidā.
15.5 x 21.3 cm; written surface: 11 x 15.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Mawrid al-ẓamʼān fī marsūm khaṭṭ al-Qurʼān lil-ʻAllāmah Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Kharrāzī, ʻalá al-tamām, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb al-Kharrāzī fī al-rasm, lil-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-ʻumdah al-fahhāmah al-Ustadār Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Umawī al-Sharīsī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā wa-al-Muslimīn min barakātihi. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tamma wa-kamula ḍabṭ al-Kharrāzī bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Intahá. Intahá. Intahá. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak fī yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, thāmin ʻishrīn Ṣafar al-khayr, min shuhūr ʻām sanah [sic] sittah wa-thamānīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, sanat 1086, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥamad ibn Shihāb al-Dīn al-Ghayyāʼī [?] al-Sūhāy [?] al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hum ajmaʻīn bi-mannihi wa-karamih wa-khafī luṭfih. Āmīn. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The adjustment of al-Kharrāzī is concluded and completed, by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. It is ended. It is ended. It is ended. This blessed book was copied on blessed Friday, 28 Ṣafar, 1086 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and peace be upon Him, by the salve, the poor to God Almighty, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥamad ibn Shihāb al-Dīn al-Ghayyāʼī [?] al-Sūhāy [?] al-Mālikī, may God forgive them all, by His benevolence, generosity and hidden graciousness. Amen. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God, the Powerful, the Almighty. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His family and His companions and grant them peace. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Nihāyat al-muḥtāj ilá sharḥ al-Minhāj : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ramlī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb al-Nikāḥ. Huwa lughatan al-ḍamm wa-al-waṭy, wa-sharʻan ʻaqd yataḍamman ibāḥat waṭy bi-al-lafẓ al-ātī. Wa-huwa ḥaqīqah fī al-ʻaqd majāz fī al-waṭy li-ṣiḥḥat baqīyat ʻaynih ..."
Secundo folio: ḥaythu lā nīyah wa-ʻalá al-aṣaḥḥ.
20.5 x 29.5 cm; written surface: 12 x 21.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Both covers missing.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā [... ... ...] lil-Shaykh al-Ramlī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Āmīn."
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "... Faṣl fī bayān luzūm al-kitābah min jānib wa-jawāzuhā min ākhar wa-mā yatarattabu ʻalayhā ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Sharḥ al-Nuqāyah : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Quṭlūbughā.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma yassir wa-tammim bi-khayr, yā karīm. Kitāb al-buyūʻ. Huwa mubādalat māl bi-māl bi-tarāḍin. Qultu: Ahmala fī aṣl al-kitāb lafẓ "bi-tarāḍin", fa-qāl al-muṣannif fī sharḥihi innamā tarakahu li-yashmula bayʻ al-mukrah, fa-innahu bayʻ munʻaqid, fa-taʼammal kayfa zāda mā nabbaha ʻalá awlawīyat tarkih. "Yanʻaqid", ay tathbut al-mubādalah "bi-ījāb", wa-huwa mā dhakara awwalan min qawlihi biʻtu aw ishtaraytu, wa-naḥwuhu ..."
Secundo folio: [...] mushāran ilayhi fa-huwa mabīʻ ayḍan.
27.5 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 13 x 20.5 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: Front cover and spine missing; back cover in blue leather.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; with the phrases of "al-Nuqāyah" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some wormholes, mainly on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An index of contents (35 chapters).
On folio 1b: "Kitāb fiqh Ḥanafī."

On folio 1b: An ownership statement: "Fī 27 al-Ḥijjah, khitām ʻām 54, arbaʻah wa-khamsīn, akhadhtuhu min al-Shaykh Nūḥ al-Kutubī. al-Faqīr Muḥammad Wākid al-Ghazzī al-Ḥanafī al-Ḥusaynī al-ʻUmarī al-Azʹharī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn."
At head of folio 2a: "al-Thānī min Sharḥ al-Nuqāyah lil-Shaykh Qāsim Quṭlubughā."
On folio 2a: An incantation against "al-araḍah" (paper-worms): "Iḥbis yā Kubaykij al-araḍah. Yā Ḥafīẓ. Yā Allāh. Yā Allāh. Yā Allāh."
On folio 2a: A quotation from "al-Badāʼiʻ" (probably "Badāʼiʻ al-ṣanāʼiʻ fī tartīb al-sharāʼiʻ" of Abū Bakr ibn Masʻūd al-Kāsānī (died 1191), on "Kafālat al-dayn" (security for debt).

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "... wa-law ishtará rajulun shayʼan fa-qīla la-hu 'Innaka ishtarayta bi-thaman ghālin', fa-saʻá al-bāyiʻ ʻinda ẓālim wa-akhsarahu. In kāna ṣidqan lam yaḍman, wa-in qāla kadhiban ḍamin. Wa-fī mutafarriqāt sariqat al-Fatāwá al-Ẓahīrīyah: Rajulun iddaʻá ʻalá ākhar sariqat, wa-qaddamah ilá al-sulṭān, fa-ṭalaba al-sulṭān an yaḍribahu ḥattá yuqirra bi-al-sariqah, fa-ḍarabahu ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣaʻīdī ʻalá Sharḥ al-Kharshī ʻalá Mukhtaṣar Khalīl : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAdwī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Bāb al-Ḥajj. Qawluhu 'Wa-huwa al-qiyās' li-annahu maṣdar ḥajja, qiyāsuhu al-fatʹḥ, illā annaka khabīr bi-anna al-murād bi-al-ḥajj huwa al-hayʼah al-makhṣūṣah al-mawṣūfah bi-annahā duʻāmah, wa-laʻallahu li-ajl dhālika kān al-kasr akthar samāʻan ..."
Secundo folio: wa-fasādihi wa-lāzamahu idrāk.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 18.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 52 unnumbered quires)
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-Juzʼ al-thānī min ḥāshiyat Ustādhinā wa-Shaykhinā al-Imām al-qudwah, ʻallāmat ʻaṣrihi, al-ʻāmil Shaykh al-Islām, al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAdwī, ʻalá sharḥ Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Kharshī ʻalá matn al-ʻAllāmah Khalīl, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-him ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr al-rājī min Mawlāhu al-isʻāf Sulaymān ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAllāf al-Mālikī al-Khalwatī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn." Seal of Sulaymān ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAllāf.
Colophon: "Tamma al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ṣaʻīdī ʻalá Sharḥ Sayyidī Khalīl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The second part of Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ṣaʻīdī ʻalá Sharḥ Sayyidī Khalīl is completed. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudhudī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī shahidat bi-wujūdihi jamīʻ al-kāʼināt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-mabʻūth bi-al-āyāt al-wāḍiḥāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-tābiʻīn la-hum fī al-karāmāt ilá Yawm al-Qiyāmah. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh. al-Ḥamd huwa al-thanāʼ bi-al-lisān bi-al-jamīl min al-awṣāf, aw al-afʻāl, ka-al-ʻilm wa-al-jūd bi-al-minan wa-huwa ḍidd al-dhamm alladhī huwa al-thanāʼ bi-al-qabīḥ min al-awṣāf wa-al-afʻāl, ka-al-jahl wa-al-bukhl ..."
Secundo folio: nazala al-Shaykh raḍiay Allāh ʻanhu.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 11 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 unnumbered quires)
In crude naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Umm al-barāhīn" and markings in red; many notes and commentaries and some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Folios 1b-2b are written in bluish ink, in a different hand and different kind of paper.
On folios 1b-2a: Different verses of poetry on friendship and the difficulty of finding true friends.
On folio 2a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Sanūsīyah Umm al-barāhīn li-Mawlānā al-Shaykh Muḥammad Manṣūr al-Hudhudī, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tamm. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Arbaʻ, ākhir sanat 1194, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá al-Malik al-Majīd, Ibrāhīm al-mulaqqab bi-Saʻīd, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-ikhwānihi wa-lil-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed. Copied on Wednesday, the end of the year 1194 [27 December, 1780] by the poor to the Glorious King, Ibrāhīm, nicknamed Saʻīd, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, his brethren and the Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá sharḥ al-Sanūsī lil-ʻAqīdah al-ṣughrá : manuscript / ʻĪsá ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Saktānī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidnā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. [Qāla] al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim, khātimat al-muḥaqqiqīn, qāḍī al-jamāʻah bi-Murrākush, Sayyidī Abū Mahdī ʻĪsá ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Saktānī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá bi-mannih. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-imām al-mursalīn, wa-al-riḍá ʻan ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-ʻan al-tābiʻīn la-hum fī silk minhāj al-muttaqīn: Fa-hādhā taqyīdun qaṣadtu fīhi, bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-tawfīqih, ilá tabyīn baʻḍ mā yakhfá tabyīnuhu min ḥall mā ʻasá an yastaṣʻiba al-ṭālib min alfāẓ minhu sh. (sharḥ) al-ʻAqīdah al-ṣughrá lil-Imām Abī ʻAbd Allāh Sayyidī Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ilḥāḥuhu ʻalayya baʻda istiqrārī.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 14 numbered quires)
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; many notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

On folios 1a: "Hādhihi ḥawāshin lil-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah Sayyidī ʻĪsá al-Saktānī ʻalá al-muṣannif ʻalá al-Sanūsīyah fī ʻilm al-tawḥīd, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakatihimā ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Intahá mā wujida muqayyadan ʻan al-Imām, ʻalam al-aʻlām, khātimat al-muḥaqqiqīn, Abū Mahdī, Sayyidī ʻĪsá al-Saktānī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Wa-ghafara li-kātibihā wa-li-muṭāliʻihā bi-jāh Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-ʻaẓẓam wa-sharraf. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm. Wa-kātibuhā Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Bujayrimī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Concluded is what was found transmitted from al-Imām, the last authority, Abū Mahdī, Sayyidī ʻĪsá al-Saktānī, may God benefit us through him. Amen. By the intercession of our Master and Chieftain, Muḥammad, may God pray on him and grant him peace, exalt and honor him. Amen. Amen. It is completed by the copyist Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Bujayrimī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may God pardon him and his parents. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá sharḥ Tuḥfat al-ikhwān fī fann al-bayān : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Jirjāwī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Naḥmaduka anta al-wāḥid al-ghaffār, fa-laka al-ḥamd ḥaqīqatan wa-li-ghayrika mustaʻār. Wa-nuṣallī wa-nusallimu ʻalá man washaḥtahu bi-laṭāʼif imdādik, Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī jaʻaltahu aṣlan li-makhlūqātik, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-mutajarridīn ʻan shawāʼib abʻādik. wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī ghafr al-masāwī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Jirjāwī: Hādhihi kalimāt qalīlah mushtamilah ʻalá fawāʼid jalīlah ʻalá sharḥ Sayyidī al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Dardīr ʻalá risālatihi al-musammāh bi-Tuḥfat al-ikhwān fī fann al-bayān. Qāla, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanh wa-amaddanā bi-imdādih: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Lā baʼsa bi-al-taʻarruḍ li-shayʼ mimmā iḥtawat ʻalayhi hādhihi al-jumlah al-sharīfah yakūnu munāsiban li-hādhā al-fann, fa-aqūlu: Qāl Sībawayh: al-Bāʼ ḥaqīqatuhā an takūna lil-ilṣāq wa-al-ikhtilāṭ ..."
Secundo folio: bi-Zayd intahá fa-ʻalá.
16 x 22.3 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 18 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 unnumbered quires)
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Dardīr preceded by "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; some markings in red; some notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, sayyid al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, master of the messengers, and upon his family and all his companions. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudhudī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir bi-al-khayr. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī shahida bi-wujūdihi jamīʻ al-kāʼināt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-mabʻūth bi-al-āyāt al-wāḍiḥāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-al-tābiʻīn la-hum fī al-karāmāt ilá Yawm al-Dīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh. Sh. [Sharḥ] al-Ḥamd huwa al-thanāʼ bi-al-lisān bi-al-jamīl min al-awṣāf, wa-al-afʻāl, ka-al-ʻilm wa-al-jūd wa-al-minan wa-huwa ḍidd al-dhamm alladhī huwa al-thanāʼ bi-al-qabīḥ min al-awṣāf wa-al-afʻāl, ka-al-jahl wa-al-bukhl ..."
Secundo folio: al-ʻaql min ithbāt aw nafī.
21 x 15.3 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.2 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in separate leaves)

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Umm al-barāhīn" preceded by the letter "Ṣ" and the commentary by the letter "Sh" in red; markings in red; and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-ʻaqīdah al-musammāh bi-Umm al-barāhīn lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Hudhudī, ʻammat barakātuhu ʻalaynā ajmaʻīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a, in a crude hand, a paragraph on how to know what day of the week falls on the beginning of the Hijrī year.

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Ghafar Allāh li-muʼallifihā wa-shāriḥihā wa-kātibihā wa-li-man kutibat la-hu wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-ʻaqīdah al-mubārakah yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak, thānī ʻishrīn Jumādá al-Ākhir, sanat 11?1 [third digit not clear, probably 1161 = 19 June, 1748]."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God forgive its author, its commentator, its copyist, for whom it was written and all Muslims. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. Amen. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High and the Almighty. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. This blessed treatise on doctrine was copied on blessed Wednesday, 22 Jumādá al-Ākhir, the year 11?1 [third digit not clear, probably 1161 = 19 June, 1748]."

record.title: 880-02 Shajarat al-kawn : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-ʻArabī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-aḥadī al-dhāt, al-fardī al-ṣifāt, alladhī taqaddasa wajhuhu ʻan al-jihāt, wa-qaddasahu ʻan al-muḥdathāt, wa-qadamuhu ʻan al-jihāt, wa-yaduhu ʻan al-ḥarakāt, wa-ʻaynuhu ʻan al-laḥaẓāt, wa-istiwāʼuhu ʻan al-ittiṣālāt, wa-qudratuhu ʻan al-hafawāt, wa-irādatuhu ʻan al-shahawāt, alladhī lā taʻaddud li-ṣifātih bi-ʻadad al-mawṣūfāt, wa-lā takhtalif irādatuhu bi-ikhtilāf al-murādāt, wa-kawwan bi-kalimat "Kun" jamīʻ al-kāʼināt, wa-awjada bi-hā al-mawjūdāt ..."
Secundo folio: an yujāwiza mā arādah.
12 x 17 cm; written surface: 10 x 14.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire)
In medium naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Shajarat al-kawn lil-Shaykh al-akbar Sayyidī Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-ʻArabī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-lā aʻrifu lil-aḥadīyah amadan, wa-lā lil-fardīyah ʻadadan. Qultu: Fa-ayna Isrāfīl? Qāl: Dhālika udkhila fī maktab al-taʻlīm yuṣāfiḥu bi-ṣafḥat wajhihi al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ wa-yastansikhu minhu mā huwa mabrūm wa-manqūḍ, thumma yaqraʼu ʻalá ṣibyān al-taʻlīm fī mithāl. Dhālik taqdīr al-ʻAzīz al-ʻAlīm. Thumma huwa fī zaman ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Hudhudī : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Khiḍr ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAmrūsī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-qadīr, ʻAlī ibn Khiḍr ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAmrūsī, askanahu Allāh bi-mannihi Jannat al-Firdaws: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anʻama ʻalá al-insān bi-maʻrifatih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi ḥawāshin kāshifah li-mā lam yattaḍiḥ maʻnāh min alfāẓ Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah Sayyidī Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudhudī, jamaʻtuhā qāṣidan bi-dhālika al-thawāb min al-Karīm al-Wahhāb ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ṭawá al-istithnāʼīyah wa-aqāma maqāmahā.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 12 x 17.5 cm; 24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (some leaves seem to be missing)
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some markings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
Folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr Ibrāhīm ibn Ibrāhīm Khawājah al-Shāfiʻī."

At the end of the colophon are written nine verses of poetry, about God, His word and His attributes, attributed to muḥaqqiq al-ʻaṣr al-Qarāfī (probably Aḥmad ibn Idrīs al-Qarāfī, a leading theoretician of the Malikī tradition in Egypt, died 1285). The poem starts with: Madlūl alfāẓi kalām Allāhi // qismān fa-iḥfaẓ lā takun bi-lāhī. And ends with: Qāla jamīʻ dhālika al-Qarāfī // muḥaqqiq al-ʻaṣr bi-lā khilāfi.

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tamma mā jamaʻahu bi-yadihi al-fāniyah al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi ʻAlī ibn Khiḍr ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAmrūsī al-Mālikī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi kamā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihi, innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼ qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah qadīr [jadīr]. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kān al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-jamʻ al-mubārak wa-min al-taʼlīf ayḍan yawm al-Ithnayn [al-Khamīs] al-mubārak, al-sādis wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Jumādá al-Ākhirah alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1165, alf wa-miʼah wa-khamsah wa-sittīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is true. To Him is the reference and the returning. Completed is what was compiled by the perishing hand of the poor to the mercy of his Lord, ʻAlī ibn Khiḍr ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAmrūsī al-Mālikī, may God benefit with it as He benefitted with its origin. He is able to do whatever He wills and is able [worthy] of responding. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. This blessed compilation was copied and also authored on blessed Monday [Thursday], 26 of Jumādá al-Ākhirah, 1165 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [11 April, 1752], may the best of prayer and the purest of peace be upon Him."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥuṣūl al-rifq bi-uṣūl al-rizq : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīn iṣṭafá. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad saʼalanī sāʼil ʻammā warada fī al-Ḥadīth min al-adhkār wa-al-afʻāl al-jālibah lil-rizq [...] fīhā man ḍāqa ʻalayhi rizquhu wa-taʻassarat ʻalayhi maʻīshatuh li-qawlihi [taʻālá] fa-ibtaghū ʻinda [Allāh] al-rizq. Thumma saʼalanī ākhar wa-ākhar, fa-jamaʻtu lahum hādhā al-juzʼ wa-sammaytuhu Ḥuṣūl al-rifq bi-uṣūl al-rizq ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ʻallimūhā awlādakum wa-akhraja.
21 x 15.3 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Ḥuṣūl al-rifq bi-uṣūl al-rizq taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah khātim al-muḥaqqiqīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Jalāl al-Dīn ibn Kamāl al-Dīn Abū al-Faḍl al-Suyūṭī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn.
On the upper left corner of folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Fī nawbat [al-faqīr] ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-ḥaqīr ʻAbd al-Jawwād ibn Muḥammad [...] al-Mālikī."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi fī yawm al-Aḥad, khāmis ʻashar shahr Shawwāl, sanat tisʻah wa-tisʻīn wa-alf, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād Muḥammad ibn Mūsá al-Ghamrī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on Sunday, 15 Shawwāl, 1099 [13 August, 1688], by the poorest of the servants, Muḥammad ibn Mūsá al-Ghamrī, may God forgive him and his parents. Amen. Amen. It is completed.

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ushmūnī ʻalá Alfīyat Ibn Mālik : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ushmūnī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-humām, al-muḥaqqiq al-mudaqqiq, Nūr al-Dīn Abū al-Ḥasan, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ushmūnī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh ʻalá mā manaḥa min asbāb al-bayān, wa-fataḥ min abwāb al-tibyān, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man rafaʻa bi-māḍī al-ʻazm qawāʻid al-īmān, wa-khafaḍa bi-ʻāmil al-jazm kalimat al-buhtān, Muḥammad al-muntakhab min khulāṣat Maʻadd wa-lubāb ʻAdnān, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna aḥrazū qaṣabāt al-sabq fī miḍmār al-iḥsān ..."
Secundo folio: wa-yaḥullu minhā maḥall al-shajāʻah.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather binding with central red medallions on covers and flap (in 40 numbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the verses of "al-Alfīyah" of Ibn Mālik and markings in red; numerous commentaries on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Ushmūnī ʻalá Alfīyat Ibn Mālik."

Colophon: "Tamma hādhā al-juzʼ yawm al-Sabt, li-khams layālin baqiyat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat iḥdá wa-thamānīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, ʻalá yad kātibihi, afqar al-ʻibād ilá Allāh Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd Allāh [... ...], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This volume is completed on Saturday, five nights remaining from the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1181 [19 September, 1767], by the poorest of the servants to God, Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd Allāh [... ...], may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Taḥbīr al-muwashshīn fī al-taʻbīr bi-al-Sīn wa-al-Shīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yaʻqūb al-Fīrūzābādī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, ḥamdan yastawjibu qāʼiluhu al-iḥsān wa-al-taḥsīn, wa-yastajlibu la-hu fī maʼāzim al-maḍāʼiq al-khalāṣ min al-taʻishīn wa-al-taʻisīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Nabīyinā Muḥammad khayr al-khalāʼiq wa-Sayyid al-unāsīn, alladhī alqá Allāh zubdat al-faṣāḥah ʻalá lisānihi fa-khāṭabahu bi-Ṭāhā wa-Yāsīn ..."
Secundo folio: bi-istiẓlālī bi-marāḥim sulṭān al-wará.
17 x 24.3 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire)
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Taḥbīr al-muwashshīn fī al-taʻbīr bi-al-Sīn wa-al-Shīn lil-ʻAllāmah ṣāḥib al-Qāmūs, ʻalayhi raḥmat al-Mawlá al-Quddūs."
On folio 1a: A short biography of the author "al-Fīrūzābādī".
On folio 1b: "... Wa-sammaytuhu Taḥbīr al-muwashshīn fī al-taʻbīr bi-al-Sīn wa-al-Shīn."

Colophon: "Tamma naskhuhu ʻaṣr yawm al-Khamīs 25 J [probably Jumādá al-Thāniyah], sanat 1295 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-salām. Katabahu al-faqīr Ramaḍān Ḥalāwah, ʻufiya ʻanhu, wa-al-ʻudhr fī dhālika, fa-innahā manqūlah min nuskhah muḥarrafah ghāyatan wa-nihāyah, fa-ʻasá Allāh an yamanna bi-nuskhah muḥarrarah, wa-tuṣaḥḥaḥu hādhihi minhā. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied on the afternoon of Thursday 25 J [probably Jumādá al-Thāniyah], 1295 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [26 June, 1878], may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him, by Ramaḍān Ḥalāwah, may he be forgiven, who apologizes for any discrepancies in this copy because it was made from a completely distorted origin. May God facilitate a well-edited copy so that the present one can be corrected. God is more knowledgeable."

record.title: 880-02 al-Alfīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mālik.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Lā ilāha illā Allāh. Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-fāḍil, ḥujjat al-ʻArab wa-kanz al-adab, waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Mālik, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh: Qāla Muḥammadun huwa Ibnu Māliki // Aḥmadu Rabbī Allāha khayra māliki ..."
Secundo folio: wāḥiduhu kalimatun wa-al-qawlu ʻamm.
14 x 20 cm; written surface: 11 x 14.5 cm; 12 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap.
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; text fully vocalized; catchwords.

On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb Ḥusayn al-Maghribī [?] waqfan ṣaḥīḥan taḥta yad al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Baḥrī [?] ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar."
On folio 1a: a partial table of contents.
Endowment statements at the head of most of the leaves: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá" and "Waqf lillāh taʻālá bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar."

Colophon: "Kamulat al-khulāṣah bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Shāhīn ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Nūrī al-Anbābī, ḥāmidan Allāh taʻālá ʻalá niʻamihi, wa-muṣalliyan ʻalá Nabīyihi Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ʻitratih al-ṭāhirīn wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Bi-Tārīkh sābiʻ ʻashar shahr Allāh al-Muḥarram, sanat sabʻīn wa-thamānimiʼah. Wa-Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The compendium is completed by the praise of God and His help, by the poor to God, Shāhīn ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Nūrī al-Anbābī. Praise be to God the Most High for His blessings. May prayers and abundant peace be on God's Prophet, our Master Muḥammad, his righteous family and descendants, until Judgement Day. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. Dated 17, Muḥarram, 870 [18 September, 1465]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 al-Nukāt al-ḥisān ʻalá mā waqaʻa lil-Najm al-Ghayṭī ʻalá awāʼil Sūrat al-Dukhān wa-faḍāʼil Laylat al-Niṣf min Shaʻbān : manuscript / Nūr al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī fī kull yawm huwa fī shān, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf nawʻ al-insān, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-mamdūḥīn fī al-isrār wa-al-iʻlān. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu afqar al-muḥtājīn ʻAlī ibn Burhān al-Dīn al-Ḥalabī al-Shāfiʻī al-Aḥmadī: Hādhihi Nukāt ḥisān mushtamilah ʻalá ḥusn al-bayān li-mā waqaʻa fīmā katabahu al-Najm al-Ghayṭī ʻalá awāʼil Sūrat al-Dukhān wa-faḍāʼil Laylat al-Niṣf min Shaʻbān, ʻallaqtuhā ʻinda mudhākarat baʻḍ al-ikhwān, min ghayr mazīd taʼammul wa-itqān wa-taftīsh wa-imʻān. Qawluhu ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ʻalayhi kāna al-awlá.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 14.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).

In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ghayṭī's treatise preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying), in red; markings in red; headings in red; some water damage without loss of text; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "al-Nukāt al-ḥisān ʻalá mā waqaʻa lil-Najm al-Ghayṭī ʻalá awāʼil Sūrat al-Dukhān wa-faḍāʼil Laylat al-Niṣf min Shaʻbān lil-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah Nūr al-Dīn ʻAlī al-Ḥalabī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azʹharī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-lil-Mslimīn bi-mannihi, bi-jāh Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallam."
At the end of folio 10b: "Balagha muqābalatan ʻalá aṣlihi bi-ḥasab al-ṭāqah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā katabahu al-ʻAllāmah khātimat al-muḥaqqiqīn al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ḥalabī, rawwaḥa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu, bi-jāh Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what was written by the learned scholar, the seal of the authorities, al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ḥalabī, may God bless his soul, and brighten his grave, by the intercession of our Master Muḥammad, may God pray on him and grant him peace."

record.title: 880-02 Tōdaiji-gire : manuscript.
record.note: Housed in a box inscribed by Yukio Fukuda.
Displayed at "Irodorareta kami ryōshi sōshoku," an exhibit at the Tokugawa Museum in 2001.
"Sanbō ekotoba, gekan, Sōbō, shigatsu, dai 17 , Taianji no daihanyae" no dankan.

record.title: Lace sample book.
record.note: Bound in original brown paper covers, with linen spine. Tie attached to spine. Stamped in ink on front cover: "1642 to 1841."

record.title: Indictment of Claude-Louis-François Régnier, comte de Guerchy for conspiring to assassinate Charles Geneviève Louis Auguste André Timothée d'Eon : manuscript fragment.
record.note: Indictment alleges that on October 31 in the fourth year of the reign of George III (that is, 1763), the comte de Guerchy attempted to hire Peter Henry Treyssac de Vergy to assassinate d'Eon.
Includes at end a separate certification of authenticity written in French by d'Eon, at London, dated 18 September 1767.
Paginated 147-148.

record.title: Roger Pettiward account book, 1789 June 25 -1796 December 31 : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Contemporary full brown sheep binding.

record.title: 880-02 al-Anwār al-bahijah fī ẓuhūr kunūz al-Munfarijah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥasan al-Maqābirī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī azāḥa ʻan qulūb awliyāʼihi shiddat muʻālajat al-nufūs wa-afraja la-hum ʻan sarrāʼ daqqāt qulūbihim ghayāhib al-ghaflah, fa-hum fī baḥr mushāhadatihi ghumūs. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī huwa li-sāʼir al-anbiyāʼ ʻarūs, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-atbāʻihi alladhīn hum li-aʻdāʼ Allāh ʻubūs ..."
Secundo folio: al-kurūb wa-anna kathīran min.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 14.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "al-Munfarijah" in red; markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At head of folio 1a, an endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Munfarijah, al-Anwār al-munbahijah fī ẓuhūr kunūz al-Munfarijah li-Ibn al-Naḥwī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn."
On folio 1b: "Wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Anwār al-bahijah fī ẓuhūr kunūz al-Munfarijah."

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā mā raqamahu al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥasan al-Shāfiʻī al-Maqābiriṣī [al-Maqābirī], ʻafá Allāh ʻanhumā, ḥāmidan wa-muṣallīyan wa-musalliman. Wa-astaghfiru Allāh min al-khaṭaʼ wa-al-zalal wa-al-taqṣīr. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī huwa abhá min al-qamar al-munīr, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-ʻazm wa-al-tadbīr, wa-ʻalá al-tābiʻīn, wa-tābiʻ al-tābiʻīn la-hum bi-iḥsān ilá yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is what was written by the poor ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥasan al-Shāfiʻī al-Maqābiriṣī [al-Maqābirī], may God forgive both of them, praising [God], praying and conveying peace [to His Prophet]. I ask forgiveness from God for any error, fault, or neglect. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad who is more magnificent than the brilliant Moon, His family and His companions, the men of might and disposition, and the followers, and those who graciously followed after those, until Judgment Day. Amen."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kataba hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah bi-yadihi al-fāniyah al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr ʻAbduh ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Damshaltī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azʹharī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhā wa-daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah, wa-dhālika fī thānī ʻashar Rajab al-fard min shuhūr sanat 1125."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This blessed copy was written by the perishing hand of the poor to God, may He be praised, who acknowledges his incapacity and deficiency, ʻAbduh ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Damshaltī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azʹharī, may God forgive him, his parents and he who reads this copy and ask God to forgive him, on 12 Rajab, 1125 [4 August, 1713]."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Unmūdhaj fī al-naḥw : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Ardabīlī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
