Decoration: paraph marks in red and blue. The commentary has been written to form a diamond border design. A small face has been drawn at the end of the text block.
Layout: main text in two columns of 44 lines each. Commentary in a diamond pattern surrounding the main text.

Damage: this binding fragment possibly served as a wrapper or a pastedown for another codex. The recto's text is largely preserved except for some loss of text along the left side. The verso's text has been almost completely lost due to fading or scraping. The fragment contains numerous holes, especially along the edges.

record.title: [Billhead of Hogg & Starkey, linen, woolen, drapers, and dealers in British lace for cloth and ribbons purchased by George Pearson].
record.note: Completed in pen and black ink.

Records purchases on March 12, May 7, and Nov 1, 7, 19, and 20, 1823 of black sash ribbon, black satin, imitation shawl, rose sain, fitch muff, cotton handkerchief, muslim, crimson sash ribbon for a bill totalling £7/4/9. Receipt of payment is afixed dated April 28th, 1824, from the estate of George Pearson, deceased Dec. 31st, 1823. Received by Robert Hogg.
Engraved billhead with engraving at top of billhead of a woman holding an anchor against a seascape with a banner which reads "Importers of British Laces."

record.title: Gypsy : a musical fable : typescript / book by Arthur Laurents ; music by Jule Styne ; lyrics by Stephen Sondheim ; suggested by the memoirs of Gypsy Rose Lee.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: Decretum (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a small Gothic bookhand. Marginal annotations in several small, neat Gothic bookhands.
Decoration: alternating red and blue initials with penwork in the contrasting color. Section numbers at top of page in red and blue. Paraph marks in blue and red.
Layout: written in two columns with 45 lines visible. Marginal commentary and annotations surround the main text. Prickings visible along outer edge.
Damage: the fragment was once used as a pastedown, which has resulted in damage and loss of text to the verso. The bottom of the fragment has been cropped, resulting in loss of text.

record.title: Who's afraid of Virginia Woolf? : a play in three scenes (1961-1962) : typescript / Edward Albee.
record.note: Title from title page.
Title page: "Theater 1962, 26 West 8th Street, New York 11, New York."
Presentation inscription: "For Mel, who will neither sell, nor lease, nor lend this. With affection, Edward, 2002."

record.title: Elizabeth Maberly arithmetic notebook : manuscript.
record.note: Ownership inscription on front board (partly worn away), front paste-down, and recto of first leaf: "Elizabeth Maberly 1798."
Manuscript initials on spine: "EM 98."
Binding: original parchment.
Title devised by cataloger.

record.title: Decretals (fragment).
record.note: Script: main text in an informal Gothic bookhand in brown ink. Gloss written in a smaller, abbreviated Gothic hand in brown ink. Marginal annotations in an informal, heavily abbreviated Gothic hand in black ink.

Decoration: sections begin in two-line initials alternating in blue and red. Numerous paraph marks in red and blue. Section headings at top of each folio in alternating red and blue. Numerous manicules have been drawn in the margin.

Layout: main text in two columns of 39 lines each. Gloss surrounds the main text. Rulings for both main text and gloss visible; text written below the top line of the ruling. Prickings visible on each folio.
Disposition: the bifolium appears to have been used as a wrapper. The text is not continuous from 1v to 2r.

Later Annotations: folio 1r contains some notes in later, possibly 17th or 18th-century hands. "Eua uon Ciuer [?]anges gab a Pallant" and "1556/1560" and "B.C." all in the same ink. "K.40" in a brown ink. An illegible three or four word note in brown ink and "15" circled in pencil.

record.title: Black spring : typescript / by Henry Miller.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: Dress gray : typescript / by Gore Vidal.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: Cruising : a screenplay : typescript / by Brian De Palma ; based on the book by Gerald Walker.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: Arrowsmith : typescript / by Sinclair Lewis ; adapted for television by Joe A. Cross and Allan Surgal.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudhudī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī shahida bi-wujūdihi jamīʻ al-kāʼināt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-mabʻūth bi-al-āyāt al-wāḍiḥāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-al-tābiʻīn la-hum fī al-karāmāt ilá Yawm al-Dīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh. al-Ḥamd huwa al-thanāʼ bi-al-lisān bi-al-jamīl min al-awṣāf, aw al-afʻāl, ka-al-ʻilm wa-al-jūd bi-al-minan, wa-huwa ḍidd al-dhamm ..."
Secundo folio: fī al-ʻaql ʻadamuh.
22.5 x 16 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 14 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; numerous commentaries on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An erased endowment statement "waqf".

Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah fī yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, fī thamāniyat ʻishrīyat shahr Safar [Ṣafar] al-ḥarām, min shuhūr sanat 1175, alf wa-miʼah wa-khamsah wa-sabʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Thursday, 28 Ṣafar, 1175 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [18 September, 1761], may the best of prayer and peace be upon him. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Mighty. It is completed. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Sharqāwī ʻalá Sharḥ al-Hudhudī ʻalá Umm al-barāhīn : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥijāzī al-Sharqāwī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mutawaḥḥid fī dhātih, al-mutanazzih fī nuʻūt jabarūtih ʻan shawāʼib al-naqṣ wa-simātih, al-faʻʻāl li-mā yurīdu, fa-lā muʻāriḍ li-mā qaḍāhu, wa-lā rādda li-hibātih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wāsiṭat ʻiqd al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn, al-ṣādiq, al-muballigh li-amr Rabbih al-amīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-al-tābiʻīn wa-tābiʻīhim bi-iḥsān ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu kathīr al-masāwī ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥijāzī al-mashhūr bi-al-Sharqāwī: Qad ṭalab minnī baʻḍ al-ikhwān an aktuba ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudhudī ʻalá Umm al-barāhīn, al-musammāh bi-al-Ṣughrá, lil-ʻAllāmah Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn al-Walī al-Ṣāliḥ Yūsuf al-Sanūsī al-Mālikī al-Maghribī al-Tilimsānī, ḥāshiyatan tataḍammanu tawḍīḥ mā katabahu ʻalayhi [ʻalayhā] Shaykhunā ʻallāmat al-zamān, wa-farīd al-ʻaṣr wa-al-awān, Shaykh al-Islām, al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-ʻAdawī al-Ṣaʻīdī, li-quṣūr fahm ghālib al-nās ʻan istiṭlāʻ ṭawāliʻ dhālik ..."
Secundo folio: kathīr al-ʻilm allafahu.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 16 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather cover with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative frames. In 17 unnumbered quires.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Imām al-ʻAllāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh al-Sharqāwī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
On the right margin of the colophon the copyist wrote three verses of poetry praising learning and the pursuit of knowledge, and urging the readers to acquire them.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, thānī ʻashar khalat min shahr Rabīʻ Awwal, sanat 1229, tisʻah wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr Aḥmad Abū Ḥamāmah al-Ikhnāwī, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble copy was completed on blessed Saturday, 12 Rabīʻ Awwal, 1229 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [4 March, 1814], may the best of prayer and peace be upon him, by the hand of its copyist, the poor Aḥmad Abū Ḥamāmah al-Ikhnāwī. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family and companions and grant them peace. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī rafaʻa li-ahl al-sunnah al-Muḥammadīyah fī al-khāfiqayn aʻlāman, wa-waḍaʻa bi-wāḍiḥ adillatihim min shubah al-mukhālifīn aʻlāman, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka la-hu, shahādatan takūnu bi-al-takhalluṣ fī al-dārayn iʻlāman, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidinā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-mamnūḥ man ittabaʻahu al-jinān aʻlāman, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, mā badat qawāʻid al-ʻaqāʼid, wa-mā ḥulliyat al-ḥayāh bi-jawāhir al-farāʼid ..."
Secundo folio: Allāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; red leather on spine and flap.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of Jawharat al-tawḥīd in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some water damage; catchwords.

On the right margin of folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqafa jamīʻ hādhā al-kitāb ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm bi-al-Maqām al-Aḥmadī al-ʻUmdah al-fāḍil al-Shaykh Ḥasan Farḥāt, wa-sharaṭ an takūn taḥt yad al-Faqīh Muḥammad Fayyāḍ al-Ḥusaynī. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad."
On folio 1a: Quotations and anecdotes in different hands.
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd ..."
Folio 68 is blank.

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu wa-jāmiʻuhu al-faqīr ilá Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, al-ʻālim al-fāḍil, al-bāriʻ al-kāmil, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Shaykh al-Islām, farīd dahrih, wa-waḥīd ʻaṣrih, al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī: Faraghtu min jamʻihi yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, li-ʻishrīn khalat min Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, min shuhūr al-sanah al-sābiʻah wa-al-arbaʻīn baʻda al-alf. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. al-Farāgh min tamāmih 9 N, 1291."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author and compiler, the poor to God (the Most High, may He be praised), the honorable perfect learned scholar, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Shaykh al-Islām, the unique in his time and age, the learned Imām, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī, said: I finished compiling the book on blessed Thursday, the twentieth of noble Ramaḍān, the year 1047 [of the Hijrah = 5 February, 1638]. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Powerful. Copied on 9 N [probably Shaʻbān or Ramaḍān], 1291 [of the Hijrah = 21 September, or 20 October, 1874]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Rawḍ al-unuf : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Suhaylī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. [...] Qāla al-Shaykh al-faqīh al-ḥāfiẓ al-Muḥaddith Abū al-Qāsim ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad ibn Abī al-Ḥasan al-Ḥanafī [al-Khathʻamī], thumma al-Suhaylī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: Ḥamdan lillāh muqaddam ʻalá kull amr dhī bāl, wa-dhikruhu, subḥānuhu, ḥarīyun lā [allā] yufāriqa al-khalad wa-al-bāl, kamā badaʼa, jalla wa-ʻalā, bi-jazīl ʻawārifih qabla al-ḍarāʻat ilayhi wa-al-ibtihāl. Fa-la-hu al-ḥamd, taʻālá, ḥamdan lā yazāl dāʼim al-iqtibāl, ḍāfī al-sirbāl, jadīdan ʻalá marr al-jadīdayn, ghayra bāl. ʻAlá anna ḥamdahu, subḥānuhu, ʻalá niʻamihi wa-jamīl balāʼihi minnah min minanihi, wa-ālāʼ min ālāʼihi, fa-subḥāna man lā ghāyah bi-jūdihi wa-naʻmāʼihi, wa-lā ḥadda <li-asmāʼih> li-jalālih, wa-lā ḥaṣr li-asmāʼih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī alḥaqanā bi-ʻiṣābat al-muwaḥḥidīn wa-waffaqanā lil-iʻtiṣām bi-ʻurwat hādhā al-amr al-matīn, wa-jaʻalanā fī ibbān barakāt ashraf al-mursalīn ..."
Secundo folio: wa-baʻd fa-innī intakhabt fī hādhā al-imalāʼ.
18 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 13 x 19.5 cm; 20-23 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some phrases and markings in red; some water damage; some notes and corrections on the margins; no catchwords.
On folio 1a: "[... ...] min al-Rawḍ al-unuf lil-Suhaylī [...] Allāh taʻālá, wa-raḍiya ʻanhu bi-mannihi wa-karamih."

On folio 1a: Ownership statements: "Min mann mann mann ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr Abī al-Wafā al-ʻAlamī, ʻufiya ʻanh". "Malakahu wa-mā baʻdahu al-muftaqir [... ... ...] Abū Bakr ibn Muḥammad [...] al-ʻImādī". "Qad wujida hādhā al-juzʼ min Rawḍ [... ...] kutub al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Muḥammad ibn [... ... ...] 21 Shaʻbān, sanat [...]."

On folio 1a: Endowment statements: "Min al-kutub allatī awqafahā al-faqīr Muḥammad Raḍī al-Dīn ibn Abī al-Luṭf [...] fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻahu, fa-Allāh taʻālá khaṣmuhu. Wa-ḥasbiya Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl". "Naʻam, abqaytuhu ʻalá ṣiḥḥat al-waqf al-ṣaḥīḥ. Uṣaddiqu ʻalá dhālik. Fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻahu, fa-Allāh taʻālá khaṣmuhu, wa-ukhāṣimuhu bayna yaday Allāh taʻālá [...] al-faqīr Yūsuf ibn Muḥammad Raḍī al-Dīn al-Luṭfī. Laṭafa Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Wa-ʻafá ʻannā wa-ʻanhu. M."

On folio 1a: Two readers statements, as follows: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Ḥaqq. Ṭālaʻahu al-wāthiq billāh al-Qawī, Aḥmad ibn Yūsuf al-ʻAdawī, laṭafa Allāh bi-hi wa-jaʻalahu min ḥizbih, bi-mannihi bi-mannih. Āmīn. Sanat 1005 [of the Hijrah = 1596/1597]". "Ṭālaʻa fīhi al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muṣṭafá ibn Muḥammad al-Rajjī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanh."
Folio 1b is written in a different hand.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with the information about "Abū Kabshah": "... qīla fīhi aqwāl. Qīla innahā kānat kunyat abīh li-ummih Wahb ibn ʻAbd Munāf. Wa-qīla kunyat abīhi min al-riḍāʻah, al-Ḥārith ibn ʻAbd al-ʻUzzá. Wa-qīla inna Salmá umm ʻAbd al-Muṭṭalib kāna yukanná abūhā Abā Kabshah, wa-huwa ʻAmr ibn Labīd. Wa-ashhar min hādhihi al-aqwāl kullihā ʻinda al-nās annahum shabbahūhu bi-rajul kāna yaʻbudu al-Shiʻrá waḥdahu dūna al-ʻArab fa-nasabūhu ilayh [... ...]. Wa-dhakar al-Dāraquṭnī isma Abā Kabshah hādhā fī al-Muʼtalif wa-al-mukhtalif, qāl ..."

record.title: A purely legal matter : typescript / written by William Blinn.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: 880-02 Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah dār al-afrāḥ : manuscript / Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī al-Azʹharī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folios 1b-2a)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-Jannah manzilan li-ʻibādih al-muʼminīn, wa-khaṣṣahum fīhā bi-mazīd al-iḥsān, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, shahādatan man qālahā khāliṣan mukhliṣan min qablihi [qalbihi] dakhala al-Jannah, wa-muttiʻa fīhā bi-al-ḥūr wa-al-wildān, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidinā Muḥammadan ʻabudhu wa-rasūluhu, awwal man yadkhul al-Jannah wa-yaftaḥu la-hu Riḍwān ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāh al-qadīr Yūsuf [ibn] Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī ... Hādhihi risālah laṭīfah fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah, jamaʻtuhā min kutub al-mufassirīn wa-min Jādhib al-arwāḥ li-Ibn al-Qayyim ..."
Secundo folio: fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah.
17 x 23.8 cm; written surface: 10 x 17.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 unnumbered quires).
In clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some headings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a (in pencil): "Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah."
On folio 31b (in a different hand): A riddle about kinship.
Folio 32 is blank; text folios 1b-31a.

Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-risālah yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, khamast ʻashar yawman min shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn thalāthah wa-sabʻīn. Wa-kātibuhā al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, Naṣār ibn Manṣūr al-Saʻdīnī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh, wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt, innahu samīʻ qarīb mujīb al-d[ʻawāt]."

Translation of the colophon: "This treatise was completed on blessed Saturday, 15 Rabī al-Ākhir, 1273 [of the Hijrah = 13 December, 1856]. Copied by the poor and despised servant who admits his inability and inadequacy, Naṣṣār ibn Manṣūr al-Saʻdīnī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents, Muslim men and women and the believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead. He [God] hears, and He is near and answers the invocations."

record.title: 880-03 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ. Al-Juzʼ 9 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Bukhārī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Bāb 'Luḥūm al-ḥumur al-unsīyah'. Fīhi ʻan Salamah ʻan al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Ḥaddathanā Ṣadaqah, akhbaranā ʻAbdah ʻan ʻUbayd Allāh ʻan Sālim wa-Nāfiʻ ʻan Ibn ʻUmar, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā: Nahá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻan luḥūm al-ḥumur al-ahlīyah Yawm Khaybar ..."
Secundo folio: ʻAbd al-Wāḥid qāl ḥaddathanā ʻUmārah.
16 x 21.8 cm; written surface: 10 x 14 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative frames (in 12 quires, numbered 2-13).
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings in red; some corrections on the margins; text within double red frame; some water damage without loss of text; catchwords.

On preliminary page: "al-Juzʼ al-tāsiʻ min ithnay ʻashar min kitāb Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl ibn Ibrāhīm ibn al-Mughīrah ibn Bardazbah al-Bukhārī al-Jaʻfī, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Tammat. M."
On the lower edge of the codex: al-Juzʼ al-tāsiʻ min al-Bukhārī al-Sharīf

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "Bāb 'al-Taslīm wa-al-istīdhān thalāthan' ... fa-qāla: Wallāh la-nuqīmanna ʻalayhi bayyinah. Aminkum aḥadun samiʻahu min al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam? Fa-qāla Ubayy ibn Kaʻb: Wallāh la-qaūmu maʻaka, illā aṣghar al-qawm, fa-kuntu aṣghar al-qawm, qumtu maʻahu, fa-akhbara ʻUmar anna al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, qāla dhālik. Wa-qāla Ibn al-Mubārak: Akhbaranī Ibn ʻUyaynah, ḥaddathanī Zayd ibn Khuṣayfah, ʻan Yusr: Samiʻtu Abā Saʻīd bi-hādhā, idhā iddaʻá al-rajul. Tamma al-juzʼ al-tāsiʻ min ithnay ʻashar, wa-yalīhi 'Bāb idhā iddaʻá al-rajul fa-jāʼa li-ahl yastaʼdhin ..."

record.title: 880-03 Matn Alfīyat al-Shaykh al-ʻIrāqī fī muṣṭalaḥ al-Ḥadīth : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn al-ʻIrāqī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Yaqūlu rājī <ʻafwa> Rabbihi al-muqtadiri // ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Athar. Min baʻdi ḥamd Allāhi dhī al-ālāʼi // ʻalá imtinānin jalla ʻan iḥṣāʼi ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-bi-al-ṣaḥīḥi wa-al-ḍaʻīfi qaṣadū.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 14 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; some commentaries on the margins in different hands; text within double red frame; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Matn Alfīyat al-Shaykh al-ʻIrāqī fī muṣṭalaḥ al-Ḥadīth, nafaʻa Allāh taʻālá bi-hā ʻibādah. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá ʻalá ahl al-ʻilm bi-al-Azʹhar, wa-maqarruhu Ruwāq al-Akrād."
On folio 37b, in a different hand, a numerical talisman.

Colophon: "Tammat al-urjūzah al-mubārakah yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, arbaʻah wa-ʻishrūn khalat min Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1166 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min namqihā ʻalá yad kātibihā, afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá raḥmat Allāh, al-faqīr Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad ibn Salāmah al-Ghadmīnī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhih."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed urjūzah was completed on blessed Wednesday, the twenty-fourth of noble month of Ramaḍān, 1166 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [25 July, 1753], may the best prayer and perfect peace be upon him. Copied by th poorest of the servants and the most needy to the mercy of God, the poor Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad ibn Salāmah al-Ghadmīnī, may God forgive him, his parents and his masters."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Alfīyat al-Sīrah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ujhūrī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Yaqūlu rājī man ilayhi al-mahrabu // ʻAbd al-Raḥīmi ibni al-Ḥusayni al-mudhnibu. Aḥmadu Rabbī bi-atammi al-ḥamdi // wa-lil-ṣalāti wa-al-salāmi uhdī. Ilá Nabīyihi wa-arjū Allāha // fī najḥ mā saʼaltuhu shifāhā. Min naẓmi Sīrati al-Nabīyi al-amjadi // Alfīyatan ḥāwiyatan lil-maqṣadi. Wa-li-yaʻlami al-ṭālibu anna al-siyara // tajmaʻu mā qad ṣaḥḥa wa-mā qad unkirā ..."
Secundo folio: al-mahrab, ay, la-hurūb.
15.3 x 21 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound, wrapped in a thick sheet of paper (in 14 unnumbered quires)
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the verses of Alfīyat al-Sīrah in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ Alfīyat al-Sīrah lil-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, farīd ʻaṣrih wa-waḥīd dahrih, al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ujhūrī al-Mālikī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ Jannatihi, bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm. Tamm."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Ḥamad al-Najjārī."

Colophon: "Tamma hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah ... al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ujhūrī al-Mālikī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ Jannatih, bi-mannihi wa-karamih, ʻalá al-Sīrah al-alfīyah lil-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn, al-maʻrūf bi-al-ʻIrāqī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmih fī al-dīn wa-al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu Yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, khāmis ʻashar Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, min shuhūr sanat ithnayn wa-tisʻīn wa-alf, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ʻAbd al-Majīd ibn al-faqīr Salāmah al-Ṭunbārī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed commentary on 'al-Sīrah al-alfīyah' -- of the learned scholar ... al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn, known by the epithet 'al-ʻIrāqī', may God forgive him, and benefit us by his knowledge in religion, in this world and in the hereafter. Amen -- was completed by the learned scholar ... al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ujhūrī al-Mālikī, may God bestow His mercy upon him, and make him dwell in His spacious Paradise, by His benevolence and generosity. Copied on blessed Saturday, 15 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 1092 [of the Hijrah = 4 May, 1681] by the poor and despised ʻAbd al-Majīd son of the poor Salāmah al-Ṭunbārī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him, his parents and those who invoke God's forgiveness, on his behalf. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥ : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. Yaqūlu mawqūf hawāhu al-khaṭīr, ʻabd Allāh wa-ibn ʻabdihi Muḥammad al-Amīr: Allāhumma rafaʻtu ilayka yadī fī taḥammul ḥamdik, fa-anā aḍʻaf ʻan adāʼih, wa-mithluhu bi-ṣalāh wa-salām ʻalá man tushaddu la-hu maṭāyā ṣaḥīḥ al-gharām, Muḥammad wa-ālihi awliyāihi. Ammā baʻd, fa-lammā kānat baṭālat maqdam al-ḥājj bi-Miṣr, adāma Allāh ḥifẓahumā, aradtu an atadhakkara maʻa al-ikhwān qaṣīdat 'Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥ' fī ʻajal, khawfan min al-baṭālah wa-al-kasal, wa-akhadhtuhā bi-taqayīd bayna bayn, mutaʻarriḍan lil-maʻnayayn, fa-aqūlu: Fawāʼid al-ūlá fī taʻrīf al-nāẓim: Huwa al-Imām al-ḥāfiẓ Shihāb al-Dīn Abū al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn Faraḥ, bi-al-ḥāʼ al-muhmalah, ibn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Lakhmī al-Ishbīlī, nisbatan li-Ashbal, madīnah bi-al-Andalus ..."
Secundo folio: yashtaghilu bi-hā bi-Jāmiʻ Dimashq.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 14.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 2 unnumbered quires)
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white aging paper; the verses of 'Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥ' in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥ lil-Shaykh [li-Shaykh] al-Islām, al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Mālikī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn."
Folios 17b-20b are blank; text folios 1b-17a.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, fī 17 Ramaḍān alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1197 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr ilá Allāh Mūsá ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Ṭilyāwī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-lil-Muslimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied on Saturday, 17 Ramaḍān, 1197 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [16 August, 1783], by the poor to God Mūsá ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Ṭilyāwī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him, his parents and Muslims. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen. Amen.Amen.Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah al-Bayqūnīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Bāqī al-Zurqānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻazīz al-qawī al-ghāfir alladhī naḍḍara aṣḥāb al-Ḥadīth wa-ḥassanahum fī al-qadīm wa-al-ḥadīth, wa-rafaʻa qadrahum fī muḍāriʻ al-azmān wa-al-ghābir, wa-waḍaʻa lahum yawm al-Qiyāmah, ʻulūwan li-shaʼnihim, min nūr, manābir, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man indaraja taḥta liwāʼ ḥamdihi kull kābir, wa-inqaṭaʻat bi-wujūdihi awṣāl al-shirk, fa-aṣbaḥa wa-huwa dābir, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-muttafiqīn ʻalá al-hudá, sawāʼun al-akābir wa-al-aṣāghir ... Ammā baʻd, fa-qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān ... an ashraḥa la-hu Manẓūmat al-Bayqūnī fī muṣṭalaḥ al-Ḥadīth ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ṭayr fī al-samāʼ.
23.5 x 16.8 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.2 cm; 22 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap (in 4 unnumbered quires)
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink on white paper; the verses of "al-Manẓūmah al-Bayqūnīyah" and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the label on the front cover: "Sharḥ al-Bayqūnīyah fī muṣṭalaḥ al-Ḥadīth."

Author's colophon: "Wa-qad faraghtu min taswīdihā fī Yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ, fī sanat thamānīn wa-alf. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "I finished writing it on 'Yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ' [10 Muḥarram], the year 1080 [of the Hijrah = 10 June, 1669]. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except is God, the Most High, the All Mighty. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ. Al-Juzʼ 9 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Bukhārī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. Bāb al-Taṣāwīr. Ḥaddathanā Ādam, ḥaddathanā Ibn Abī Dhiʼb, ʻan al-Zuhrī, ʻan ʻUbayd Allāh ibn ʻAbd Allāh, ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās, ʻan Abī Ṭalḥah, qāl, qāla al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Lā tadkhulu al-malāʼikah baytan fīhi kalb wa-lā taṣāwīr. Wa-qāla al-Layth: Ḥaddathanī Yūnus ʻan Ibn Shihāb, qāl, akhbaranī ʻUbayd Allāh annahu samiʻa Ibn ʻAbbās, qāl, samiʻtu Abā Ṭalḥah, qāl, samiʻtu al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Bāb ʻAdhāb al-muṣawwirīn Yawm al-Qiyāmah ..."
Secundo folio: ṣāḥib al-dābbah aḥaqq bi-ṣadr al-dābah.
18 x 27 cm; written surface: 12 x 18 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap.
In good, clear and large naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings in red; text fully vocalized; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Sifr al-tāsiʻ min Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih."
On the lower edge of the codex: "al-Juzʼ al-tāsiʻ min al-Bukhārī al-Sharīf."
On the upper left corner of folio 1a, in red: "Hādhā al-kitāb nāqiṣ, min 'Mīrāth al-asīr' ilá ākhirih."

On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "[Awqafa] hādhā al-kitāb, wa-huwa al-tāsiʻ min Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī, wa-mā qablahu wa-mā baʻdahu, [...] al-ʻabd al-faqīr [... ... ...] ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Khalīl ibn al-Ḥājj Ibrāhīm, Shaykh madīnat Dayrkūsh, min aʻmāl Ḥalab al-maḥrūsah ʻalá [... ... ...] al-ashhur al-thalāthah [... ... ...] fī ṣaḥāʼif al-wāqif al-madhkūr [... ... ...] al-mawqūf al-madhkūr kāna ahdā [... ... ...] bi-Darkūsh [... ... ...] wa-dahr al-dāhirīn, waqfan ṣaḥīḥan sharʻīyan, lā yubāʻu, wa-lā yurhanu, wa-lā yūhabu, fa-man baddalahu [...] fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnahu. Inna Allāh samīʻun ʻalīm. Wa-ashhad ʻalayhi Allāh, fī tārikh shahr Shaʻbān [sanat] arbaʻ wa-thalāthīn wa-thamānimiʼah min al-Hijrah."
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with 'Bāb Mīrāth al-asīr' (Chapter on the Inheritance of the captive), as follows: "[... ... ...] qāl, man taraka mālan fa-li-warathatihi ..."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī. Al-Juzʼ 8 : manuscript / Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Baṭṭāl al-Andalusī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi tawfīqī. Kitāb al-waṣāyā. Bāb al-waṣāyā, wa-qawl al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Waṣīyat al-rajul maktūbah ʻindahu. Wa-qāl Allāh, ʻazza wa-jall: Kutiba ʻalaykum idhā ḥaḍara aḥadakum al-mawt, al-āyah. Fīhi, Ibn ʻImrān, al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, qāl: Mā ḥaqq umriʼin Muslim la-hu shayʼ yuʻṣá fīhi yabītu laylatayn illā waṣīyah maktūbah ʻindahu. Wa-fīhi, ʻAmr ibn al-Ḥārith khatan Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, akhū Juwayrīyah bint al-Ḥārith ..."
Secundo folio: ḥaqqan mimmā qalla aw kathur.
17.5 x 26 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 19 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding (in 22 numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thāmin min Sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī lil-Shaykh Abī al-Ḥasan al-Mālikī al-Andalusī, huwa Ibn Baṭṭāl, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh, wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmih. Āmīn."
Folios 212-213 are blank.
Pages numbered in Indian numerals: 1-425.

Colophon: "Kamula al-juzʼ al-thāmin min Sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, yatlūhu al-juzʼ al-tāsiʻ, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, Kitāb al-libās, wa-qawl Allāh, ʻazza wa-jall: Qul man ḥarrama zīnat Allāh allatī akhraja li-ʻibādih wa-al-ṭayyibāt min al-rizq, al-āyah ... [Sūrat al-Aʻrāf, al-āyah 32]. Ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the colophon: "The eighth part of Sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. It will be followed, God willing, by the ninth part, and the saying of God, may He be glorified and praised: 'Say, Who has prohibited the adornment God has brought forth for His servants, and the wholesome things of sustenance?' ... The verse [Sūrat al-Aʻrāf, verse 32]. God suffices us, He is the best advocate."

record.title: 880-02 al-Jawhar al-munaẓẓam fī ziyārat al-qabr al-mukarram : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn ʻalá al-qawm al-kāfirīn. Naḥmaduka Allāhumma an ahhaltanā -- ʻalá mā fīnā min al-taqṣīr wa-al-taʻāmī ʻan shuhūd āyātik, lāsīyamā wa-qad jāʼa al-nadhīr, wa-al-tabāṭī ʻan al-mubādarah ilá imtithāl awāmirika wa-nawāhīka, wa-al-takhallī ʻan al-taḥallī bi-mā yurḍīka -- lil-safar ilá ziyārat ḥabībika wa-rasūlika wa-nabīyika wa-ṣafīyika wa-khalīlika, insān ʻayn khulafāʼika, wa-wāsiṭat ʻiqd walāʼika ..."
Secundo folio: bi-al-qabūl in shāʼa Allāh.
14.3 x 20.2 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding; cover embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative frame.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Jawhar al-munaẓẓam fī ziyārat al-qabr al-mukarram, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah al-ʻumdah Ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakatihi. Āmīn."
At head of folio 1a: "Ziyārat qabr al-Mukarram."
On folio 1a: An erased endowment statement: "Waqf".
On folio 2a: "... thumma sammaytuhu al-Jawhar al-munaẓẓam fī ziyārat qabr al-mukarram."

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min nisākhatihi ḍuḥá yawm al-Khamīs min shahr Shaʻbān, ʻām thamān wa-khamsīn wa-tisʻimiʼah. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Thulāthāʼ al-mubārak, al-sādis wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sant 1100, ʻalá yaday afqar al-ʻibād ilá Rabbihi al-Mawlá al-muʻṭī al-māniḥ, ṣāḥib al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr Aḥmad Ṣāliḥ, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar al-Shāfiʻī, may God have mercy upon him and benefit us through him. Amen, said: 'I finished writing it on Thursday morning in Shaʻbān, 958 [of the Hijrah = August/September, 1551]'. Copied on blessed Tuesday [probably Thursday], 26 Rabīʻ al-Thanī, 1100 [of the Hijrah = 17 February, 1689], by the poorest of the servants of his Lord, the Giver and Sustainer, he of disability and insufficiency, Aḥmad Ṣāliḥ, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Manāsik al-ḥajj : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Nūrī al-Ṣafāqisī.
record.note: Title of Manāsik al-ḥajj from folio 1a.
Title of Masāʼil al-ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj from incipit (folio 91b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Manāsik al-Ḥajj: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-muḥaqqiq, al-walī al-ṣāliḥ al-zāhid al-nāṣiḥ, waḥīd dahrih wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, Sayyidī ʻAlī al-Nūrī al-Ṣafāqisī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala baytahu al-mubārak alladhī bi-Bakkata hudan wa-raḥmatan wa-taṭhīran, wa-daʻā ʻibādahu ilá ziyāratihi, fa-ajābahu bi-al-talbiyah man khaṣṣahu bi-ʻināyatih, wa-aʻadda la-hu ajran kabīran ..."
Secundo folio of Manāsik al-Ḥajj: wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā.

Incipit of Masāʼil al-Ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi Masāʼil al-ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj. Idhā arāda an yuḥrima bi-al-ḥajj yuqallimu aẓāfirahu, wa-yaquṣṣa shāribahu, wa-yaḥliqa ʻānatahu, wa-yantifa ibṭahu, wa-yaghtasila aw yatawaḍḍaʼa, wa-yataṭayyiba, thumma yalbasa izāran wa-ridāʼan, thumma yuṣalliya rakʻatayn ..."
Secundo folio of Masāʼil al-ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj: sunnat al-iḥrām thumma baʻda al-ṣalāh.
11 x 16.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 13 cm; 12 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative frame.
In clear Maghribī script, in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in purple; no catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Manāsik al-ḥajj lil-Shaykh Sayyidī ʻAlī al-Nūrī al-Ṣafāqisī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On the back of the front cover to preliminary page, in crude hand: Table of contents of "Manāsik al-ḥajj".
Folios 50-55a are blank.
On folios 55b-59a, in crude hand, in pencil: Scribbles, lists of items and calculations.
On folios 82a-83a, in crude and different hand: Table of contents for "Masāʼil al-ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj".
Folios 83b-91a are blank.
Colophon of Manāsik al-ḥajj: "Intahá bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ākhir daʻwānā an al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Ah. Ah."

Translation of the colophon of Manāsik al-ḥajj: "It is completed by the praise of God and His benevolent assistance. There is no power nor might except in God the Most High, the All Mighty. Our concluding invocation is: Praise be to God. Lord of the Universe."

Colophon of Masāʼil al-ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj: No colophon. Text ends with: "Lā ilāha illā Allāh. Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh. Allāhumma ṣalli wa-sallim wa-bārik ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn."

record.title: 880-02 Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh rāfaʻa li-ahl al-sunnah al-Muḥammadīyah fī al-khāfiqayn aʻlāman, waḍaʻa waḍḥ [wa-waḍaʻa bi-wāḍiḥ] adillatihim min shubah al-mukhālifīn aʻlāman, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka la-hu, shahādatan takūnu bi-al-takhalluṣ fī al-dārayn iʻlāman, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidinā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-mamnūḥ man ittabaʻahu al-jinān aʻlāman, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, mā uyyidat qawāʻid al-ʻaqāʼid, wa-mā ḥulliyat al-jiyād bi-jawāhir al-fawāʼid ..."
Secundo folio: bi-ṣarf shāghilihi li-mā jāʼa.
15 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In red cardboard cover.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords in purple; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ ʻAbd al-Salām ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl."
On folio 1a: Ownership statement: "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá al-Ḥājj Aḥmad Qalāqiṭ [ʻufiya] ʻanh."
On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Itḥāf al-murīd bi-jawharat al-tawḥīd'."

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu wa-jāmiʻuhu al-faqīr ilá Allāh, taʻālá subḥānuhu, al-ʻālim al-fāḍil, al-bāriʻ al-kāmil, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Shaykh al-Islām, farīd dahrih, wa-waḥīd ʻaṣrih, al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī: Faraghtu min jamʻihi yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, li-ʻishrīn khalat min Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, min shuhūr al-sanah al-sābiʻah wa-al-arbaʻīn baʻda al-alf. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author and compiler, the poor to God (the Most High, may He be praised), the honorable, perfect, and learned scholar, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Shaykh al-Islām, the unique in his time and age, the learned Imām, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī, said: I finished compiling the book on blessed Thursday, the twentieth of noble Ramaḍān, the year 1047 [of the Hijrah = 5 February, 1638]. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Powerful. God suffices us, He is the best advocate."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhih fī laylat al-Jumʻah sādis ʻishrī [ʻishrīn] Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat sabʻ wa-sittīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijratihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Faḍl al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God and His help. Copied on Friday night, 26 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1267 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [28 February, 1851], may God pray on him and grant him peace, by the poor Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Faḍl al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him, his parents, and all the faithful." At the left margin of the colophon the copyist states that he made this copy for himself, and stamps his seal.

record.title: 880-02 Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī.
record.note: Title from from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī rafaʻa li-ahl al-sunnah al-Muḥammadīyah fī al-khāfiqayn aʻlāman, wa-waḍaʻa bi-wāḍiḥ adillatihim min shubah al-mukhālifīn aʻlāman, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka la-hu, shahādatan takūnu bi-al-takhalluṣ fī al-dārayn iʻlāman, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidinā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-mamnūḥ man ittabaʻahu min al-jinān aʻlāman, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, mā uyyidat qawāʻid al-ʻaqāʼid, wa-mā ḥulliyat al-jiyād bi-jawāhir al-farāʼid ..."
Secundo folio: al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá ṣilātih bi-kasr al-Ṣād.
21 x 15.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap (in seven numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of Jawharat al-tawḥīd and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawhart al-tawḥīd, li-Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Salām ibn al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī al-Mālikī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. wa-nafaʻanā bi-himā. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Itḥāf al-murīd bi-jawharat al-tawḥīd'."

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu wa-jāmiʻuhu ʻAbd al-Salām ibn al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī: Faraghtu min jamʻihi yawm al-Khamīs, ʻishrīn khalat min Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, min shuhūr al-sanah al-sābiʻah wa-al-arbaʻīn baʻda al-alf. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author and compiler ʻAbd al-Salām ibn al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī, said: I finished compiling the book on Thursday, the twentieth of noble Ramaḍān, the year 1047 [of the Hijrah = 5 February, 1638]. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Powerful. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and grant him peace."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, tāsiʻ ʻashar shahr Jumādá al-ūlá, sanat 1140, ʻalá yad kātibihi, bi-yadihi al-fāniyah, al-faqīr al-fānī, Saqr al-Samānī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "Copied on Wednesday, 19 Jumādá al-Ūlá, 1140 [of the Hijrah, 2 January, 1728], by the perishing hand of the poor and perishing servant Saqr al-Samānī, may God forgive him, his parents, and the Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī.
record.note: Title from from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī rafaʻa li-ahl al-sunnah al-Muḥammadīyah fī al-khāfiqayn aʻlāman, wa-waḍaʻa bi-wāḍiḥ adillatihim min shubah al-mukhālifīn aʻlāman, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka la-hu, shahādatan takūnu bi-al-takhalluṣ fī al-dārayn iʻlāman, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidinā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-mamnūḥ man ittabaʻahu min al-jinān aʻlāman, ṣallá Allāh wasallama ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, mā abdat qawāʻid al-ʻaqāʼid, wa-mā ḥulliyat al-jiyād bi-jawāhir al-farāʼid ..."
Secundo folio: iqtidāʼan bi-al-Kitāb al-ʻAzīz.
13.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of Jawharat al-tawḥīd and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām ʻalá matn al-Jawharah, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmih."
On folio 1a: Ownership statement, as follows: "Dakhala fī Mulk al-ʻabd al-fānī, al-faqīr Muḥammad al-ʻAqqād ibn Aḥmad, ghafara Allāh [la-hu] wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharah al-tawḥīd'."
Folios 21a-32b are written in a different hand, in naskh script.
On folios 78b-80b: An invocation, in a different hand.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārakah, sābiʻ ʻasharī Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-ʻasharah min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Tamm." Below the colophon: "Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Ghafara Allāh li-kātibihā, aw, mālikihā, wa-man ṭālaʻa fīhā, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Friday, 17 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 1110 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [23 October, 1698], may the best of prayer and peace be upon him. It is completed." Below the colophon: "May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. May God forgive its copyist, or, its owner, he who reads it and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 al-Ṭarīqah al-Muḥammadīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Bīr ʻAlī al-Burkawī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻalanā ummatan wasaṭan, khayra umam, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá afḍal man ūliya al-nubūwah wa-al-ḥukm, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-muqtadīn bi-hi fī al-qaṣd wa-al-shiyam, mā dāmat al-samāwāt wa-al-arḍ, wa-mā taʻāqabat al-aḍwāʼ wa-al-ẓulam. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-ʻaql wa-al-naql mutawāfiqān, wa-al-Kitāb wa-al-Sunnah mutaṭābiqān. Inna al-dunyā fāniyah, sarīʻat al-zawāl wa-al-kharāb, ʻizzuhā dhill, wa-niʻamuhā niqam, wa-sharābuhā sarāb, wa-inna al-dār al-ākhirah la-hiya al-ḥayawān, uʻiddat lil-muttaqīn min ahl al-īmān ..."
Secundo folio: bi-aqṣá juhd matīn.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 6 x 15.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In buckram cover with brown leather spine and corners.

In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and the abbreviations of the references of the Ḥadīth sources in red; many commentaries and notes on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
On the preliminary leaf: "al-Ṭarīqah al-Muḥammadīyah lil-Burkawī."

On folio 1a: 1. Shahādah (Statement of faith) by Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá al-Jisr ibn Akwārwā. 2. Ownership statement: "Dakhala fī nawbat al-faqīr Bakr ibn [...] Bakr Sallākh, sanat 1297 [1879/1880]". 3. Seal of Bakr Ṣidqī. 4. Shahādah (Statement of faith) by Abū Bakr ibn al-marḥūm Muḥammad Ṣāliḥ Ḥammād al-Madanī. 5. Ownership statement: "Intaqala ilá ḥawz al-rājī min [Allāh] al-najāh fī yawm al-maʻād Abī Bakr ibn al-marḥūm Muḥammad Ṣāliḥ Ḥammād ghufira la-humā, taḥrīran fī awākhir Ṣafar al-khayr 229 [1229 = 20 February, 1814], wa-annā bi-Makkah al-Mukarramah." 6. A list of the abbreviations used in the treatise.

On folio 2a: "... fa-aradʹtu an uṣannifa al-Ṭarīqah al-Muḥammadīyah, wa-aḥbabtu an ubayyina al-Sīrah al-Aḥmadīyah, ḥattá yaʻriḍa ʻalyahā kull sālik, fa-yatamayyaza al-muṣīb ʻan al-mukhṭiʼ wa-al-nājī min al-hālik ..."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-ḥirmān mā ʻadā al-awlād al-dhukūr wa-ʻadam al-qaḍāʼ wa-al-tanfīdh ẓulm, wa-taṣarrufuhum fīhā wa-taṣarruf man ʻayyanahum al-sulṭān in lam yakun fī al-warathah awlād dhukūr taṣarruf fī mulk al-ghayr, fa-yakūnu al-ḥāṣil minhā khabīthan. Qāla fī al-Tātārkhānīyah: Rajul ghaṣaba arḍan fa-ajjarahā wa-akhadha ghallatahu, aw, zaraʻa al-arḍ kaddan fa-kharaja thalāth akrār, yaʼkhudhu raʼs mālahu al-kurr wa-yataṣaddaqu bi-al-ghallah wa-al-kurrayn wa-yaḍmanu al-nuqṣān, wa-hādhā aqwāhum jamīʻan. Intahá. Wa-yakūnu akhdh baʻḍ ..."

record.title: Babel, Babel, little tower : typescript / by Doric Wilson.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: De ecclesiastica potestate (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a small, informal Gothic bookhand.

Decoration: numerous 2 and 3-line initials in red and blue with penwork in the contrasting color. Section headings in red and blue present at the top of each folio. Paraph marks alternating in red and blue.
Layout: in 2 columns of 59 lines each.

Damage: the bifolium is composed of two separate fragments with contiguous text; one fragment comprises the top half of the bifolium, while the other comprises the bottom. The fragments may have been used as a wrapper, as uneven staining and glue residue is present. Discoloration is relatively even across both fragments. There is major loss of text on 1r and 2v due to staining and tearing.

record.title: Entre deux caresses : manuscript / par Georges Damian.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: Biblical commentary (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in two, possibly three, small Gothic bookhands, the first rather rounded and the second and possibly third more angular.
Decoration: 1r contains several paraphs in red. 2v contains space for a 2-line capital "D."
Layout: 1r in 2 columns of 46 lines each. 2r in 2 columns of roughly 45 lines each.

record.title: Legenda aurea (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a heavily abbreviated and informal Gothic bookhand.

Decoration: alternating paraphs in red and blue. First letter after each paraph touched in red. Remnants of a 3-4 line initial in red with blue penwork can be seen in the margin where the previous leaf was excised from the bifolium
Layout: in 2 columns of 34 lines each.

Damage: the leaf has been heavily damaged and probably used as a pastedown; remnants of glue and paper can be observed on the verso. Text on the recto is undamaged, though there is some loss on the verso.

record.title: L'Ange galant, ou, la vie amoureuse, fastueuse et finalement malheureuse de Madame la Comtesse du Barry : typescript / par Renée Dunan.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: Ballad of the cities : typescript / by Jack Micheline.
record.note: Title from cover.

record.title: Robert Louis Stevenson notebook : manuscript.
record.note: Title page: "Original autograph poems."
Accompanied by a printed description created by the vendor.
Binding by Sangorski & Sutcliffe: full red morocco binding with gilt lettering and decoration.

record.title: Annotated copy of The London censorship, 1914-1919 : manuscript / by members of the staff past and present.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

record.title: Canon medicinae (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a heavily abbreviated, Gothic hand.

Decoration: each medicinal entry begins with a 3-line initial, alternating red and blue with penwork in the contrasting color. Headings at the top of each page in red and blue. Each column contains decorative borderwork consisting of elongated strokes alternating in red and blue with red penwork.
Layout: in two columns of 68 lines each.

Damage: the fragment has been removed from a binding, where it possibly served as a wrapper. Glue and binding material are still attached to one side of the leaf; the other side is discolored with offsetting from the later book. A piece from the spine remains attached and reads "Bbb" [?].

record.title: Decretals (fragment).
record.note: Script: main text in an informal Gothic hand in dark brown ink; marginal annotations in a small, heavily abbreviated Gothic hand in lighter brown ink.

Decoration: new sections begin with 3 to 4-line initials alternating red and blue with penwork in the contrasting color. Occasional 1-line initials in red and blue appear in the text. The heading of each page has information on the book and number in red and blue. Occasional paraph marks in blue.
Layout: two columns of 40 lines each with surrounding gloss.
Disposition: the leaf has been extracted from a binding; leather from the binding is still attached to the verso. The verso has near complete loss of text.

record.title: 880-03 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Bukhārī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ḥāfiẓ Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl ibn Ibrāhīm ibn al-Mughīrah al-Bukhārī, Raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. Bāb Kayafa kāna badʼ al-waḥy ilá Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-qawl Allāh jalla dhikruhu: Innā awḥaynā ilayka kamā awḥaynā ilá Nūḥin wa-al-nabīyīn min baʻdih. Ḥaddathanā al-Ḥamīdī qāl ḥaddathanā Sufyān qāl ..."
Secundo folio: fīhi wa-huwa al-taʻabbud.
18 x 26.7 cm; written surface: 12 x 20 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In green buckram binding with flap.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; text fully vocalized; catchwords.
Leaf 1 seems to have been replaced with a different hand and a different kind of paper.
On the lower edge of the codex: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min al-Bukhārī al-Sharīf."
On the preliminary page in indelible pencil: "Rubʻ al-Bukhārī al-awwal. 880."
On the upper left corner of folio 2a, in red: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min al-Bukhārī min arbaʻat ajzāʼ."
The first volume ends with "Bāb al-muʻtakif."

Colophon: "Ākhir al-juzw al-awwal min ajzāʼ arbaʻah, wa-yatlūhu al-juzʼ al-thānī 'Bāb al-Buyūʻ', in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Khātim al-Nabīyīn wa-imām al-mursalīn. Wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan Sādātinā aṣḥāb Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. ʻAlá yad aqall ʻibād Allāh wa-aḥwajihim ilá raḥmatih, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Muqrī al-Shāfiʻī, al-nāsikh, al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Sharīf, bi-tārīkh nahār al-Sabt, thāmin ʻasharī shahr Ṣafar al-khayr, min shuhūr sanat thamānīn wa-thamānimiʼah. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-kafá. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Sanat 880."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the first part of the four parts. It will be followed, God willing, by the second part 'Bāb al-Buyūʻ' [Chapter on sales]. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Seal of the Prophets and the leader of the messengers. May God be pleased with our Masters, all the companions of the Messenger of God. Amen. Amen. Copied by the least among the servants of God and the neediest to His mercy, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Muqrī al-Shāfiʻī, the copyist, known by Ibn al-Sharīf, on Saturday, 18 Ṣafar, the year 880 [of the Hijrah = 2 July, 1475]. God suffices us, and that is enough. There is no power nor might except in God the Most High, the All Mighty. The year 880."

record.title: Elizabeth I, Queen of England order to Sir Thomas Heneage for payment of alms money : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Signed "Elizabeth R" at head of document.
Dated from "our manor of St. James the seventh day of Aprill in the five and thirtith yeare of oure Reigne."
Signature in lower right corner of recto: "J. Wood."
Papered seal affixed to recto.
Bound with: two prints of Queen Elizabeth I, made by unidentified printers, window mounted.
Docketed on verso by John Dix.
Binding: modern brown straight-grained morocco, gilt.

record.title: Yellow drum : typescript.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: Indenture between William Curtys and Geoffrey Walkeden and Thomas Walkeden.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Script: secretary.
Docketed on verso in a contemporary hand; note on verso in nineteenth-century hand.
Decoration: enlarged and calligraphic initial letter.
With: red wax seal bearing the merchant's mark of William Curtys appended on parchment tag.

record.title: Account of expences on a tour to France, July 14th 1788 : manuscript.
record.note: Title from item.
Bound in 20th century vellum.

record.title: Indenture between John Moore and Nicholas Barbon and John Richardson : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Signatures of John Moore and Nicholas Barbon at the foot of the document. Their paper-wrapped wax seals appended on parchment tags.
Decoration: enlarged and calligraphic initial letter.
Script: secretary.
Signatures of witnesses on verso.

record.title: Tancred Robinson annotations in John Ray's Synopsis methodica stirpium Britannicarum : manuscript.
record.note: Inscription on recto of front flyleaf: "Ex dono Autoris May 19 1690 Tancred Robinson."
Binding: contemporary full paneled calf, rebacked and recornered.

record.title: Fifty years of an actor's work, 1871-1921 : typescript / Chas. B. Wells.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: Autographed copy of Autographic record of patrons of the Chronicles of America : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: Passports of George Treherne Thomas.
record.note: Both passports are in contemporary wallet style bindings, with flaps intact. Both bear the gilt-stamped name of George Treherne Thomas.

record.title: My first memory book : manuscript / Katharine P. Hastings.
record.note: Title from title page.
From cover: The Keystone Note Book.

record.title: Notebook : manuscript / Gerard Malanga.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: L'Orfeo [microform] : tragicomedia per musica.
record.note: Manuscript of the libretto by Francesco Buti to the opera by Luigi Rossi.

record.title: Commonplace book.
record.note: Bound in contemporary gilt- and blind-tooled calf

record.title: Accounts of churchwardens and overseers of the poor in Middleton, Thornham, Hopwood, Pilsworth, Birkle-cum-Bamford (Bury) : manuscript.
record.note: Title from dealer's description.
Textblock mostly loose in contemporary blindruled parchment.

record.title: Amos Mix letter, Knox County, Ohio, to David Frost, Waterbury, Connecticut, 1811 December 18 : manuscript.
record.note: Letter is dated 1811 December 18, with an autograph postscript by Mix dated 1812 July 23.

record.title: The Oxford declarations.
record.note: Manuscript described in John Griffiths' manscript table of contents as "abstracts and remarks on the number of signatures to the three declarations" of the University of Oxford in 1834.
Catpion title.

"About 2670 persons were entitled to sign the three declarations. Of these a large number, say 170, were either abroad or ill or could not be found. There remain as dispentients about 485 : so that the opponents of the bill outnumbered its supporters in a greater ratio than that of four to one"--Page 1.

record.title: Maxims : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page.
Caption title: "Aphorisms."

Annotated on title page in a nineteenth-century hand: "Selected by our great-aunt, Elizabeth Coltman, from various writings of her own: to which new ones, also her own, are added. Ala / D. E. D. Dec. 9, 1881."
Accompanied by 20th-century typed transcript.
Binding: contemporary full calf, gilt, rebacked.

record.title: Korrespondenzen italienische Kardinäle und anderer Personen, besonders italiener, an Herzog Johann Friedrich.
record.note: Letters from Johann Friedrich's Italian correspondents between the years 1667-1679. Items of musical importance include letters of Francesco Maria Massi (210 letters, 1669-1676), Pietro Dolfino (58 letters, 1669-1678), Antonio Sartorio (18 letters, 1672-1679), and Nicolò Bérégan (27 letters, 1669-1678).
Detailed description in: Nel theatro di tutta l'Europa : Venetian-Hanoverian patronage in 17th-century Europe / Vassilis Vavoulis. Lucca : Libreria musicale italiana, c2010.

record.title: R. D. Mussey letter, Washington, D.C., to Nathaniel Prentiss Banks, 1866 March 21 : manuscript.
record.note: Letter is accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: Poems : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Disbound section from a larger volume. Text closely trimmed, with slight loss at the top and/or bottom of some leaves.
Cropped inscription at the foot of l1r: "Kilkenny. october: 16: 17[09?]".
Inscription at the foot of l26v: "Kilkenny. April 9th 1709: John Cramer."
Accompanied by a typescript list of contents created by an unidentified former owner.

record.title: Evelyn Craddock Neish memoir : typescript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Manuscript note indicates that the memoir was transcribed from audiocassettes by J. Donaldson, likely Neish's daughter Jocelyn Neish Donaldson.

record.title: Collection of alchemical texts.
record.note: Accompanied by five sheets of notes in a twentieth-century hand.
Script: Italic cursive.
Binding: unbound. Seven signatures loosely sewn into an 18th century? paper wrapper.

record.title: The vision : manuscript.
record.note: Title from caption.
Footnote on the first page in a later hand: "my great GrandMother."

record.title: Samuel Vince letter to Charles Hutton : manuscript.
record.note: Annotated at the foot of the letter: "Addressed to Dr. Charles Hutton, and given by him to William Upcott."

record.title: Commonplace book in English and Latin.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Autograph of Henry Lilly ("Henry Lylly") on f1r.
Script: most entries in secretary script.
Binding: modern paper wrapper.
Accompanied by a partial transcript.

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Mūsá al-Khayālī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bika iʻtimād [iʻtimādī]. Yā Karīm. Qāla al-shāriḥ al-niḥrīr, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khaṭīr, baʻdamā tayammana bi-al-tasmīyah, al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Aqūlu: Fī taʻqīb al-tasmiyah bi-al-taḥmīd iqtidāʼ bi-uslūb al-Kitāb al-Majīd, wa-ʻmal bi-mā shāʻ, bal waqaʻa ʻalayhi al-ijmāʻ, wa-imtithāl bi-ḥadīthay al-ibtidāʼ, wa-mā yutawahhamu min taʻāruṣihmā, fa-madfūʻ immā bi-ḥaml al-ibtidāʼ ʻalá al-ʻurfī al-mumtadd, aw bi-ḥaml aḥadihimā ʻalá al-ḥaqīqī wa-al-ākhar ʻalá al-iḍāfī ..."
Secundo folio: ʻadam sharikat al-ghayr fī jalāl al-dhāt.
15.5 x 21.2 cm; written surface: 7 x 11 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: Cardboard binding.

In naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the commentary of al-Taftāzānī preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; markings in red; numerous notes and commentaries on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Khayālī fī Ḥāshiyat Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid."
Folio 77a is blank.
On folios 77b-78b: Anecdotes, quotations, poems in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish in different hands.

The text of al-Khayālī ends with: "... ṣifāt fāḍilah yaḍmaḥillu afḍal al-ʻamal fī janbihā. Qultu: Hādhā al-iddiʻāʼ mimmā lā yuqbalu fī ḥaqq al-anbiyāʼ, wa-bi-hi yaẓharu anna hādhā al-wajh ayḍan yufīdu tafḍīlahum faqaṭ, wa-anna al-faḍl bi-yad Allāh yuʼtīhi man yashāʼ, wa-Allāh dhū al-faḍl al-ʻaẓīm."

Colophon: "Qad tammat hādhā al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād wa-al-faqīr al-mudhnib al-ḥaqīr, wa-Allāh ʻalá kull shayʼ khabīr, Allāhumma min suʼl Munkar wa-Nakīr, Ḥamzah ibn Idrīs ibn Khalīl ibn Ilyās, ghafara Allāh lahum ajmaʻīn. Tārīkhuhu sant 974."

Translation of the colophon: "This book is completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the weakest of the servants, the poor, the sinner and despised Ḥamzah ibn Idrīs ibn Khalīl ibn Ilyās. May God forgive all of them. God is knowledgeable of everything. O God! [Spare] from the questioning of Munkar and Nakīr [the two angels questioning the dead in the grave]. Dated in the year 974 [of the Hijrah = 1566 or 1567]."

record.title: 880-03 Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣāwī ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣāwī.
record.note: Title from from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī manna ʻalaynā bi-al-īmān wa-al-Islām, wa-akhrajanā bihimā min ẓulmat al-shirk wa-al-awhām, wa-ashhad an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah shahādatan addakhiruhā ʻinda al-khitām, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh sayyid al-anām, ṣallá Allāh wa-sallama ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih al-bararah al-kirām, wa-ʻalá ashyākhinā wa-ashyākhihim ilá muntahá al-Islām. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-murtajī ghafra al-masāwī Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Mālikī al-Khalwatī al-Ṣāwī: Hādhihi Taqyīdāt ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd lil-Imām al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm ibn Ḥasan al-Mālikī al-Laqānī, raʼs silsilat hādhā al-fann, wa-min arbāb al-aḥwāl wa-al-kashf, wa-ʻāsha muddata ʻumrihi lam yura mā taḥta jubbatihi, min baghtah wa-lā ghayrihā, wa-kāna muhāban jiddan lā yukallimuhu illā al-qalīl min al-nās ..."
Secundo folio: jālis bi-jānib ḍarīḥ al-Sayyid al-Badawī.
17.5 x 25 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 18 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard.
In fafir naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords. Folios 24a-27b are written in a different hand on a different kind of paper.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣāwī ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd."
On folio 1a, in pencil: "Wa-hādhihi mufīdah jiddan li-man ṭālaʻahā wa-atqanahā itqānan jayyidan. Tamm." "Qawluhu 'Hādhihi' ay, al-muʼallafah."

Colophon: "Wa-qad tamma mā ajrāhu Allāh ʻalá yad al-faqīr min al-taqyīdāt allatī kharajat bi-ḥawl Allāh wa-qūwatih, maʻa al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, ākhir yawm min Ramaḍān al-mubārak, sanat ithnayn wa-ʻishrīn baʻda al-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat al-Bashīr al-Nadhīr, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, thāmin ʻashar Jumādá al-Ākhir, sanat 1261, wāḥid wa-sittūn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-ʻAmrūsī laqaban, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "Completed are what God facilitated, by the hand of the poor one, of the glosses, which were recorded by the power and might of God, despite [my] incapacity and insufficiency, on blessed Monday, the last day in blessed Ramaḍān, the year 1222 [1 December, 1807] of the Hijrah of al-Bashīr al-Nadhīr [Prophet Muḥammad], may God pray on him, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Copied on blessed Monday, 18 Jumādá al-Ākhir, 1261 [24 June, 1845] of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs nobleness and honor, by the hand of the poor Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-ʻAmrūsī laqaban, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Hudhudī ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-Ṣaʻīdī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wājib al-dawām, al-munfarid bi-al-ījād wa-al-iʻdām, alladhī khalaqa al-insān wa-ʻallamahu al-kalām, wa-anʻama ʻalayhi bi-niʻmatay al-īmān wa-al-Islām, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-al-tābiʻīn lahum bi-iḥsān, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayan mā dāmat al-duhūr wa-al-azmān. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá al-Munjī min al-mahālik, ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAdwī, al-Muqtadī bi-al-Imām Mālik: Hādhihi ḥawāshin ʻalá sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Hudhudī ʻalá matn al-ʻAllāmah al-wariʻ al-zāhid, al-jāmiʻ shawārid al-fawāʼid, walī Allāh bi-lā nizāʻ, al-Sanūsī, al-musammá bi-al-ṣughrá, tūḍiḥu mushkilahu, wa-tusahhilu muʻḍilahu, jamaʻtuhā min ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-Saktānī [ʻĪsá ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, died 1652], ʻalá sharḥ al-muṣannif, wa-ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-Ghunaymī [Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad, died 1634] ʻalayhi ayḍan, wa-ḥāshiyat Shaykhinā al-Ṣaghīr [probably ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad, died 1319 or 1320], raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-ghayrihā mimmā uṣarriḥu bi-hi wa-mimmā fataḥa bi-hi Rabbunā. Wa-Allāh asʼal an yanfaʻa bi-hā kamā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-rada ʻalá ism fa-huwa ʻalá madlūlih.
16.3 x 21.3 cm; written surface: 10 x 17 cm; 24-29 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap.

In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of Sharḥ al-Hudhudī preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; some markings in red; text within double red frame; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-ʻAdawī al-Ṣaʻīdī ʻalá Sharḥ al-Hudhudī ʻalá matn al-Sanūsī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: "Nimrat 6598."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Aḥmad [... ... ...] ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Sanat 1204 [1789/1790]". An illegible seal. "Aḥmad al-Hāshimī al-Ḥanafī."

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih bi-al-tamām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, al-tāsiʻ min shahr Ṣafar al-khayr, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1164, arbaʻah wa-sittīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-ʻAlī, ʻabduhu ʻAlī al-Manīlī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It is entirely completed, by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God in all situations. This noble copy was concluded on blessed Thursday, 9 Ṣafar, 1164 [7 January, 1751] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the hand of its copyist, the poor to his All Mighty Lord, His servant ʻAlī al-Manīlī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-ʻAḍudīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Asʻad al-Dawwānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā man waffaqanā li-taḥqīq al-ʻaqāʼid al-Islāmīyah, wa-ʻaṣamanā ʻan al-taqlīd fī al-uṣūl wa-al-furūʻ al-kalāmīyah, ṣalli ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-muʼayyad bi-qawāṭiʻ al-ḥujaj wa-al-burhān, al-mushayyad bi-lawāmiʻ al-sayf wa-al-sinān, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-aʻyān al-mubashsharīn bi-al-dukhūl wa-al-khulūd fī ghuraf al-jinān. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūl al-faqīr ilá ʻafw Rabbihi al-ghanī, Muḥammad ibn Asʻad al-Ṣiddīqī al-Dawwānī, mallakahu Allāh nawāṣī al-amānī: Inna al-ʻAqāʼid al-ʻAḍudīyah lam tadaʻ qāʻidah min uṣūl al-ʻaqāʼid al-dīnīyah illā wa-atat ʻalayhā, wa-lam tatruk min ummahātihā wa-muhimmātihā masʼalah illā wa-qad ṣarraḥat bi-hā, aw awmaʼat ilayhā ..."
Secundo folio: idh kull mā waṣala ilayya min dhālik.
16.2 x 23.8 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 13 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap (in 9 unnumbered quires). On the label of the cover is written the title of another book: "Matn Tahdhīb al-kalām lil-Saʻd al-Taftāzānī."
In clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-ʻAqāʼid al-ʻAḍudīyah in red or purple; some notes and corrections on the margins.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Jalāl al-Dawwānī ʻalá al-ʻAqāʼid al-ʻAḍudīyah. Allāhumma tammim bi-al-khayr. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallam."

Colophon: "Tamma hādhā al-sharḥ al-jalīl al-mansūb lil-ʻAllāmah al-Dawwānī, ṣāḥib al-taṣānīf al-ʻadīdah, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá [... ... ... ...] fī laylat al-Thalāth, al-muwāfiqah thamāniyah wa-ʻishrīn Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-tisʻah wa-tisʻīn [1299]. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-khitām. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá ashraf al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This glorious commentary, attributed to the scholar al-Dawwānī, author of various works, is copied by the poor to God Most High [... ... ... ...] on Tuesday night, 28 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1299 [17 February, 1882]. Praise be to God on the completion. May God pray on the Most Noble of mankind [Prophet Muḥammad], his family and all his companions. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 Ṣafwat al-Zubad fīmā ʻalayhi al-muʻtamad : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Ḥusayn ibn Raslān al-Ramlī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh dhī al-jalāli // wa-Shāriʻi al-ḥarām wa-al-ḥalāli. Thumma ṣalāti Allāhi maʻ salāmī // ʻalá al-Nabī al-Muṣṭafá al-Tihāmī ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-inna min abʻad qulūb al-nāsi.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; text mostly vocalized; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Ṣafwat al-zubad fīmā ʻalayhi al-muʻtamad, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-walī al-ʻārif Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Raslān, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā min barakātih. Āmin. Āmin. Āmin."

The text ends with: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-takammuli // sāʼilu tawfīqin li-ḥusni al-ʻamali. Thumma al-ṣalātu wa-al-salāmu abadā // ʻalá al-Nabī al-Hāshimī Aḥmadā. Wa-al-āli wa-al-ṣuḥbi wa-man lahum qafā // wa-ḥasbunā Allāhu taʻālá wa-kafá."
Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."
Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God alone."

record.title: 880-02 al-Ṣawāʻiq al-muḥriqah fī al-radd ʻalá al-zanādiqah wa-ahl al-ḍalāl wa-al-mubdiʻah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. Yā Karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ikhtaṣṣa Nabīyahu Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-aṣḥāb ka-al-nujūm, fa-awjaba ʻalá al-kāffah taʻẓīmahum wa-iqtifāʼ ḥaqīqat mā kānū ʻalayhi li-mā muniḥūhu min ḥaqāʼiq al-maʻārif wa-al-ʻulūm. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, shahādatan andariju bi-hā fī silkihim al-manẓūm. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidinā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh alladhī ḥabāhu bi-sirrihi al-maktūm al-Ḥayy al-Qayyūm. Wa-baʻd, fa-innī suʼiltu qadīman fī taʼlīf kitāb yubayyinu ḥaqīqat khilāfat al-Ṣiddīq wa-imārat Ibn al-Khaṭṭāb, fa-ajabtu ilá dhālika musāriʻan fī khidmat hādhā al-jināb ..."
Secundo folio: ahl al-bidaʻ sharr al-khalq wa-al-khalīqah.
15.8 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard (mostly damaged) cover with flap and brown leather on spine and flap (in 17 numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At the head of several folios, an endowment statement and illegible seal: "Waqf dhurrīyah, lā yubāʻ wa-lā yushrá wa-lā yūhab."
On the back cover is exposed part of a leaf from another manuscript which seems to be dealing with "bayʻ" (sales) according to Islamic law.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Ṣawāʻiq al-muḥriqah fī al-radd ʻalá al-zanādiqah wa-ahl al-ḍalāl wa-al-mubdiʻah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ḥāfiẓ, al-Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ al-jinān. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Fī mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Hidāyat [?] Allāh, aḥad khuddām al-ʻilm al-sharīf. Fī shahr Shawwāl li-sanat 1083 [January/February, 1673]".

On folio 1a: An ownership and an endowment statements, as follows: "Malakahu min faḍl Rabbihi, sātir al-ʻayb, Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Hudayb. Wa-min baʻdihi dakhala fī mulk al-Ḥājj [...] al-Shuḥnah, wa-huwa waqafahu waqf dhurrīyah ʻaṣabīyah, lā yubāʻu wa-lā yūhab."
On the front cover in pencil: "Hādhā al-kitāb lā yubāʻ."

Author's colophon: "Yaqūlu muʼallifuhu, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḍiya ʻanh: Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu fī ʻashr Shawwāl, sanat khamsīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, wa-ibtadaʼtu fīhi fī al-ʻishr al-awsaṭ min shahr Ramaḍān min al-sanah al-madhkūrah, aḥsana Allāh taqaḍḍīhā fī khayr wa-ajāranī min kull miḥan wa-fitnah. Innī in alqāhu wa-huwa ʻanī rāḍin. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamma bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Muʻīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, may God have mercy upon him and be pleased with him, says: I completed it on the tenth of Shawwāl, the year 950 [of the Hijrah = 16 January, 1544] having started writing it in the middle tenth of Ramaḍān of the aforementioned year [22 December, 1543], may God ends it well, and may He protect me from all calamities and temptations. I hope to meet Him being pleased with me. Amen. Amen. Amen. It is completed by the help of God, the Supporting King."

record.title: 880-02 Taʻlīq ʻalá al-Manẓūmah fī uṣūl al-dīn : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ujuhūrī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajamʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā taʻlīq laṭīf waḍaʻtuhu ʻalá al-manẓūmah allatī allaftuhā fī uṣūl al-dīn, nāfiʻ in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá ..."
Secundo folio: wa-taḥta hādhihi thalāthat nisab.
16.5 x 22.3 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 10 unnumbered quires).

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; the verses of the original "Manẓūmah" preceded by the letter "Ṣ", and the commentary by the letter "Sh" in red; markings in red; catchwords.

al-Ujuhūrī's original "Manẓūmah" (Treatise in verse) starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāhi wa-ṣallá Allāhu // ʻalá Nabīyihi wa-man wālāhu. Wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallamā // mā khaffa najmun aw tabaddá fī al-samā ..."

Colophon: "Tammat al-ʻAqīdah al-mubārakah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Allāhumma ighfir li-muʼallifihā, wa-kātibihā, wa-qārīhā, wa-man ṭālaʻa fīhā, wa-daʻā lahum bi-al-maghfirah, wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed 'ʻAqīdah' [Doctrine/Statement of faith] is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. O God! Forgive its author, its copyist, its reader, he who studies it, he who invokes God to forgive them, Muslim men and Muslim women, and the believers, men and women. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ al-Muqaddimah fī al-ṣalāh : manuscript / Naṣr ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Layth al-Samarqandī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Ay, al-thanāʼ wa-al-shukr lillāh bi-inʻāmih. Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Ay, mālik al-khalāʼiq ajmaʻīn, wa-qīla mudabbiruhum, wa-qīla walīyuhum, kadhā fī Gharāʼib al-Qurʼān. Wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn. Ay, al-ʻāqibah al-muḥammadah, aw, al-saʻādah al-sarmadīyah li-alladhīna yattaqūn Allāh taʻālá wa-yaḥdharūna ʻiqābah bi-ṭāʻah, wa-fassarahā Qatādah bi-al-Jannah. Thmma inna al-taqwá qismān ..."
Secundo folio: ay lā sabīl wa-lā muʼākhadhah illā ʻalá al-ẓālimīn.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 13.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá al-Fattāḥ ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAlī al-Jarrāḥ, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhi wa-daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Āmīn."
