Āmīn. Qāla al-muṣannif, raḥimahu Allāh: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Naḥmaduka Allāhumma, ay, naṣifuka bi-jamīʻ ṣifātika, Yā Allāh ..."
Secundo folio: wājib, wa-al-thānī mandūb.
14.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red cover with flap; cover embossed with central medallion within a geometrical design (in 21 numbered quires).
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper, the phrases of Jamʻ al-jawām in red; notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
Brockelmann (S II, page 105) gives the title of the book as "al-Badr aṭ-ṭāliʻ fī ḥall Ǧ. al-ǧ. [al-Badr al-ṭāliʻ fī ḥall Jamʻ al-jawāmiʻ]."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Jamʻ al-jawāmiʻ lil-Maḥallī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Colophon: "Qāla al-muʼallif: Wa-hādhā ākhir mā ishtamala ʻalayhi al-kitāb. Wa-lillāh al-ḥamd wa-al-minnah ʻalá ikmālih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min takmilatihi yawm al-Thulāthāʼ al-mubārak, ḥādī ʻashar Ṣafar al-khayr, min shuhūr sanat tisʻ wa-thalāthīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-salām, wa-dhālika ʻalá yad al-faqīr ʻAbd Allāh ʻAlī al-Shinnāwī al-Qaḥāfī al-Shāfiʻī al-Shādhilī al-Aḥmadī, fī salkh Muḥarram, ʻām 1256, sittah wa-khamsīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf."

Translation of the colophon: "The author said: This is the end of what the book encompasses. Praise and grace be to God for its completion. It was completed [i.e., the copy from which the present copy was copied] on blessed Tuesday, 11 Ṣafar, 1139 [8 October, 1726] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and purest peace be upon Him. [Copied] by the hand of the poor ʻAbd Allāh ʻAlī al-Shinnāwī al-Qaḥāfī al-Shāfiʻī al-Shādhilī al-Aḥmadī, at the end of Muḥarram, the year 1256 [3 April, 1840] of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs nobleness and honor."

record.title: 880-02 Lamʻ al-lawāmiʻ fī ikhtiṣār Jamʻ al-jawāmiʻ : manuscript / ʻĪsá ibn ʻAlī al-Ikhnāʼī al-Shāfiʻī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah. Qāla faqīr raḥmat Rabbihi ʻĪsá ibn ʻAlī al-Ikhnāʼī al-Shāfiʻī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu wa-li-wālidayh: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāfiyah lil-muttaqīn, wa-lā ʻudwāna illā ʻalá al-ẓālimīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥābatihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb ikhtaṣartu fīhi 'Jamʻ al-jawāmiʻ', muṣannaf al-Imām al-ʻAllāmah al-Subkī, wa-lam adhkur fīhi illā al-muḥtāj ilayhi, wa-sammaytuhu 'Lamʻ al-lawāmiʻ fī ikhtiṣār Jamʻ al-jawāmiʻ'. Wa-arjū min Allāh taʻālá tawjīzahu, in ʻishtu, bi-ʻibārah wa-jīzah. Wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn wa-al-hidāyah ilá mā fīhi al-kifāyah, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
Secundo folio: ḥaythu innahu muʻarraf aw ghayruhu.
17 x 22.3 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper, the phrases of Jamʻ al-jawām and markings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Lamʻ al-lawāmiʻ fī ikhtiṣār Jamʻ al-jawāmiʻ."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa lillāh taʻālá hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ʻawn al-Karīm al-Wahhāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi mā ṭalaʻa najmun wa-ghāb. Fī tārīkh shahr Jumād al-Thānī, sanat 1077. Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed book is complete by the help of the Generous and Abundant Giving One. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions, as long as a star rises and sets. In the Month of Jumād al-Thānī, the year 1077 [of the Hijrah = November/December, 1666]. God Most High is more knowledgeable."

record.title: 880-03 Fatḥ al-Wahhāb bi-sharḥ Manhaj al-ṭullāb. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā Qāḍī al-Quḍāh, Shaykh Mashāyikh al-Islām, malik al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām, farīd ʻaṣrih wa- waḥīd dahrihi, Sībawayh zamānihi, ḥujjat al-munāẓirīn wa-lisān al-mutakallimīn, Muḥyī al-Sunnah fī al-ʻālamīn, Zayn al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih, wa-nafaʻanā wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakatih: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá afḍālih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-ālih, wa-baʻd, fa-qad kuntu ikhtaṣartu 'Minhāj al-ṭālibīn' fī al-fiqh, taʼlīf Shaykh al-Islām Abī Zakarīyā Yaḥyá Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Nawawī, raḥimahu Allāh, fī kitāb sammaytuhu bi-'Manhaj al-ṭullāb', wa-qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-aʻizzah min al-fuḍalāʼ al-mutaraddidīn ilayya an ashraḥahu sharḥan yaḥullu alfāẓahu, wa-yujillu ḥuffāẓahu, wa-yubayyinu murādahu, wa-yutammimu mafādahu, fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik bi-ʻawn al-Qādir al-Mālik, wa-sammaytuhu bi-'Fatḥ al-Wahhāb bi-sharḥ Manhaj al-ṭullāb'. Wa-Allāh asʼalu an yanfaʻa bi-hi, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
Secundo folio: al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá afḍālih.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 13.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In red cover with flap; cover and flap embossed with a geometrical design; in 42 numbered quires (quires 7 and 8 seem to be missing).
In good and large naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of 'Manhaj al-ṭullāb' in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: A talismanic formula, in letters and numbers, intended to enhance the mental faculties of the student to acquire knowledge, as follows: "Fāʼidah: Yanbaghī lil-ḥāriṣ ʻalá al-ʻilm an yaktuba hādhihi al-ḥurūf fī ẓahr al-kitāb, li-anna Allāh taʻālá jaʻala li-kull shayʼ khaṣāʼiṣ, wa-khaṣāʼiṣ hādhihi <al-aḥruf> al-ḥurūf an tajʻala ṭālib al-ʻilm mudhhinan, qādiran ʻalá mā ibtadaʼa min al-ʻulūm; kadhā fī 'Sharḥ al-Fuṣūl' [could not be identified], wa-hiya hādhihi: 1115 H 11 H Bʻ Mā H J11 11Mā11 1M Bj."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Tamma al-juzʼ al-awwal min Sharḥ al-Manhaj, li-Shaykh al-Islām Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi wa-ruḍwānih, wa-askanahu baḥbūḥata jinānihi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable. Completed is the first part of Sharḥ al-Manhaj of Shaykh al-Islām Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, may God encompass him with His mercy and favor, and make him dwell in the comfort of His Paradises. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen."

record.title: Table showing military camps between Fort Leavenworth and Denver City, with distances between each and remarks : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: 880-03 Fatḥ al-Wahhāb bi-sharḥ Manhaj al-ṭullāb : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā Shaykh Mashāyikh al-Islām, malik al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām, Sībawayh zamānihi, farīd ʻaṣrih wa- waḥīd dahrihi, lisān al-mutakallimīn, ḥujjat al-munāẓirīn, Muḥyī al-Sunnah fī al-ʻālamīn, Zayn al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih, wa-nafaʻanā Allāh wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakatih: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá afḍālih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-ālih. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad kuntu ikhtaṣartu 'Minhāj al-ṭālibīn' fī al-fiqh, taʼlīf Shaykh al-Islām Abī Zakarīyā Yaḥyá Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Nawawī, raḥimahu Allāh, fī kitāb sammaytuhu bi-'Manhaj al-ṭullāb', wa-qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-aʻizzah ʻalayya min al-fuḍalāʼ al-mutaraddidīn ilayya, an ashraḥahu sharḥan yaḥullu alfāẓahu, wa-yujillu ḥuffāẓahu, wa-yubayyinu murādahu, wa-yutammimu mafādahu, fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik bi-ʻawn al-Qādir al-Mālik, wa-sammaytuhu bi-'Fatḥ al-Wahhāb bi-sharḥ Manhaj al-ṭullāb'. Wa-Allāh asʼalu an yanfaʻa bi-hi, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
Secundo folio: ay uʼallif, wa-al-ism mushtaqq min al-sumū.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 18 quires; numbered 1-5; 10-21; quires 6-9 are missing; quire 22 in unnumbered)
In good and large naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of 'Manhaj al-ṭullāb' in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Fatḥ al-Wahhāb sharḥ Manhaj al-ṭullāb, li-Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Shaykh Mashāyikh al-Islām, ʻallāmat al-ʻaṣr wa-waḥīd al-dahr, Mawlānā Abī Zakarīyā Yaḥyá al-Anṣārī, nufuʻnā wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakatihi. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: Partially erased ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ... ... ... al-Ghanī al-Ṣabbāgh."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "Bāb al-Mawāqīt" (Chapter on the Appointed times, i.e., points and times of meetings for the Mecca pilgrims), as follows: "... wa-rawá al-Shāfiʻī fī 'al-Umm' ʻan ʻĀʼishah, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhā, anna Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, waqqata li-ahl al-Madīnah Dhā al-Ḥulayfah, wa-li-ahl al-Shām wa-Miṣr wa-al-Maghrib al-Juḥfah. Wa-rawá Abū Dāwūd wa-ghayruhu, bi-isnād ṣaḥīḥ, kamā fī 'al-Majmūʻ', ʻan ʻĀʼishah, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhā, anna al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, waqqata li-ahl al-ʻIrāq Dhāt ʻIrq, hādhā in lam yunib man dhakarahu ʻan ghayrihi, wa-illā fa-mīqātuhu mīqāt munībihi, aw mā quyyida bi-hi man abʻad, kamā yuʻlamu min 'Kitāb al-Waṣīyah', wa-al-afḍal li-man fawq ..."

record.title: William Bromley annotations and illustrations in John Bossewell's Workes of armorie : manuscript.
record.note: Ownership inscription of George Wilkinson at top of title page.
Ownership inscription of George Baker of Cringleford on verso of title page.
Presentation inscription on first page of dedication: Rob. W. Ratcliffe mo. June tenth 1687 Ex dono Jos: Stoner Higgs Lond.

Decoration: the majority of the coats of arms in the printed text have been colored in ink and wash. In addition, over 60 coats of arms and several other illustrations, including two portraits, all in full color, have been added by William Bromley in the margins and blank spaces of the original printed text.
Script: annotations to coats of arms, including the description of the Cholmondeley arms, in italic script; letter from Bromley to Hugh Cholmondeley in secretary script.
Binding: nineteenth-century polished full calf, covers panelled in contrasting brown calf and gilt. Spine tooled in gilt with brown label in second compartment: Bossewell's [Ar]morie.

record.title: Johannes Osborne annotations in Thomas Styward's The pathwaie to martiall discipline : manuscript.

record.title: Laurence Hyde, Earl of Rochester meditation on Lamentations 3:22 : manuscript.

Date given as: "Cornbury / Ap. [th]e 12th / 168?" with an indistinct final numeral. The text states that "this day twelvemonth it pleased God to stretch out his arme," (page 4) referencing Lady Hyde's death one year previously, on 12 April 1687.
Annotated on front wrapper in an eighteenth-century hand: "Wrote by the Earl of Rochester."
Binding: stab-stitched in paper wrappers.

record.title: 880-03 Nihāyat al-muḥtāj ilá sharḥ al-Minhāj. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ramlī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 3a)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. Yā Karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī shayyada bi-Minhāj dīnihi arkān al-sharīʻah, wa-saddada bi-aḥkāmihi furūʻ al-Ḥanīfīyah al-samḥāʼ, man ʻamala bi-hi fa-qad ittabaʻa sabīl al-muʼminīn, wa-man waqafa ʻanhu kharaja ʻan masālik al-muʻtabarīn. Aḥmaduhu, subḥānahu, ʻalá mā ʻallam, wa-ashkuruhu ʻalá mā hadá wa-qawwam, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, al-Malik al-Ḥaqq al-Mubīn, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-mabʻūth raḥmatan lil-ʻālamīn, wa-al-nūr al-sāʼir lil-khalāʼiq ilá Yawm al-Dīn, arsalahu ḥīna darast aʻlām al-hudá wa-ẓaharat aʻlām al-radá, wa-inṭamasa manhaj al-ḥaqq wa-ʻafā, wa-ashrafa miṣbāḥ al-ṣidq ʻalá al-inṭifā, fa-aʻlá min al-dīn maʻālimah, wa-min ḥukm al-sharʻ dalāʼilah, fa-insharaḥ bi-hi ṣudūr ahl al-īmān, wa-inzāḥat bi-hi shubuhāt ahl al-ṭughyān ..."
Secundo folio: wa-tasāmá fa-lam yasmaʻ ayna al-thurayyā.
21 x 30.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 22 cm; 33 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Minhāj and markings in red; many commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-Juzw al-awwal min 'Nihāyat al-muḥtāj ilá sharḥ al-Minhāj', taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ramlī, taghammadahumā Allāh bi-raḥmatih. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Mimmā sāqahu al-taqdīr li-nawbat al-ʻabd al-faqīr Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Shaṭbī al-Suyūṭī, ghafara Allāh lahum. Āmīn, wa-dhālika fī rābiʻ Shawwāl, sanat 1248, thamāniyah wa-arbaʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf [24 February, 1833]."

On folio 1a: Two pieces of poetry (6 and 4 verses, respectively), by al-Shaykh Burhān al-Dīn al-Jaʻbarī (probably Burhān al-Dīn Ibrāhīm ibn ʻUmar al-Jaʻbarī, 1242 or 1243-1331 or 1332), praising the author of al-Rawḍah (Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn) and al-Minhāj (Minhāj al-ṭālibīn), i.e., al-Nawawī.
On folio 1a: A quotation from "al-Muhimmāt" of al-Isnawī (ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥasan al-Isnawī, 1305-1370) on the different kinds of fatwas.
On folio 3a: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Nihāyat al-muḥtāj ilá sharḥ al-Minhāj' ..."

On folio 374a: Two verses of poetry attributed to Ibn al-Humām (probably Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Wāḥid, 1388-1456 or 1457), and three verses attributed to al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī (Muḥammad ibn Idrīs, 767 or 768-820), blaming their time in which the unworthy became prominent.

On the left margin of folio 374a: A statement attributed to al-Ramlī: "Yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, tāsiʻ ʻashar Rajab al-fard al-aṣamm al-ḥarām, sanat khams wa-sittīn wa-tisʻimiʼah [17 Ayyār/Māyū, 1558], ʻalá yad muʼallifihi, faqīr ʻafw Rabbihi wa-asīr waṣmat dhanbihi, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ramlī al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-muḥibbīhi, wa-li-dhurrīyatihi, wa-li-man daʻá lahum bi-al-khayr, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, wa-nafaʻa Allāh man qaraʼahu, wa-daʻā li-man kāna sababan fī dhālika bi-al-mawt ʻalá al-Islām, wa-li-sāʼir al-Muslimīn, wa-sāʼir anbiyāʼihi wa-rusulih wa-malāʼikatihi wa-akhiṣṣāʼihi, an yudīma lanā riḍāhu, wa-an yuṣliḥa minnā mā afsadnāh, wa-an yamanna ʻalaynā bi-qurbihi, wa-an yutḥfanā bi-ḥaqāʼiq ḥubbihi, wa-an lā yajʻala aʻmālanā ḥasratan ʻalaynā wa-nadāmah, wa-an yajmaʻanā maʻa sādātinā fī aʻlā farādīs al-karāmah, wa-an yuʻīnanā ʻalá itmām baqīyat sharḥ al-kitāb, kamā aʻānanā ʻalá ibtidāʼih, fa-innahu mujīb al-duʻāʼ, lā yaruddu man qaṣadah, wa-iʻtamada ʻalayh, wa-lā man ʻawwala fī jamīʻ umūrihi ʻalayh. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-aqūlu ḥarrartuhu mujtahidn, wa-laysa yakhlū min ghalaṭ [... ... ...]."
The first volume of "Nihāyat al-muḥtāj ilá sharḥ al-Minhāj" ends with "Bāb al-Iḥṣār wa-al-fawāt" (Chapter on what prohibits the completion of the stages of the pilgrimage).

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-juzw al-mubārak yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak, ḥādī ʻashar shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, min shuhūr ʻām 0181 [1081], aḥad wa-thamānūn wa-alf, ʻalá yad kātibihi wa-mālikihi al-Sayyid Aḥmad Abū al-Faḍl al-Ḥasanī, al-Shāfiʻī al-Samhūdī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed part was completed on blessed Wednesday, 11 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 1081 [28 August, 1670], by its copyist and owner al-Sayyid Aḥmad Abū al-Faḍl al-Ḥasanī al-Shāfiʻī al-Samhūdī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Mukhtaṣar. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻArafah al-Dasūqī al-Mālikī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī wa-rajāʼī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī kammala dhawī al-aḥlām bi-maʻrifat ʻilm al-ḥalāl wa-al-ḥarām, wa-hadāhum li-istikhrāj durar al-aḥkām, fa-istakhrajūhā min baḥrihā wa-awdaʻūhā kanzahā bi-daqāʼiq al-afhām. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man atá bi-al-kalām al-ḥasan, wa-ukhtuṣir la-hu al-kalām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-ḥāfiẓīn li-sharīʻatihi min al-taghyīr wa-al-tabdīl ʻalá mamarr al-sinīn wa-al-ayyām. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Dasūqī al-Mālikī: Hādhihi taqyīdāt ʻalá Sharḥ Shaykhinā al-ʻAllāmah mufīd al-ṭālibīn wa-murabbī al-murīdīn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Dardīr al-ʻAdawī li-Mukhtaṣar al-ʻAllāmah Abī al-Ḍiyāʼ Khalīl ibn Isḥāq alladhī allafahu fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab Imām al-aʼimmah wa-najm al-Sunnah al-Imām Mālik ibn Anas, iqtabastuhā min kutub al-aʼimmah al-aʻlām, mushīran bi-mā ṣūratuhu ..."
Secundo folio: afʻāl al-mukallafīn li-annahu yabḥathu.
16.3 x 22.8 cm; written surface: 11 x 18 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion, tooled with geometrical design (in 56 numbered quires).
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-juzw al-awwal min Ḥāshiyat al-Imām al-kāmil, al-ʻallāmah al-fāḍil, Sayyidī al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Dasūqī, ʻalá Sharḥ al-Shaykh Abī al-Barakāt Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Dardīr, li-Mukhtaṣar al-Imām Abī al-Ḍiyāʼ Khalīl ibn Isḥāq al-Mālikī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-him ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. M."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Salām al-Laqānī."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-hādhā ākhir al-juzw al-awwal min Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh al-Dasūqī ʻalá Sharḥ Sayyidī Abī al-Barakāt al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Dardīr ʻalá Mukhtaṣar Abī al-Ḍiyāʼ al-Shaykh Khalīl ibn Isḥāq, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-al-jamīʻ. Āmīn. M."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable. This is the end of the first part of the commentary of al-Shaykh al-Dasūqī on the commentary of Sayyidī Abī al-Barakāt al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Dardīr on al-Mukhtaṣar of Abī al-Ḍiyāʼ al-Shaykh Khalīl ibn Isḥāq. May God benefit us with all of them. Amen. M."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Mukhtaṣar. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻArafah al-Dasūqī al-Mālikī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Bāb al-Dhakāh. Qawluhu 'bi-maʻná al-tadhkiyah', ashāra ilá anna al-dhakāh ism maṣdar, bi-maʻná al-maṣdar, wa-al-murād al-dhakāh al-muḥaqqaqah fī al-dhabḥ, fa-lā yaridu anna al-ʻqd wa-al-naḥr min <min> afrād al-dhakāh, wa-lā yushtaraṭu fīhā qaṭʻ al-ḥulqūm wa-al-wadijayn, wa-kharaja ʻan qawlihi qaṭʻ al-khanq wa-al-nahsh, fa-lā yusammá dhabḥan. Wa-qawluhu 'lā ghayruhu', ay, lā qaṭʻa ghayruhu ..."
Secundo folio: fa-ʻulima an aqsām al-masʼalah thamāniyah.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 18.5 cm; 26-32 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion, tooled with geometrical design (in 40 numbered quires).
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-juzw al-thānī min Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Dasūqī ʻalá Sharḥ Abī al-Barakāt Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Dardīr li-Mukhtaṣar Abī al-Ḍiyāʼ Khalīl ibn Isḥāq, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-him. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Salām al-Laqānī."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Kamula bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi al-juzʼ al-thānī min Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-Dasūqī ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Dardīr. Fa-bi-kamālihi kamula al-niṣf minhā. Wa-yalīhi, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, awwal al-thālith 'Kitāb al-Buyūʻ'. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran, ẓāhiran wa-bāṭinan. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "God, Almighty and All Powerful, is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. The second part of the Commentary of al-ʻAllāmah al-Dasūqī on the Commentary of al-ʻAllāmah al-Dardīr was completed by the praise of God and His help. By its completion half of the Commentary is now completed. It will be followed, God Almighty willing, by the beginning of the third part, 'Book on sales'. Praise be to God from the beginning to the end, overtly and covertly. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and grant him peace."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Mukhtaṣar. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻArafah al-Dasūqī al-Mālikī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi wathiqtu, wa-ʻalayhi tawakkaltu. Bāb 'Yanʻaqidu al-bayʻ bi-mā yadullu ʻalá al-riḍá'. Qawluhu 'ay yaḥṣal wa-yūjad'. Innamā fassara yanʻaqidu bi-mā dhukir, li-anna inʻiqād al-shayʼ ʻibārah ʻan taqawwumihi bi-ajzāʼih, wa-lā yaṣuḥḥu an yufassara bi-yaṣuḥḥ aw yalzam, li-annah qad yaḥṣalu al-bayʻ bi-al-maʻṭāh aw ghayrihā min al-ṣiyagh, wa-lā yakūnu ṣaḥīḥan aw lāziman. Wa-al-ḥaqāʼiq al-sharʻīyah tashmalu al-ṣaḥīḥ wa-al-fāsid. Qawluhu 'ʻAqd muʻāwaḍah', ay, ʻaqd yaḥtawi [yaḥtawī] ʻalá ʻiwaḍ min al-jānibayn ..."
Secundo folio: al-muʻayyan fīhi muʻayyan wa-al-ḥāṣil.
16.5 x 23.3 cm; written surface: 11 x 18.5 cm; 26-30 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion, tooled with geometrical design (in 39 numbered quires).
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā awwal al-juzʼ al-thālith min Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-Dasūqī ʻalá Sharḥ al-Shaykh al-Dardīr li-Mukhtaṣar al-Shaykh Khalīl ibn Isḥāq al-Mālikī, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-al-jamīʻ. M."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Salām al-Laqānī."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, aʻlam. Tammat thalāthat arbāʻ Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-Dasūqī ʻalá Sharḥ Walī Allāh Abī al-Barakāt Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Dardīr, fī awāʼil Jumādá al-Thāniyah, min sanat 173 [1273], Thalāthah wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat man kāna yará min al-amām wa-al-khalf, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "God, Almighty and All Powerful, is more knowledgeable. Three quarters of the Commentary of al-ʻAllāmah al-Dasūqī on the Commentary of Walī Allāh Abī al-Barakāt Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Dardīr, was completed at the beginning of Jumādá al-Thāniyah, of the year 1273 of the Hijrah [27 January, 1857] of Him who was able to see from the front and from the back, may God pray on Him and grant Him peace."

record.title: Notebook on veterinary medicine.
record.note: Bound in contemporary leather, rebacked; spine largely exposed. Original clasp lacking.

record.title: Colorado travel journal : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

record.title: Commemorative English and French heraldry keepsake : manuscript / Wm. Roberts Gichard.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Illustrations in gouache and gilt.
Page 2 and 4 blank.

record.title: Western United States travel scrapbook : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

record.title: Laurence Hyde, Earl of Rochester meditation on the fourth anniversary of his wife's death : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Date at head of text: "New parke. April [th]e 12th, 1691."
Annotated on front wrapper: "Wrote by the Earl of Rochester."
Binding: stab-stitched in paper wrappers.

record.title: Benjamin de Rohan, seigneur de Soubise letter to Catherine de Parthenay-Larchevêque, vicomtesse de Rohan, London, 1631 March 2 : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Script: italic.
Signed: "Soubize."
Integral address leaf. Docketed in a contemporary hand: "De l'onziesme de Mars 1631."

record.title: Mineral surveys no. 3 : manuscript.
record.note: Title from font cover.

record.title: Stratton Cripple Creek Mining and Development Company assay reports : manuscript.
record.note: Title from front cover.

record.title: Henry II, King of France order to Nicolas de Neufville, seigneur de Villeroi, Annet, 1547 June 18 : manuscript.
record.note: Signed: "Henry." Signed: "Bochetel."
Script: document in scribal secretary hand with batarde features. Signature of Henry II in cursive. Signature of Bochetel in batarde.
Integral address. Docketed in a contemporary hand.
Annotated at head of letter in an eighteenth-century hand with a summary of the letter's contents and the incorrect date of "8 juin 1547."

record.title: George H. Thomas letter, Buena Vista, Mexico, to John W. Thomas, Norfolk, Virginia, 1848 May 28 : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Ownership inscription on recto of first leaf: "Angell Knightley her Receipt Book. Anno 1732-1741."
Bookplate of R. Anthony Stephenson on recto of first leaf.
Engraved portrait of "Frederick Prince of Wales" pasted onto front pastedown.
Binding: contemporary full parchment, blind-ruled.

record.title: Elizabeth Essex household account book : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Inscription on front pastedown, in a different hand: "Teusday 5th March 1776. Mary Cooper."
Inscription on front cover: "Elizabeth Essex 1770."
Inscription on back cover: "Essex Elizabeth Essex 1776."
Binding: original parchment-covered boards.

record.title: Catherine Clough recipe book : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Volume is paginated 1-234, with several errors and missing pages. Table of contents on pages numbered 227-232.

Ownership inscription in copperplate script pasted to front pastedown: "Catherine Clough. This Book was given me by my dear Mother Catherine Clough. April the 2nd, 1770." Similar ownership inscription pasted to verso of front flyleaf.
Note on front flyleaf with Clough family ownership history of the volume to 1838.

Binding: contemporary triple-paneled full brown calf. Panels formed by roll tooling, gilt, with large tooled floral ornament in each corner. Eight-compartmented spine, rebacked, elaborately gilt. Second compartment red morocco label with gilt lettering: "Receipts." Marbled endpapers.

record.title: 880-02 Iltiqāṭ al-durr wa-al-ʻiqyān min kitāb Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bāʻūnī.
record.note: Title from folio 7b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 6b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala ḥayāt al-ḥayawān sababan li-baqāʼ al-wujūd, wa-khalaqa al-khalq wa-ʻammahum bi-fayḍ al-karam wa-al-jūd, wa-khaṣṣa kull mawjūd bi-khawāṣṣ, wa-ʻamma nafʻahā kull ʻāmm wa-khāṣṣ, fa-lam yakhlu makhlūq min khawāṣṣ, fīhā manāfiʻ lil-nās, min jalīl wa-ḥaqīr, wa-ḍaʻīf wa-qawī dhī baʼs; fa-Huwa al-ḥakīm alladhī waḍaʻa al-ashyāʼ fī maḥallihā, wa-ḥarrama al-ashyāʼ wa-aḥallahā, ʻalá annahu, subḥānuhu. lam yakhuṣṣ al-ḥayawān bi-al-khawāṣṣ wa-al-manāfiʻ dūna makhlūqātih, bal jaʻalahā fī sāʼir mubtadaʻātih, fī kull ṣāmit wa-nāṭiq, wa-sākin wa-khāfiq, wa-raṭb wa-yābis, wa-ḍāḥik wa-ʻābis, wa-waḥsh wa-jāriḥ, wa-ʻadhb wa-māliḥ ..."
Secundo folio: jamaʻa ghāyat al-ibdāʻ.
17.5 x 27 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18.5 cm; 22 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with green leather spine, tooled and embossed with five central medallions in gold (in 22 numbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red, blue, green and gold; catchwords.
On the leaf pasted to folio 1a: Two illegible, large and circular seals.

On folios 1a-5a: An index of contents listing the zoological names in alphabetical order: "Fihrist 'Iltiqāṭ al-durr wa-al-ʻiqyān min Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān', taʼlīf al-Shaykh Abī al-Makārim ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn al-Shaykh Shams al-Dīn Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad al-Bāʻūnī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih."

At the end of the index of contents (folio 5a): "Tammat Fihrist kitāb Ilatiqāṭ al-durr wa-al-ʻiqyān min ḥayāt al-ḥayawān, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim wa-al-adīb al-fāḍil, Abī al-Makārim ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah Shams al-Dīn Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad al-Bāʻūnī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān. Āmīn."

On folio 6a: Two illegible ownership statements and one partially legible: "Min inʻām Allāh taʻālá ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr [... ... ...] ʻafā Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-ʻan wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Taḥrīran fī awāʼil Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min shuhūr sanat sitt ʻasharah baʻda al-alf [26 June, 1607)], khutimat bi-al-khayr wa-al-sharaf."

On folio 6a: A ḥilyah (decoration), in blue, red, brown and gold, inscribed with: "Iltiqāṭ al-durr wa-al-ʻiqyān min ḥayāt al-ḥayawān, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-adīb al-fāḍil, Karīm al-Dīn, Abī al-Makārim, ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn al-Shaykh al-ʻallāmah Shams al-Dīn Abī ʻAbd Allāh al-Bāʻūnī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu baḥbūḥata jannatih, bi-faḍlihi wa-raḥmatih."
On folio 7b: "... wa-qad sammaytuhu 'Iltiqāṭ al-durr wa-al-ʻiqyān min Kitāb Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān' ...".

On folio 223a, after the colophon, in a "ḥilyah" (decoration), in gold, blue and red, the copyist recorded the date of death of the author, and a eulogy, in two verses of poetry, by his father, as follows: "Tuwuffiya muʼallifuhu wa-jāmiʻuhu, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥa Jannatih, thālith ʻishrīn Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat arbaʻ wa-sittīn wa-thamānimiʼah [25 February, 1460]. Wa-mimmā anshada wāliduhu, fasaḥa Allāh fī muddatih, wa-aʻānahu ʻalá muṣībatih: Qad kāna ʻAbdu al-Karīmi jawharatan // qad ṣāghahā Dhū al-Jalāli min sharafi. Mudh jahila al-dahru qadra qīmatihā // aʻādahā ghayratan ilá al-ṣadafi."

Colophon: "Wa-wāfaqa al-farāgh min taʻlīqihi ʻalá yad aḍʻaf ʻabīd Allāh, wa-aḥwajihim, wa-afqarihim ilá raḥmatihi wa-maghfiratih, al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-naḥīf al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-taqṣīr, al-jānī, Muḥammad ibn Sālim al-Ḥasbānī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, fī ʻashīyat nahār al-Khamīs, thāmin shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min shuhūr sanat arbaʻ wa-sittīn wa-thamānimiʼah, aḥsana Allāh taʻālá ʻuqbāhā fī khayr wa-ʻāfiyah, bi-mannihi wa-karamih, innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed by the hand of the feeblest of God's servants, the neediest and the poorest to His mercy and forgiveness, the weak, emaciated and despised servant, who confesses his insufficiency, the sinner Muḥammad ibn Sālim al-Ḥasabānī, may God forgive him, his parents, him who invokes God for his forgiveness, and all Muslims, on the evening of Thursday, 18 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 864 [21 January, 1460], may God Almighty ends it with well being and health, by His favor and generosity; for He is able to do whatever He wills and readily answers invocations."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-adhkiyāʼ : manuscript / Abū al-Faraj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Jawzī.
record.note: Title from colophon (folio 83b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Jamāl al-Dīn Abū al-Faraj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Jawzī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aḥallanā maḥallat al-fahm, wa-ḥallānā ḥilyat al-ʻilm, wa-mallkanā ʻiqāl al-ʻaql, wa-zayyananā bi-niṭāq al-nuṭq, wa-naʻūdhu bi-hi min kadar ṣafāʼ al-fikr wa-ʻakar duhn al-dhihn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá al-mabʻūth bi-jawāmiʻ al-kalim ilá aʻqal al-umam, wa-ʻalá jamīʻ atbāʻihi al-sāʼirīn fī manhaj atbāʻih, wa-sallama kathīran. Ammā baʻd, fa-inna ajall al-ashyāʼ mawhibat al-ʻaql, fa-innahu al-ālah fī taḥṣīl maʻrifat al-ālah, wa-bi-hi tuḍbaṭu al-maṣāliḥ, wa-tulḥaẓu al-ʻawāqib, wa-tudraku al-ghawāmiḍ, wa-tujmaʻu al-faḍāʼil ..."
Secundo folio: ibn Muḥammad qāl samiʻtu.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 8 x 13.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In red cardboard with flap.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings; some commentaries and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: Kitāb al-adhkiyāʼ.

Colophon: "Tamma Kitāb al-adhkiyāʼ li-Ibn al-Jawzī bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-luṭfihi wa-karamih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi nahār al-Jumʻah, ghurrat shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat sabʻ wa-tisʻīn baʻda al-alf, ʻalá yaday al-faqīr ilá ʻafw al-Qadīr, al-mutakaddir bi-nakabāt al-zamān, al-mustafīḍ fayḍ al-Raḥmān, innahu ḥannān mannān, Qāsim ibn al-Ḥājj Dāwūd ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd Allāh, ghafara Allāh dhunūbahum wa-satara ʻuyūbahum [... ... ...] wa-ʻāmmat al-muʼminīn. Rabbi taqabbal duʻāʼī wa-ḥaqqiq rajāʼī. Āmīn. Bi-wasīlat Sayyid al-Awwalīn wa-al-Ākharīn. Wa-ḥaṣṣil maqāṣidī. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Kitāb al-adhkiyāʼ of Ibn al-Jawzī is now completed, by the praise of God Almighty, His graciousness and His generosity. The copy was concluded on Friday, the beginning of Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 1097 [of the Hijrah = 19 September, 1686], by the hand of the poor to the forgiveness of the Mighty One, who is afflicted by the calamities of time, and is seeking the copiousness of the Merciful One, the Most Compassionate and the Most Generous, Qāsim ibn al-Ḥājj Dāwūd ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd Allāh, may God forgive their sins and cover their shortcomings [... ... ...] and all Muslims. O my Lord! Accept my invocation and fulfill my request. Amen. By the intercession of the Master of the Former and the Latter [Prophet Muḥammad]. And fulfill my hopes. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Kashf al-lithām ʻan sharḥ Shaykh al-Islām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Buhūtī al-Khalwatī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī adhāqa man ijtabāhum ḥalāwat al-taḥqīq, wa-jaʻala lahum min al-ʻināyah khayra rafīq, wa-sharaḥa ṣudūrahum li-sulūk sabīl al-taṣawwur wa-al-taṣdīq. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-mursal ilá khayr rafīq, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-ḥāʼizīn nisbatahum ilayh al-nasb al-ṣiddīq, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn mutalāzimayn ilá yawm al-fazaʻ wa-al-maḍīq. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-ḥaqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ʻAlī, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Buhūtī al-Ḥanbalī, baṣṣarahu Allāh bi-ʻuyūb nafsih, wa-jaʻala yawmahu khayran min amsihi: Hādhihi taḥrīrāt rāʼiʻah wa-taḥrīrāt [wa-taqrīrāt] fāʼiqah ʻalá Sharḥ Shaykh al-Islām, malik al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām, dhī al-taṣānīf al-bāriʻah al-kathīrah wa-al-taʼālīf al-nāfiʻah al-shahīrah, Qāḍī al-Quḍāh, Abī Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, li-kitāb al-Shaykh Ashraf al-Dīn al-Abharī, al-shahīr bi-Īsāghūjī, jarradtuhā min khaṭṭ Shaykhinā wa-Ustādhinā, ʻallāmat zamānih, wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-awānih, baqīyat al-muḥaqqiqīn, wa-bughyat al-mudaqqiqīn, Shihāb al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghunaymī al-Anṣārī al-Khazrajī, aḥallahu Allāh maḥalla ruḍwānih, wa-askanahu farādīs jannātih [jinānih] ..."
Secundo folio: wa-iʻlam annī anqulu mā arāh.
15.2 x 20 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard (in 10 unnumbered quires).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Folio 94 is blank.

On folio 1a: "Kashf al-lithām ʻan sharḥ Shaykh al-Islām lil-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Shihāb al-Dīn, Aḥmad ibn Mumliḥ [Muḥammad] al-Ghunaymī al-Anṣārī al-Khazrajī, ʻalá Sharḥ Īsāghūjī, li-Shaykh al-Islām, Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā [al-kitāb] lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement in a crude hand: "al-Faqīr Muḥammad al-Ṭarīfī [or al-Ṭurayfī] najl al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-Ṭarīfī, najl al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Quddūs al-Ṭarīfī, najl al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Ṭarīfī, najl al-Shaykh <Abū> Abū al-Fatʹḥ al-Ṭarīfī, najl al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Majīd al-Ṭarīfī, najl al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh al-Ṭarīfī, najl al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Ṭarīfī, najl al-Quṭb al-Rabbānī Sayyidī Abū Bakr al-Ṭarīfī al-Rifāʻī al-Mālikī, najl al-Quṭb al-Rabbānī Sayyidī ʻAlī bi-Tūnus al-Khaḍrāʼ, min dhurīyat Abū ʻUbayd ʻĀmir ibn Asad al-Jarrāḥī, aḥad al-ʻasharah al-bararah, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum ajmaʻīn. Taḥrīran fī 22 Rabīʻ Awwal, sanat 1177 [30 September, 1763], sabʻ wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf."
On the margin of folio 93b: An ownership statement in a crude hand: "Lil-faqīr Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-Ṭarīfī al-Rifāʻī al-Mālikī."

Colophon: "Hādhā ākhir mā ḥarrarahu al-Shaykh bi-hāmish [nuskhatihi?], nafaʻanā Allāh bi-taḥqīqātih, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā min barakatih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah [Prophet Muḥammad], wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what the Shaykh recorded on the margin of [his copy?]. May God benefit us of his accomplishments and bestow upon us of his blessing. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on him, whom no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad], and on his family and companions and grant them peace. This blessed copy is concluded. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 Bustān al-ʻārifīn : manuscript / Naṣr ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Layth al-Samarqandī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 3b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Hādhā Kitāb Bustān al-ʻārifīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad Khātim al-Nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-ṭayyibīn, wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ʻibād Allāh al-ṣāliḥīn, min ahl al-samāwāt wa-al-araḍīn. Qāla al-Faqīh Abū al-Layth, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh: Innī qad jamaʻtu fī kitābī hādhā funūnan min al-ʻilm mimmā lā yasaʻu jahluhu, wa-lā al-takhalluf ʻanhu min al-khāṣṣ wa-al-ʻāmm, wa-istakhrajtu dhālika min kutub kathīrah, fa-awradtu fīhi mā huwa al-awḍaḥ lil-nāẓir fīhi wa-al-rāghib ilayhi, wa-bayyantu lil-ḥujaj fīmā yuḥtāju fīhi ilá al-ḥujjah bi-al-Kitāb wa-al-akhbār wa-al-naẓar, wa-taraktu al-ghawāmiḍ min al-kalām, wa-ḥadhaftu asānīd al-Aḥādīth takhfīfan lil-rāghibīn fīhi wa-iltimāsan li-manfaʻat al-nās, wa-sammaytuhu 'Kitāb Bustān al-ʻārifīn' ..."
Secundo folio: al-nār bi-jahlihim wa-rawá Makḥūl.
15.5 x 21.7 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 16.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1b-2b: An index of contents.
On folios 3a: A partially legible statement of ownership dated 1205 of the Hijrah (1790/1791), and an illegible seal.
Text folios 3b-93b.
On folios 94a-95b: Miscellaneous quotations in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish, in different hands.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-ʻajibtu mimman yakhāfu min makr al-nās kayfa lā yaqūlu: 'Wa-ufawwiḍu amrī ilá Allāh; inna Allāh baṣīrun bi-al-ʻibād'; li-anna Allāh taʻālá yaqūlu: 'Fa-waqāhu Allāh sayyiʼāt mā makarū'. Wa-ʻajibtu li-man yarghabu fī al-Jannah, kayfa lā yaqūlu: 'Mā shāʼa Allāh, lā qūwata illā billāh'; li-anna Allāh taʻālá yaqūlu: 'Fa-ʻasá Rabbī an yuʼtiyani khayran min jannatik ...' al-Āyah." An illegible seal.

record.title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-Raḥmān bi-sharḥ Luqṭat al-ʻajlān wa-bullat al-ẓamʼān : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. al-Ḥamdu lillāh fātiḥ abwāb al-ʻulūm li-man qaṣadahu, wa-māniḥ ʻaṭāyāhu li-man aṭāʻahu wa-ʻabadah. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh al-mutafaḍḍil ʻalá man ikhtārahu wa-waḥḥadah. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabuduhu wa-rasūluh, al-mufaḍḍal ʻalá ghayrihi mimman abdaʻahu wa-awjadah. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf Nabī ʻaẓẓamahu wa-majjadah, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-atbāʻihi al-bararah al-mumajjadah. Wa-baʻd, fa-lammā kānat al-Muqaddimah al-mawsūmah bi-'Luqṭat al-ʻajlān wa-bullat al-ẓamʼān', taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-ʻallāmah al-Rabbānī Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Zarkashī al-Shāfiʻī mushtamilah ʻalá nuqūl ʻajībah, wa-masāʼil gharībah, wa-ḥudūd manīʻah, wa-mawḍūʻāt badīʻah, maʻa kathrat ʻilmihā wa-wajāzat lafẓihā, wa-iftiqārihā ilá ḥall mabānīhā, wa-bayān maʻānīhā, ṭalab minnī baʻḍ al-aʻizzah ʻalayya min al-fuḍalāʼ al-mutaraddidīn ilayya an aḍaʻa ʻalayhā sharḥan yaḥullu alfāẓahā, wa-yubrizu daqāʼiqihā, wa-yuḥaqqiqu masāʼilihā, wa-yuḥarriru dalāʼilihā, fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik bi-ʻawn al-Qādir al-Mālik, rājiyan bi-hi jazīl al-ajr wa-al-thawāb min fayḍ Mawlānā al-Akram al-Wahhāb. Wa-sammaytuhu: 'Fatʹḥ al-Raḥmān bi-sharḥ Luqṭat al-ʻajlān wa-bullat al-ẓamʼān' ..."
Secundo folio: riwāyah bi-al-Ḥamdu lillāh fa-huwa ajdham.
15.7 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red cardboard.
In naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrased of "Lugṭat a-ʻajlān wa-bullat al-ẓamʼān" in red; Some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi al-risālah tusammá 'Fatʹḥ al-Raḥmān bi-sharḥ Luqṭat al-ʻajlān wa-bullat al-ẓamʼān' lil-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Zarkashī al-Shāfiʻī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Four ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Min faḍl Rabbihi al-mannān malakahu ʻAbd al-Qādir Sulṭān". 2. "Malakahu min faḍl Rabbihi al-mannān Maḥmūd [...]". 3. "Dakhalat fī mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Maḥmūd al-Rīḥāwī". 4. "Malakahu min faḍl Allāh taʻālá al-ʻabd al-faqīr [... ... ...]".

Author's colophon: "Qāla Shaykhunā, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, wa-nafaʻanā min barakātih, wa-fasaḥa fī turbatih: Faraghtu min taʼlīfihi nahār al-Arbaʻah, Sādis shahr Jumād al-Awwal, sanat arbaʻ wa-ʻishrūn wa-tisʻimiʼah, bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Tammat."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Our Master, may God be pleased with him, benefit us of his blessings and make spacious his resting place, said: 'I finished writing it on Wednesday, 6 Jumād al-Awwal, 924 [of the Hijrah = 26 May, 1518], by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī aḥkām al-Jānn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Maydānī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā, al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-muḥaqqiq al-ruḥalah, Nawawī zamānih, wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-awānih, wārith ʻulūm Sayyid al-Mursalīn, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, Shams al-Dunyā wa-al-Dīn, Muḥammad al-Maydānī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad ashraf al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-sādah al-kirām. Wa-baʻd, qāla Imām al-Ḥaramayn fī kitābihi al-shāmil: Ankara kathīr min al-falāsifah, wa-al-Qadarīyah, wa-kāffat al-Zanādiqah, wujūd al-Shayāṭīn wa-al-Jinn, maʻa anna nuṣūṣ al-Qurʼān, wa-tawātur al-akhbār, wa-istifāḍat al-āthār, dāllah ʻalá wujūdihim ..."
Secundo folio: fī wujūd al-Jinn wa-jumhūr al-kuffār.
14.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In light green cardboard with flap; light brown leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the front cover: "Fī aḥkām al-Jānn."
On the preliminary leaf: Miscellaneous quotations in prose and verse, in different hands.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah fī aḥkām al-Jānn, li-Shaykh al-Islām, al-Shaykh Muḥammad Shams al-Dīn, al-shahīr bi-al-Maydānī al-Dimashqī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 19b: Miscellaneous quotations, in a different hand.

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tammat al-Risālah fī aḥkām al-Jānn." On the margin of the colophon: "Kataba hādhihi al-risālah al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Najm al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh Khalīl ibn al-Shaykh Saʻd al-Dīn."

Translation of the colophon: "God Almighty is more knowledgeable. To Him is the reference and returning. The epistle on the rules of the Jinn is completed." On the margin of the colophon: "This epistle was copied by the poor to God Almighty, Najm al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh Khalīl ibn al-Shaykh Saʻd al-Dīn."

record.title: Assignment of household goods from Bedingfeild Heigham to Thomas White, 1708 May 11 : manuscript.
record.note: Docket: "Assignment of Household goods &c. from B. Heigham to Thomas White."
Document signed: "B. Heigham." Signature followed by red wax seal.
Document signed by two witnesses: "Owen Lloyd" and "Joshua Miles."

record.title: Paramount novelties : typescript.
record.note: Title from front cover.

record.title: Recipe book, circa 1770-1860 : manuscript.
record.note: Paginated in an eighteenth-century hand 1-332; pages 83-94 missing, and several leaves unpaginated. Tabbed alphabetical index at front of volume, mostly blank.
Recipes in two different eighteenth-century hands are interspersed with recipes in at least two nineteenth-century hands.
Binding: late 18th-century full reverse calf.

record.title: Griffith Isaac Robertson school notebook in Welsh and English : manuscript.
record.note: Ownership inscriptions of Griffith Isaac Robertson on front and back pastedowns and within the mathematics textbook.

record.title: 880-02 Ākām al-marjān fī aḥkām al-Jānn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Shiblī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Khāliq al-Ins wa-al-Jān. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, shahādatan yakūnu li-man tadarraʻa bi-hā awfá jinnah. Wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-dāʻī ilá al-Jannah, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayh, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih, dhawī al-baʼs wa-al-najdah wa-al-minnah, ṣalātan tuʻaẓumu bi-hā ʻalayhim al-minnah, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran yaqūmu bi-al-gharaḍ wa-al-Sunnah, ka-mā awjaba dhālika ʻalaynā wa-sannah. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb jāmiʻ li-dhikr al-Jānn wa-akhbārihim wa-mā yataʻallaqu bi-aḥkāmihim wa-āthārihim ..."
Secundo folio: al-Kitāb li-anna man ishtaraṭa.
15.2 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 11 x 16 cm; 21-22 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with dark brown leather on spine.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the front cover: "Kitāb fī ithnayn wa-tisʻūn [wa-tisʻīn] bāban, wa-ghayruhu, fī al-Jinn wa-ghayruhu. 1115."

On the back of the front cover: "In shāʼa Allāh, yaṣilu ilá Ḥaḍrat al-Sayyid al-ajall, al-mukarram, al-muḥtaram, al-Sayyid Ibrāhīm ibn al-Sayyid Ḥasan ibn al-Munayyir, sallamahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-zādahu M ʻ R W F A [maʻrūfan]."

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Ākām al-marjān fī aḥkām al-Jānn, taʼlīf al-Shaykh Badr al-Dīn al-Shiblī al-Ḥanafī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-fīhi ithnayn [ithnān] wa-tisʻūn bāban, bal, akthar, wafawāʼid jalīlah. 1115."
On folio 2b: "... wa-sammaytuhā 'Ākām al-marjān fī aḥkām al-jānn' ..."
Leaf 72 is blank.

At the front of the back cover: Yaṣilu, in shāʼa Allāh ilá Dimashq al-Shām fī yawm [...], yusallamu bi-yad al-Sayyid Ibrāhīm ibn al-Sayyid Ḥasan al-Munayyar B B R K T M ʻ R W F A L K R Kh Y [bi-Barakat Maʻrūf al-Karkhī]."
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kitāb al-sābiʻ ʻashar Jumādá al-Thānī, min shuhūr sanat tisʻ wa-sittīn wa-alf, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Tashafūnī."
Translation of the colophon: "This book was completed on 17 Jumādá al-Thānī, 1069 [of the Hijrah = 12 March, 1659], by the hand of the poor Muḥammad al-Tashafūnī."

record.title: 880-02 Shumūs al-anwār wa-kunūz al-asrār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥājj al-Tilimsānī al-Maghribī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī awdaʻa ruqūm al-ḥurūf badāʼiʻ asrārih, wa-rakkaba minhā maʻāniya asmāʼih, wa-fajjara minhā yanābīʻ al-aʻdād wa-buḥūr al-awfāq bi-mawāhib anwārih, wa-wakkala rūḥānīyatan taqūmu wa-takhdumu arbābahā fī jamīʻ al-maṭālib, tadullu bi-surʻatihā ʻalá faradānīyatihi, fa-fataḥa bisāṭ al-uns, wa-aṭlaʻa man shāʼa min al-ins ʻalá ʻajāʼib malakūtihā mimman akhlaṣa min ʻibādih ..."
Secundo folio: ward wa-misk alf marrah.
15 x 22 cm; written surface: 9 x 17.7 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in purple; many magic squares and a magic circle; on some leaves a seal with the phrase "Dawāwīn maṣraf"; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Shumūs al-anwār wa-kunūz al-asrār li-Ibn al-Ḥājj al-Tilimsānī al-Maghribī, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. M."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhā bi-Kitāb Shumūs al-anwār wa-kunūz al-asrār ..."

Colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kitāb fī yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, al-muwāfiq ithnayn Jumād al-Ākhir, sanat 1304, arbaʻah wa-thalāthmiʼah wa-alf, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-salām. Wa-kāna dhālika ʻalá yad kātibihi wa-nāqilihi al-faqīr ilá al-Karīm al-Wahhāb, ʻabduhu Ḥassānayn Khaṭṭāb al-Nujaylī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. M."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God and His help. The copying of this book was completed on blessed Friday, 2 Jumād al-Ākhir, 1304 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him. Copied and transcribed by the hand of the poor to the Generous and Abundant Giving One, His servant, Ḥassānayn Khaṭṭāb al-Nujaylī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Amen. M."

record.title: 880-03 Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī.
record.note: Title of "Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq" from folio 1b.
Title of "al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah" from incipit (folio 23b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥamda al-shākirīn, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, shahādat al-mukhliṣīn. wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabdahu wa-rasūlah, sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākharīn, ṣalāt Allāh wa-salāmuhu ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn. Wa-raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻan al-ṣaḥābah wa-al-tābiʻīn wa-tābiʻīhim ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi, Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī, al-muʼaqqit al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn: Laysa fī ḥisāb al-aʻmāl al-falakīyah aḥsan min ṭarīq ḥisāb al-nisbah al-sittīnīyah, wa-hiya al-mustaʻmalah fī ʻaṣrinā hādhā, wa-tarakū ṭarīq al-aqdamīn li-ṣuʻūbatihi wa-kathrat aʻmālihi. Wa-lam aqif ʻalá muqaddimah shāfiyah fī hādhā al-fann ghayra muqaddimat Shaykhinā al-ʻAllāmah Shihāb [al-Dīn] Aḥmad ibn al-Majdī, raḥimahu Allāh, al-musammāt [al-musammāh] bi-Kashf al-ḥaqāʼiq. Wa-lā aʻrif fī hādhā al-fann [muqaddimah] qablahā, wa-innamā yūjadu kalām ghayr shāfin fī maqāṣid hādhā al-ʻilm, lākinnahu, raḥimahu Allāh, aṭāla fīhā al-ishārah ilá ṭarīq al-aqdamīn, min al-futūḥ wa-al-ghubār, wa-ishbāʻ al-qawl fī ṭarīq al-nisbah, maʻa irādat al-ikhtiṣār ..."
Secundo folio of "Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq": Allāh taʻālá bi-Nabīyihi al-karīm.

Incipit of "al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn, Muḥammad Khātim al-Nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-innī wāḍiʻun fī hādhihi al-maqāmah ʻamal al-basīṭah al-musammāt [al-musammāh] bi-al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah, li-yasʹhula ḥalluhā fī al-jāmiʻ wa-al-madrasah, wa-lā tatawaqqafu ʻalá ḥisāb wa-lā taṣaffuḥ kitāb, rājiyan min Allāh ḥusna al-thawāb, innahu karīmun wahhāb. Li-takun al-rukhāmah min jism ṣulb mustawin, wa-yanbaghī an yakūna ʻirḍuhā thuluthay ṭūlihā, li-yaḥsuna shakluhā fī al-manẓar, thumma turabbiʻu al-saṭḥ wa-taqsimahu bi-niṣfayn bi-khaṭṭ A B, fa-huwa khaṭṭ niṣf al-nahār ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah": qāʼiman ʻalá al-basīṭah.
14.5 x 20.3 cm; written surface: 8 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown buckram.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; some mathematical diagrams; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj [wa-]al-daqāʼiq, lil-Sibṭ."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhā Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq ..."
On folio 25a: A mathematical table, in 13 x 13 squares.
On folio 25b: Miscellaneous mathematical calculations.

Colophon of Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq (folio 23a): "Qad kamula lanā min faḍl Allāh taʻālá mā aradnā waḍʻahu fī hādhihi 'al-Muqaddimah', wa-qad taʼassasat qawāʻiduhā, wa-waḍuḥat mushkilātuhā, wa-tahadhdhabat abwābuhā, wa-infataḥat ṭuruqātuhā, wa-taḥarrarat amthāluhā. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá jamīʻ al-niʻam, thumma al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Sayyid al-ʻArab wa-al-ʻAjam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-ʻazm wa-al-himam. Ghafara Allāh li-kātibihā, wa-li-qārīhā, wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn."

Translation of the colophon of Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq: "Completed, by the favor of God Almighty, is what we intended to present in this 'Introduction', having laid down its foundations, elucidated its problems, revised its chapters, cleared its roads and clarified its examples. Praise be to God for all the blessings. May prayer and peace upon our Master Muḥammad, the Master of the Arabs and Non-Arabs, and on his family and companions, of zeal and valor. May God forgive its author, its reader and all Muslims."

"al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah" ends with: "... wa-mā dhakartuhu aqrab al-ṭuruq. Thumma thabbit al-rukhāmah bi-al-bināʼ bi-al-jiṣṣ wa-naḥwihi. Wa-imtiḥān aʻmālihā bi-istikhrāj al-ʻamal min al-ālāt; fa-in ṭābaqat fa-ḍaʻ [fa-waḍʻ] al-rukhāmah ṣaḥīḥ, wa-kadhālika rasmuhā, wa-in khālafat tuftaqad aʻmāluhā al-sābiqah, li-iḥtimāl al-sahw wa-al-ghalaṭ."
Colophon of "al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah": "Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. M."

Translation of the colophon of "al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah": "God Almighty is more knowledgeable of what is correct; to Him is the reference and returning. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on Him, who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad]. M."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Īsāghūjī : manuscript / Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Bitlīsī.
record.note: Title of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Tiblīsī from folio 1a.
Title of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by an anonymous author supplied by cataloger.
Title of Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Abīwardī from folio 107a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Tiblīsī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Naḥmaduka yā man yusʻidunā bi-al-hidāyah ilá al-ṣidq, wa-nashkuruka yā man yaʻḍudunā bi-al-iʻānah ʻalá al-nuṭq, wa-nuṣallī ʻalá Muḥammad al-muʼayyad bi-al-muʻjizāt al-sāṭiʻah, wa-ʻalá ālihi alladhīn fāzū bi-al-ḥujaj wa-al-barāhīn al-qāṭiʻah. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad iltamasa minnī baʻḍun min aṣḥābī wa-khullaṣ ikhwānī an ashraḥa lahum al-risālah al-mashhūrah bi-Īsāghūjī, al-mansūbah ilá al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil, qudwat al-ḥukamāʼ, Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī, nawwara Allāh maḍjiʻahu, sharḥan yakshifu ʻan mushkilātihā wa-yashtamilu ʻalá muʻḍilātihā, ḥāwiyan bi-akthar al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah, mubayyinan lil-aqānīm al-abīyah, ẓannan minhum anna ʻindī baʻḍ dhālik, wa-in kuntu mā kuntu hunālik, fa-sharaʻtu fīmā yuṭābiqu iltimāsahum wa-yuwāfiqu iqtibāsahum, maʻa qillat al-biḍāʻah wa-kathrat al-ṣināʻah ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Tiblīsī: al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil qudwat al-ḥukamāʼ.

Incipit of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by an anonymous author (folio 80b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn. Fa-hādhihi risālah fī al-manṭiq. al-Manṭiq ʻilm yuʻrafu [bi-hi] tamyīz al-sālim min al-fikr min fāsidihi. Wa-al-muṣannif awrada fī risālatihi ʻiddat iṣṭilāḥāt minhu tajibu [yajibu] istiḥḍāruhā li-man sharaʻa fī al-shayʼ min al-ʻulūm, li-yakūna ʻawnan la-hu fī al-taḥṣīl, minhā 'Īsāghūjī', wa-al-murād bi-hi al-kullīyāt al-khams. Wa-al-Īsāghūjī ism li-ḥakīm min ḥukamāʼ al-Yūnān yunsabu ilayhi al-kullīyāt al-khams, li-mahāratihi fīhā, wa-ʻalá al-nawʻ, wa-al-jins, wa-al-faṣl, wa-al-khāṣṣah, wa-al-ʻarḍ al-ʻāmm. Wa-hādhihi hiya al-maqṣūdah bi-al-naẓar ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by an anonymous author: wa-illā fa-ʻaqlīyah ka-dalālat al-lafẓ.

Incipit of Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Abīwardī (folio 107b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anṭaqa alsinat al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān bi-asrār al-balāghah fī asālīb naẓm al-Qurʼān, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad alladhī dallat dalāʼil al-iʻjāz ʻalá annahu unzila ʻalayhi al-sabʻ al-mathānī fī nihāyat al-injāz, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, khayr ṣaḥb wa-khayr āl, mā ṭābaqat al-tarākīb li-muqtaḍayāt al-aḥwāl. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah namnamtu washyahā wa-sabaktu ḥalyahā lil-wuqūf ʻalá ashraf al-ʻulūm al-adabīyah wa-al-iṭṭilāʻ ʻalá dhakhāʼir asrār al-ʻArabīyah, aʻmaltu al-qarīḥah fī taḥrīrihā, wa-atʻabtu al-salīqah fī taḥbīrihā ..."
Secundo folio of Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Abīwardī: dhakhāʼir asrār al-ʻArabīyah.
13 x 20.4 cm; written surface: 7 x 12.5 cm; 11-19 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.

In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some commentaries on the margins and interlinear; text within double red frame, surrounded by a larger red frame; catchwords.
On the back of the preliminary leaf: An illegible statement by an owner/reader bears the date 1229 (of the Hijrah = 1813/1814).
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ Īsāghūjī, taʼlīf al-Shaykh Khayr al-Dīn, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. M."

On folio 107a: "Kitāb Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-ʻallāmah, murabbī al-sālikīn, shaykh shuyūkh al-ʻārifīn, aʻāda Allāh ʻalaynā min barakātih, wa-nafaʻanā bi-ṣāliḥ daʻawātih al-Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Khaṭībī al-Anbawardī [al-Abīwardī], ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu wa-khatama la-hu bi-al-khayr."
On folios149a-149b: Miscellaneous quotations by the hand of the copyist of the codex (Aḥmad Karāmah), on the different times of prayer.
Folios 150-151 are blank.

Colophon of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Tiblīsī: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Dakhala fī silk al-taḥrīr kitābatan nahār al-Aḥad, thāmin ʻashar yawm khalat min shahr Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, min shuhūr sanat 1080. M."

Translation of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Tiblīsī: "Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May prayer be on His Messenger Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. Edited and copied on Sunday, the eighteenth of noble Ramaḍān, of the year 1080 [of the Hijrah = 9 February, 1670]. M."
Colophon of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by an anonymous author: "Hādhā ākhir mā awradnāhu fī sharḥ hādhā al-kitāb. Tmm."
Translation of the colophon of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by an anonymous author: "This is the end of what we introduced of the commentary on this book. It is completed."

Colophon of Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Abīwardī: "Tamma bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb mukhtaṣar 'Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān', ʻafā Allāh ʻan hafawāt al-banān wa-ʻatharāt al-lisān. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭāhirīn wa-ṣaḥbihi al-muntakhabīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Katabahu Aḥmad Karāmah, ghafara Allāh li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. 2 khalat min Dhī al-Ḥijjah min shuhūr sanat 1080."

Translation of the colophon of Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Abīwardī: "It is completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King the compendium of 'Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān'. May God forgive the mistakes of the fingers and the shortcomings of the tongue. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his righteous family and his chosen companions. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Copied by Aḥmad Karāmah, may God forgive him who invokes Him on his behalf. Amen. [Dated], 2 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1080 [of the Hijrah = 23 April, 1670]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Muṭṭalaʻ : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, shaykh al-ṭarīqah wa-maʻdin al-ḥaqīqah, waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, ḥujjat al-munāẓirīn, murabbī al-sālikīn, qudwat al-ʻārifīn, baqīyat al-mujtahidīn, qāmiʻ al-mubtadiʻīn, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi. Āmīn ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ laṭīf li-kitāb al-ʻAllāmah Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, al-musammá bi-Īsāghūjī fī ʻilm al-manṭiq, yaḥullu alfāẓah wa-yubayyinu murādah, wa-yaftaḥu mughlaqah, wa-yuqayyidu muṭlaqah, ʻalá wajh laṭīf wa-manhaj munīf. Wa-sammaytuhu "al-Muṭṭalaʻ". Wa-Allāh asʼal an yanfaʻa bi-hi, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
Secundo folio: laṭīf wa-manhaj munīf.
15 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding; cover embossed with central medallion.
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Īsāghūji" of al-Abharī in red; some corrections on the margins; headings in bold script; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Īsāghūjī li-Shaykh al-Imām Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakātihi wa-barakāt ʻulūmihi, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥābatih. Āmīn."

Author's colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Qāla, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Tamma al-sharḥ bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi, fī khāmis ʻashar Ramaḍān, sanat khams [probably khamsīn] wa-thamānimiʼah. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf khalqih, Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih <wa-sallam>, kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. He [the author], may God have mercy upon him, said: The commentary was completed by the praise of God Almighty and His help, on 15 Ramaḍān, 805 [probably 850 of the Hijrah = 13 December, 1446]. May prayer and peace be upon the most noble of God's creation, our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions, as long as he is remembered by those who remember him and as long as he is forgotten to be remembered by those who forget to remember him."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ʻiyādh billāh min kull sūʼ, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It is finished by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, thoroughly and completely. May refuge be in God from all evil. He suffices me. He is the best advocate. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 al-Muṭṭalaʻ : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla Shaykhunā al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, shaykh al-ṭarīqah wa-maʻdin al-ḥaqīqah, waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, ḥujjat al-munāẓirīn, walī al-sālikīn, qudwat al-ʻārifīn, baqīyat al-mujtahidīn, qāmiʻ al-mubtadiʻīn, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, dhū al-funūn wa-al-taṣānīf al-ḥamīdah wa-al-fatāwá al-mufīdah, Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥābatih. Āmīn. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ laṭīf li-kitāb al-ʻAllāmah Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī, raḥimahu Allāh, al-musammá bi-Īsāghūjī fī ʻilm al-manṭiq, yaḥullu alfāẓah wa-yubayyinu murādah, wa-yaftaḥu mughlaqah, wa-yuqayyidu muṭlaqah, ʻalá wajh laṭīf wa-manhaj munīf. Wa-sammaytuhu "al-Muṭṭalaʻ". Wa-Allāh asʼalu an yanfaʻa bi-hi, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalá wajh laṭīf wa-manhaj munīf.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 14 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; red leather on spine and flap (in three unnumbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Īsāghūji" of al-Abharī in red; many notes and corrections on the margins of the first fifteen leaves; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Īsāghūjī li-Shaykh al-Islām, al-Qāḍī Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ilayhi taʻālá Muḥammad Sharīf Salīm. Sanat 1299 [of the Hijrah = 1881/1882]."
On folio 32b, in a different hand, three veses of poetry attributed to al-Imām al-Ghazzālī praising solitude and condemming his time in which true friendship no more exists.
Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassara Allāh taʻālá ʻalá hādhā al-kitāb. Wa-Allāh yajʻaluhu khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This is the end of what God Almighty fascilitated of [the commentary] on this book. May God, may He be praised, render it worthy of His gracious face. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 Kitāb al-Bustān : manuscript / Naṣr ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Layth al-Samarqandī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī, wa-Huwa ḥasbī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad Khātim al-Nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-ʻibādihi al-ṣāliḥīn, min ahl al-samāwāt wa-al-araḍīn. Qāla al-Faqīh Abū al-Layth Naṣr ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: Innī qad jamaʻtu fī kitābī hādhā funūnan min al-ʻilm mā lā yasaʻu jahluhu wa-al-takhalluf ʻanhu lil-khāṣṣ wa-al-ʻāmm, wa-istakhrajtu dhālika min kutub kathīrah, wa-sammaytuhu 'Kitāb al-Bustān', fa-awradtu fīhi mā huwa al-awḍaḥ lil-nāẓir fīhi wa-al-rāghib ilayhi, wa-bayyantu al-ḥujaj fīmā yuḥtāju fīhi ilá al-ḥujjah bi-al-Kitāb wa-al-akhbār wa-al-naẓar wa-al-āthār, wa-taraktu al-ghawāmiḍ min al-kalām, wa-ḥadhaftu asānīd al-Aḥādīth takhfīfan lil-rāghibīn fīhi wa-iltimāsan li-manfaʻat al-nās, wa-arjū Allāh taʻālá bi-hi al-thawāb, wa-asʼaluhu al-tawfīq lil-ṣawāb ..."
Secundo folio: qāla ʻalaykum bi-al-ʻilm qabla an yuqbaḍ.
17.5 x 13 cm; written surface: 10 x 13.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In light blue cardboard binding; flap torn off; dark brown leather on spine; lower edges of the leaves burnt without loss of text.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.

On the preliminary leaf 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Dakhala hādhā al-kitāb fī mulk al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-Ḥājj Yūsuf ibn Asʻad al-Bishtāwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn." Khatm al-Ḥājj Yūsuf ibn Asʻad al-Bishtāwī. 2. "Intaqala wa-dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr li-Rabbihi Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥājj Maḥmūd al-Badawī bi-Nāblus, fī ghurrat Rabīʻ Anwar, sanat 1315 [31 July, 1897]." 3. "Wa-intaqala wa-dakhala fī mulk al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-karīm, ʻazza shaʼnuhu, Muḥammad Shawqī ibn al-marḥūm Muṣṭafá ibn al-Sayyid Asʻad al-Shinnāwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn."
On the preliminary leaves 1b-3a: A table of contents.
At the head of the preliminary leaf 1b: "Fahrasat Bustān al-ʻārifīn wa-nuzʹhat al-nāẓirīn."

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Bustān al-ʻārifīn wa-nuzʹhat al-nāẓirīn, taʼlīf al-Faqīh al-zāhid Abī al-Layth Naṣr ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Samarqandī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Najaz al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnih, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr ilá al-Mawlá al-Jalīl, al-Ḥājj Yūsuf ibn Asʻad ibn Yūsuf ibn al-Ḥājj Ṣāliḥ al-Bishtāwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-wālid wālidayhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad Sayyidī [Sayyid] al-Sādāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, wa-tābiʻ al-tābiʻīn, ruḍwān Allāh wa-salāmuhu ʻalayhim ajmaʻīn ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn." Khatm al-Ḥājj Yūsuf Asʻad al-Bishtāwī.

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the praise of God Almighty and His help, by the hand of the poor and despised, who confesses his iniquity and insufficiency to the Exalted Lord, al-Ḥājj Yūsuf ibn Asʻad ibn Yūsuf ibn al-Ḥājj Ṣāliḥ al-Bishtāwī, may God forgive him, his parents and the parents of his parents, and all Muslim men and women, and the believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad the Lord of Lords, and on his family and companions, and the followers of his followers, may God be pleased with all of them and grant them peace, until Judgement Day. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe." Seal of al-Ḥājj Yūsuf Asʻad al-Bishtāwī.

record.title: 880-02 al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Mārdīnī.
record.note: Title of "al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah" from incipit (folio 1b).
Title of "Muqaddimah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah" from folio 10b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aḥṣá kull al-ashyāʼ ʻadadan, wa-jaʻala al-mawāl li-man aʻṭá wa-ittaqá wa-ṣaddaqa bi-al-ḥusná saʻādatan sarmadā, wa-ʻalá man bakhula wa-istaghná wa-kadhdhaba bi-al-ḥusná kuʻūb shuʼm tūqiʻu fī al-radā [al-radá], aḥmaduhu wa-ashkuruhu an jaʻalanā ummatan wasaṭan, li-takūna ʻalá al-nās shuhadāʼ, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, ʻālim al-ghayb, fa-lā yuẓhiru ʻalá ghaybihi aḥadan ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu faqīr raḥmat rabbihi, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī: Hādhā taʻlīq ʻalá al-urjūzah al-Yāsamīnīyah fī ʻilm al-jabr, mukhtaṣar jiddan, lam yasʼalnī fīhi aḥad, wa-innamā walaghtu fīhi min al-baṭālah wa-al-kasal, hurūban min al-ishtighāl wa-al-malal, fa-jāʼa bi-ḥamd Allāh nukhbah rāʼiqah, wa-tuḥfah fāʼiqah, wa-laqqabtuhu bi-'al-Lumaʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah' ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah": jinsuhumā fa-yatanāwalu al-jadhr al-wāḥid.

Incipit of "Muqaddimah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah. al-Jabr al-ziyādah fī kull nāqiṣ ḥattá lā yanquṣ, wa-al-muqābalah ṭarḥ kull nawʻ min naẓīrihi ḥattá lā yakūna fī al-jihah nawʻān mutaḥābbān mutajānisān, wa-al-muʻādalah an tajbura al-nāqiṣ bi-al-zāʼid, wa-taṭraḥ al-zāʼid min al-zāʼid, wa-kadhā al-nāqiṣ min al-nāqiṣ, wa-ghāyatuhu istikhrāj al-majhūlāt, wa-mawḍūʻuhu al-māl wa-al-shayʼ wa-al-ʻadad, min ḥaythu al-basāṭah wa-al-tarkīb ..."
Secundo folio of "Muqaddimah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah": No secundo folio.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; the verses of "al-Yāsamīnīyah" are preceded written in red; some markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsimīnīyah, lil-ʻAllāmah Sibṭ al-Māridīnī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān wa-askanahu aʻlá farādīs al-jinān, wa-nafaʻa bi-hi al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá́ Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

al-Yāsamīnīyah of Ibn al-Yāsamīn starts with: ʻAlá thalāthatin yadūru al-jabr // al-mālu wa-al-aʻdād thumma al-jadhru. It ends with: Thumma ṣalātu Allāhi wa-al-salāmu // ʻalá al-Nabīyi mā injalā al-ẓalām.

On folio 10b: "Wa-hādhihi Muqaddimah, ayḍan, fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah, manqūlah min 'Khulāṣat al-qawāʻid wa-ghāyat al-maqāṣid', lil-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr ala-fahhāmah, Abī ʻAbd Allāh ibn Jamāʻah al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḍiya ʻanhu, wa-nafaʻa bi-hi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon of "al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah": "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā awradnā [aradnā] īrādahu min hādhā al-taʻlīq ʻalá hādhihi 'al-urjūzah'. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah": "This is the end of what we wanted to introduce of the commentary on this 'urjūzah'. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on Him who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad] and grant Him peace. Amen. Amen. Amen."

Colophon of "Muqaddimah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah": "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Intahá min 'Khulāṣat al-qawāʻid wa-ghāyat al-maqāṣid' li-Ibn Jamāʻah, yawm al-Thalāt al-mubārak, thālith ʻashar shahr Rabīʻī [Rabīʻ] al-Awwal, sanat alf wa-miʼah thamāniyah wa-thamānīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá muhājirihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad afqar al-wará wa-aḥwajihim ilayhi subḥānah wa-taʻālá, Yūsuf Ruḍwān al-Jundī al-Būshī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Muqaddimah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah": "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. It is completed, extracted from 'Kulāṣat al-qawāʻid wa-ghāyat al-maqāṣid' of Ibn Jamāʻah, on blessed Tuesday, 13 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1188 [24 May, 1774] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the poorest of mankind and the most needy to Him, may He be praised and glorified, Yūsuf Ruḍwān al-Jundī al-Būshī, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters and all Muslims. May God pray on Him who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad]. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Mūsá al-Damīrī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "[Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm]. Bāb al-Hamzah. al-Asad min al-sibāʻ maʻrūf, wa-jamʻuhu usūd, wa-usd, wa-āsud, wa-āsād, wa-al-unthá asadah. Wa-innamā ibtadaʼnā bi-hi li-annahu ashraf al-ḥayawān al-mutawaḥḥish, idh manzilatuhu manzilat al-malik al-muhāb, li-qūwatihi wa-shajāʻatihi wa-qasāwatihi wa-mahābatihi wa-sharāsat khuluqihi, wa-li-dhālika yuḍrabu bi-hi al-mathal fī al-shajāʻah wa-al-basālah wa-fī shiddat al-iqdām wa-al-ṣawlah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-fī al-inʻāẓ bi-ghayr al-jamāʻ.
14 x 19 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 17 cm; 24-25 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In clear ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a: "Kitāb Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān, li-ʻallāmat al-zamān wa-farīd al-awān al-Shaykh Shams al-Dīn, Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad al-Damīrī, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh."
On folio 1a: A sample letter, starts with: "al-Mawlá al-mushīr al-mubajjal, wa-al-ʻālim al-kabīr al-mufaḍḍal, al-Afandī fulān, al-ḥākim al-ʻadl, bi-maḥrūsat fulānah, ḥurisa wa-dām. Āmīn ..."

Colophon: "Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-kafá. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan aṣḥāb Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, ʻāshir shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, sanat tisʻ wa-sittīn wa-tisʻimiʼah min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá musharrifihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm, ʻalá yad muʻalliqihi li-nafsihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-zalal wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-maḥmūd, Maḥmūd ibn Mawlānā Khalīl ibn Mawlānā al-Ḥājj Muḥammad al-Aydīnī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-ikhwānihi wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-in tajid ʻayban fa-sudda al-khalalā // fa-jalla man lā ʻayba fīhi wa-ʻalā."

Translation of the colophon: "God suffices us and that is enough. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace. May God be pleased with all the companions of the Messenger of God. The copy of this blessed book was completed on blessed Saturday, 10 Muḥarram, 969 [30 September, 1561] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the hand of the poor and despised servant, who admits his shortcoming and inadequacy, and hopes for the forgiveness of His praiseworthy Lord, Maḥmūd ibn Mawlānā Khalīl ibn Mawlānā al-Ḥājj Muḥammad al-Aydīnī, may God forgive him, his parents, his brethren and Muslim men and Muslim women, and the believers, men and women. Amen. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. If you were to find a blemish close the gap // Mighty and Sublime is the One in whom no blemish exists."

record.title: 880-02 al-Asrār al-Rabbānīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Būnī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a and the colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
